subject: [Last Chance to Register] Maximize Workplace Collaboration with Zoom
body:
Discover how to make the most of Zoom's features to improve communications in your company.
 
 
 
 
Webinar
Maximize Workplace Collaboration with Zoom
  
Wednesday, August 16
10:00 a.m. PT | 1:00 p.m. ET
Register now
 
 
Zoom has emerged as the go-to platform for virtual collaboration, providing businesses and teams with the ability to work together seamlessly from any location.
Our Zoom expert will share their insights and tips on how to make the most of Zoom's features to improve communication, increase productivity, and enhance teamwork.
Here's what you can expect to learn from this webinar:
Strategies for using Zoom to foster collaboration among hybrid & remote teams
Best practices for organizing and managing group projects using Zoom
Techniques for using Zoom's chat and file sharing features to streamline communication.
  
Register now
  
Can't make it? 
Register anyway
 and we'll email you the recording!
 
Catch us on social
 
 
 
 
 
Visit 
zoom.us
1-888-799-9666
55 Almaden Blvd., San Jose, CA 95113

one person liked your LinkedIn post.
 
In our latest podcast, Paul Ladipo explained how the phrase “I don’t see color” can be used as a Get Out of Jail Free card to avoid having brave conversations about race. While the phrase is often viewed as “politically correct,” it allows the individual to remain ignorant of the oppression faced by people of color. “You can say that all you want to. It doesn't change who I am,” he said. “To be ‘colorblind’ is neglecting people and their heritage and their needs.” 💡 ⏯️ Check out the full recording and transcript on our website: https://hubs.ly/Q01-8s_30 #Podcast #DEI #Culture #ThoughtLeadership #Inclusion 
View
one person liked your LinkedIn post.
 
Since 1994, August 9 has marked the International Day of the World’s Indigenous Peoples. We cannot truly stand with Indigenous Peoples without also acknowledging the struggles brought on by centuries of discrimination. According to the United Nations: ➡️ While Indigenous People make up less than 5% of the world’s population, they represent 15% of the poorest. ➡️ Indigenous People are 3x as likely as non-Indigenous people to live in extreme poverty. Today and throughout the year, inclusive leaders must listen to and uplift the incredibly diverse lived experiences of Indigenous People on our journey toward equity, reconciliation, and authentic allyship. #DEI #Inclusion #Culture 
View
one person liked your LinkedIn post.
 
💜 Since 2014, August 7th has been observed as Purple Heart Day in the United States—a day to remember and honor the brave Americans who were either wounded on the battlefield or paid the ultimate sacrifice with their lives. 💜 Today, Veterans make up 6.4% of the United States’ adult population at approximately 16.5 million people, and 30% are living with a disability. 💜 Our Veteran population exemplifies diversity, having sacrificed and served our country regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, religion, economic status, and the many other aspects of identity. 💜 It is crucial that inclusive leaders take the time to understand their lived experiences and continue to support Veterans on our journey toward building truly equitable mindsets and systems. #PurpleHeartDay #DEI #Culture 
View

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 August 13, 2023
body:
Review the latest resources from Training Industry.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
Our team is gearing up to end the year strong, bringing you more great content, events and resources to help you spark new ideas and connect with other learning leaders. Here’s a peek at what we have in store:
[Webinar] The Reality of Virtual Reality for L&D: Hosted by Training Industry
[Virtual Conference] Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)
[New Course] Harnessing the Power of Competency Modeling
Training Industry’s 2024 Trends Report
We will also be addressing relevant topics on our website, including skills mapping, digital fluency in the workplace, learning technologies and how to make learning stick. If you’re interested in writing, you can 
learn more here
.
I hope you find the resources in this email helpful as you embark on a new week. We love hearing from you, so email us with your thoughts at 
editor@trainingindustry.com
 with any article pitches, suggestions or questions. We hope you have a great week!
Michelle Eggleston Schwartz, CPTM
Editor in Chief 
[Article] L&D Leaders: 4 Ways to Share Your Thought Leadership With Training Industry
Are you a thought leader in the L&D industry with ideas and tips to share with your peers? If so, check out this 
LinkedIn article
 by Training Industry’s senior editor, Sarah Gallo, CPTM, to learn more about ways to share your thought leadership with Training Industry’s global audience of L&D leaders. Because the L&D community is better, together.
Read the Article
 
Identify Your Training Teams' Strengths and Weaknesses
Training Industry research has identified seven core responsibilities and associated competencies that make up our 
Training Manager Competency Model™
. Based on this model, our Training Team Assessment gives you a holistic picture of your teams’ strengths and weaknesses, allowing you to create a targeted plan for their professional development. Use our 
free assessment tool
 to benchmark your training teams' competencies and create a targeted team development plan today.
Learn More
 
[State of the Industry Report] The Sales Training Market
Staying up to date on the latest research and trends is time-consuming but essential. Luckily, we’ve done the research and gathered the insights for you in our new report, “
The State of the Sales Training Market
.” In this report, you’ll find all the information you need to gain a competitive edge and stay ahead in the sales market. With data on trends, modalities, market projections, sourcing practices and more, our newly released report has the answers you need to stay on top of the sales training market.
Get the Report
 
Training Industry’s New Vendor Directory
With thousands of training vendors across the L&D landscape, choosing the right partner can be a daunting task. Save time by starting your search with the 
Training Industry Vendor Directory
. Our comprehensive directory showcases a diverse range of vendors, categorized in 78 specialties, all dedicated to providing innovative products and services to meet your training needs.
Check it Out
 
STRATEGY, ALIGNMENT AND PLANNING 
Reaching the "Digital Natives:" Effective Training Delivery for Gen Z

Read Now →

subject: Docebo Partners With Google Cloud, Litmos Enhances Learning Suite and Other L&D News ...
body:
Business News This Week
View this email in your browser
August 12, 2023
Industry News from 
Training Industry
Sign up to receive this newsletter each week
 
 
Docebo Partners With Google Cloud on Generative AI
TORONTO — Aug. 10, 2023
Docebo Inc. (NASDAQ: DCBO; TSX: DCBO), a leading provider of learning platforms with a foundation in artificial intelligence (AI) and innovation, has announced it is partnering with Google Cloud to enhance Docebo’s ability to train enterprise workforces, customers, and related external communities with generative AI technologies.
Read More
 
Litmos Announces Enhancements to its Leading Learning Suite to Meet Growing Needs of Corporate L&D and Training Across the Extended Enterprise
SAN RAMON, Ca. — Aug. 8, 2023
Litmos, a leading global learning solutions provider to the world’s top companies, today unveiled significant investment in its offerings to address the evolving training and development requirements. With innovations across their entire solution suite – including LMS platform, content and services – Litmos customers will gain tailored experiences supported by expert assistance to optimize and enrich their learning initiatives.
Read More
​​​​​​
SALES
RAIN Group Launches Self-Study+ for Sales Teams 
BOSTON — Aug. 9, 2023 
  
RAIN Group, a global sales training company delivering results through in-person and virtual sales training, coaching, and reinforcement, announced today the launch of Self-Study+, an approach combining the advantages of self-paced learning with the power of practice, feedback, and collaboration.
Read More →
LEARNING TECHNOLOGIES
LMS365 Acquires Weekly10 
WREXHAM, UK — Aug. 10, 2023
  
LMS365, an AI-powered learning platform integrated with Microsoft 365 has announced the acquisition of Weekly10, a dynamic performance and engagement management company based in Wrexham, UK.
Read More →
PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT
Open LMS Expands Into Professional Certification Market 
RALEIGH, N.C. — Aug. 10, 2023
  
Open LMS, a leading global provider of open-source learning management systems (LMSs), today announced its expansion to enhance professional certification programs.
Read More →
LEARNING TECHNOLOGIES
Uplimit (Formerly CoRise) Opens Their AI Education Platform to Enterprises 
SAN FRANCISCO — Aug. 8, 2023
  
Uplimit (formerly CoRise), the AI-powered online learning platform, is excited to announce that it is building on its success achieving industry-leading learning outcomes at scale––both for individual learners and enterprise clients including high-growth start-ups through the Fortune 500––and will open its platform to a select group of beta enterprise clients to run their own courses.
Read More →
COMPLIANCE
ThriveDX Launches Cybersecurity Apprenticeship Program to Reskill Cybersecurity Talent and Enhance Workplace Diversity 
MIAMI — Aug. 10, 2023
  
ThriveDX, the global leader in cybersecurity and digital skills training, continues its mission to reskill and upskill the global cybersecurity workforce with the launch of a Cybersecurity Apprenticeship Program that will create job opportunities for diverse cyber talent at no-training cost.
Read More →
ONBOARDING
VirgilHR Introduces Chat-Based Employee Classification Tool for 50-State Compliance 
GAITHERSBURG, Md. — Aug. 8, 2023
  
VirgilHR, the technology company removing risk from HR compliance, announced the release of a chat-based tool for employee onboarding that allows organizations to properly classify employees as exempt or non-exempt during onboarding.
Read More →

.”
         -James Donovan, Global Head of MarTech, SimilarWeb

subject: 🔒 Unlimited Access to Workshops, Employee Retention, & More!
body:
Actionable tools, industry trends, upcoming events, research, and more delivered to your inbox monthly.
 
 
 
 
Join the waitlist
 
As You Wish!
 
We've been working tirelessly, fueled by your feedback and requests, to bring you the ultimate employee development experience you've been yearning for. ✨ Today, we're thrilled to announce the 
new LifeLabs Learning Membership
 is just around the corner, and you're among the very first to know!
LifeLabs Learning Membership is ready to work its magic on your organization, and we can't wait to have you on board. 
Join our waitlist
 and be among the first to experience the transformative features of Membership, including:
 
🪄 Group practice and coaching opportunities 
thoughtfully designed to deepen learners’ skills through live, interactive experiences.
 
🪄 Simplified scheduling 
with unlimited access to daily virtual workshops, facilitated by live experts and suitable for learners of all levels.
 
🪄 Budget-friendly plans 
starting at $500 per year, per person, with no setup fee!
 
🪄 Streamlined program management
 with a dedicated platform to track learners and program results all in one place.
 
The excitement is real, and we're excited for you to experience the LifeLabs Learning Membership!
 
We all know the problem: employees crave growth. Managers want their direct reports to grow. Companies are in urgent need of skilled, inspired employees. Yet somehow it's still difficult to catalyze the career growth everyone wants. Last month in Culture Club, we shared tools, frameworks, and experiments to immediately use at your company to deepen your career growth culture and systems. 
 
Watch a replay of our 
Career Growth
 mini-workshop, to learn:
How to define and message 'career growth' at your organization
A framework to help employees navigate their own development
Pro-tips to grow your own career in People Operations
 
Want to deepen your company's career growth culture and systems?
Talk with a LifeLabs Consultant
 
 
Lab 49,
 
the renowned software consultancy,
 
faced challenges in achieving their goals and retaining talent. With LifeLabs' 
Manager CORE Part 1
 training, they experienced remarkable results:
Halved attrition, retaining great people for happy clients.
Elevated managers' skills and boosted team cohesion.
Strengthened their culture with continuous improvement.
This partnership wasn't just about training. Helena Cantrell, Head of Global Talent Engagement, praised LifeLabs' personalized approach and support, making the learning journey a breeze.
 
Ready to be inspired? ✨Watch the video below!
 
Discover even more of our client testimonials and Learning & Development success stories by reading and watching below.
Show me
 
 
LLL x Mentera Wellness Workshop: Resiliency Skills
 
August 15, 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM ET
 
How do we help employees navigate uncertainty and adversity, especially if you are encountering it yourself? In this mini-workshop, we're teaming up with 
Mentera
 to share research, tips, and exercises to equip you and your managers to support people through challenging times.

August 22, 5:30 PM - 8:00 PM ET

(yes, in-person!) 
with other awesome HR and People Ops leaders in the Boston area. We’ll share research on what makes inclusive leaders different. ✅ You'll also leave with an inclusion assessment for your company, simple micro-inclusion habits you can apply immediately, and tips for gaining leadership buy-in.
LLL x Charter: Hybrid Readiness
 
August 23, 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM ET
 
Whether hybrid working is brand new or old news to your company, there is always more to learn. In the next 
Charter Skills Accelerator
, LifeLabs Learning will share research and instantly useful tools to help your teams go from surviving to thriving in a distributed landscape.

subject: HiBob’s August 2023 content roundup
body:
Building HR roadmaps, correct pronoun usage, and more
 
AUGUST 2023
PEOPLE-FUELED BUSINESS GROWTH
For people professionals navigating today's tight market, nothing is more important than proving HR's critical role as a revenue generator in the business. So, we're getting right down to business and talking about building future-ready organizations, stellar HR roadmaps, leveraging the Great Unretirement to close the skills gap, creating remarkably inclusive environments, and collaborating with your CFO to grow your business.
 
Build HR roadmaps for C-suite buy-in
Establishing HR as a revenue generator vs cost center is critical for any new CHRO. Use these five tips to gain C-suite buy-in and launch your HR strategy.
'
Stellar HR roadmaps
 
'
 
 
Promote correct pronoun usage
It's every organization's duty, with HR at the helm, to create inclusive environments for everyone, no matter how they identify or what pronouns they use.
'
Genuine inclusivity
 
'
 
 
Leverage the Great Unretirement
Baby Boomers retired en masse during COVID, inflating the skills gap and labor shortage. Here's how hiring ex-retirees can be the secret sauce of success.
'
Tapping into experience
 
'
 
 
The changing role of CFOs
Digital transformation and a fast-evolving work world have made the CFO/CPO relationship key to maintaining growth and stability in modern business.
'
People-focused business
 
'
 
 
How Bob helps Anyfin get future-ready
Anyfin's CPO wanted an easy-to-use, one-stop solution that proactively prepped the company for future growth. Bob delivered, plus so much more.
'
Prep for future growth
 
'
 
  
Resources your HR colleagues love
Prepare for the future of work: Incorporate AI into HR practices
CHROs’ top challenges and solutions for 2023
22 metrics for measuring workforce planning
  
 
Shelby is the Head of Content at HiBob. She's passionate about the written word and storytelling. In a past life, she was a music journalist. When she's not writing and editing you can find her baking sweet treats in the kitchen.

body:
Take control with the Getting Along Toolkit: Practical Techniques for Dealing with Difficult People at Work. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
BOOKS

HBR STORE
 
 
 
Take control of difficult situations at work
 
Work relationships can be hard. Dealing with difficult people can dampen creativity and productivity, degrade decision-making abilities, and cause us to disengage. Take control with the 
Getting Along Toolkit: Practical Techniques for Dealing with Difficult People at Work
. 
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
 
 
In the kit:
 
Ebook: 
Getting Along: How to Work with Anyone
This informative guide, written by workplace expert and HBR podcast host Amy Gallo, provides a practical, evidence-based approach to dealing with difficult people at work. 
 
 
 
 
The Assessment Tool
By answering a few simple questions, you’ll determine which of the 8 types of difficult colleagues you’re most likely dealing with. 
 
 
 
 
Support Tools
You also get additional tools to help you move forward with the recommendations: 
A Tactics Tracker
 so you can know which solutions are most effective.
A Decision Guide
 to help determine whether to escalate the problem.
The Last Resort Tool
 with other steps you may choose to take if all else fails.
 
 
 
 
6 Coaching Podcasts
In each 30-minute podcast, Amy Gallo coaches a professional on how to navigate a real-life situation with a challenging coworker. 
 
 
 
 
The Handbook
Get the most for your toolkit investment with step-by-step guidance on how to use each tool most effectively. 
 
 
This indispensable toolkit will help you navigate your toughest interactions and relationships at work—and build interpersonal resilience in the process. 
 
LEARN MORE
 
Discover more tools
Master essential business and leadership skills with downloadable tools you can use right away. Get instant access today.

subject: lcwweb's WP Engine July report
body:
lcwweb
monthly report. 
 
1.84
 billion
Threat events blocked 
WP Engine has blocked 1.84 billion threat events on our customers' sites in the past month--keeping our customers' sites up and secure. 
Global Edge Security 
4 
Sites secured
You now have 4 site(s) leveraging increased security and performance benefits through our advanced network. 
Advanced Network 
655,826
Plugins updated
WP Engine has auto-updated 655,826 plugins in the past month saving our customers time and ensuring their sites are protected. Use Smart Plugin Manager to automate your plugin updates.
Smart Plugin Manager 
143 
GB
Additional off-site storage 
Your automated backups have generated 143 GB that we are keeping for you offsite at no additional cost. 
Manage backups 
86 
Platform enhancements 
We delivered 86 platform enhancements and 178 security updates to ensure stability, security, and performance of the platform. 
Learn more 
1
Updated PHP
out of 3 sites are now on the latest and more performant version of PHP 8.0.
Manage sites 
Data pulled on July 31st, 2023.
 
 
Upcoming MySQL Version Upgrade and Live Webinar
Starting November 1, 2023, MySQL 5.7 will reach end-of-life (EOL) status and no longer receive updates or security patches. Therefore, MySQL 5.7 will be removed from the WP Engine platform by October 2023. WP Engine will be hosting a live webinar to give you the opportunity to learn more about testing MySQL 8.0 in Local. 
Register to join us on August 17th > 
 
PHP 8.0 End-of-Life and PHP 8.2 upgrades
PHP 8.0 will reach end-of-life (EOL) and no longer receive security support by the end of this year. Therefore, this version will no longer be available on the WP Engine platform by November 2023. WP Engine will perform automatic upgrades of all sites still on PHP 8.0 to PHP 8.2 before November and will communicate more specific dates in the coming weeks. 
There is no need to wait for your automatic upgrade – we encourage you to take advantage of PHP 8.2 now! Use our 
PHP Test Driver
 to preview your site on PHP 8.2 without impacting your live content. 
Learn more > 
 
PHP 7.4 Extended Security Support
WP Engine is pleased to announce that we will continue to invest in ongoing security support of PHP 7.4 through 2024, as WordPress and a wide range of themes and plugins are still not fully compatible with PHP 8.0+, which could lead to critical errors on some websites. 
Learn more > 
We would love your feedback to ensure we are delivering the most value to you in this email. Please fill out this 
short survey 
.

.

subject: Now Live: Zoom Customer Success Community Forum
body:
Hi Jacob, 
In case you missed it, we’re excited to announce the launch of the Customer Success Forum on the Zoom Community!  
What is the Zoom Community?  
The 
Zoom Community 
is a hub for users to find answers, seek support, and receive guidance from fellow Zoom users and Zoom product experts.  
What is the Customer Success Forum? 
Located within the Zoom Community, the Customer Success Forum is a collaborative place to share customer success stories, learn about upcoming events, and exchange use cases for helpful ways to use Zoom features. 
Zoom customers and experts alike are already on the Customer Success Forum exchanging knowledge and best practices, so sign in today to learn more and maximize Zoom’s many capabilities.

Casey Cott and Courtney Reed, Broadway’s Newest Bohemian and Sparkling Diamond
 
 
 
Hello, young lovers!

subject: [BOOK LAUNCH] Did you see our new book?
body:
The 
Visible Expert Revolution
 is available on Amazon now!
 
NEW BOOK
Hi Jacob,
In a marketplace hungry for information and authoritative advice, how can ordinary experts at a firm like yours become high-profile thought leaders, increasing your firm’s visibility and earning potential? And exactly what does it take for these individuals to rise above the noise and deliver the critical insights and advice your buyers crave?
These are central questions we answer in our new book 
The Visible Expert Revolution
—and I wanted to take a moment and tell you why I think this book is so important for today’s professional services firms. So I recorded a little video about it! 
  
Not another content marketing book…
Why is this book so important for today’s professional services leaders and marketers?
It’s no secret how important content marketing is for professional services marketing. Hinge’s own research into buyer behavior confirms the market’s appetite for high-credibility, high-value content. 
But how do you stand out when everyone is doing content marketing?
That’s where
 The Visible Expert Revolution 
comes in. Featuring the stories and advice of Visible Experts from a wide range of professional services, the book is a comprehensive yet accessible handbook to help your experts raise their profile, sharpen their expertise and command higher fees.
 
What Readers Are Saying
"Expertise is more important than ever. The Visible Expert Revolution shows you how to turn your expertise into a rewarding and impactful career."
—Jonah Berger, Wharton Professor, Bestselling Author of Magic Words, Contagious, Invisible Influence, and The Catalyst
"This book is a game-changer for professionals seeking to establish themselves as prominent thought leaders. Filled with insights and practical strategies, it empowers individuals to make an indelible impact in their field. A must-read for any expert who aspires to become a true industry leader."
—
Michael Brenner, B2B Marketing Expert, Author of The Content Formula and Mean People Suck, Founder of Marketing Insider Group 
  
Meet the Authors
 
Copyright © 2023, All rights reserved.
Hinge
1851 Alexander Bell Dr, Suite 350
Reston, VA 20191

subject: [Webinar] Enhancing Sponsor and Exhibitor Experiences in Webinars and Events
body:
You're invited! Register today for this info-packed webinar happening Thursday, August 24th at 1 PM EST.
 
 
 
Enhancing Sponsor and Exhibitor Experiences in Webinars and Events
 
For years, webinar hosts have used co-branded registration pages to promote session sponsors or partners to their audience. But with the rise of digital experiences shifting the event landscape, many webinar and event planners have sought out more innovative ways to engage their audiences with sponsored content.
 
Recent innovations in sponsor activation, experiences and advanced analytics in the virtual event and webinar space have made event sponsorship more advantageous to sponsors and exhibitors too. This win-win situation has led to more positive outcomes with sponsor relationships and higher ROI for all contributors.
 
Join us for a 
l
ive webinar
 on 
Thursday, August 24 at 1 PM EST
,
 w
here we'll explore the evolving webinar and event landscape for sponsors and exhibitors, and discuss the various ways event technology is accommodating these changes
. 
Specifically, we'll discuss:
How to create more engaging sponsor and exhibitor experiences
Ways to effectively incentivize your audience to encourage sponsor and exhibitor participation
Innovations in sponsor activation, lead scoring, and advanced analytics
Register Now

On July 26, 1990, the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) was signed into law, prohibiting discrimination against people with disabilities, and the first ever disability pride parade was held in Boston to celebrate. July 26 is now commemorated as #DisabilityIndependenceDay, and the month of July is recognized as #DisabilityPrideMonth. While disability rights have come a long way, there’s still progress to be made in achieving truly equitable systems. According to a 2022 report from the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics: ➡️ Across all age groups, people with disabilities are much less likely to be employed than people without disabilities. ➡️ The unemployment rate for people with disabilities is about twice as high as the rate for people without disabilities. ➡️ 30% of workers with disabilities are employed part-time as opposed to 16% of nondisabled workers, often because their hours were reduced or they couldn’t find an accessible full-time job. During July and throughout the year, we stand with the disabled community as we seek to foster equity in the communities where people live and at the organizations where they work. Only when all cultures are included can we ensure equitable outcomes and optimized performance in the workplace. #DEI #DiversityAndInclusion #Culture

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 August 6, 2023
body:
Virtual reality e-book, new infographic and more.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
As a learning leader, it's more important than ever to make sure your skills are up to date. To help you stay on top of your own professional development (and not just your learners'), we're featuring our 
Training Manager Competency Model™
, which describes the crucial competencies and responsibilities of successful training managers.
Also, since accurate measurement is one of the core responsibility areas of modern training managers, we're featuring 
this month's infographic
, which outlines three metrics to help you evaluate the effectiveness of your learning solutions.
As always, we love to hear from you: Write to us at 
editor@trainingindustry.com
 with any article pitches, suggestions or questions. We hope you have a great week!
Mike Allen, CPTM
Editor
[Infographic] Measuring Training Impact: 3 Metrics for Evaluating Success
Learning leaders often face pushback from business stakeholders when implementing new training initiatives. To gain support and be seen as a trusted partner, you have to speak the language of the business. Our 
latest infographic
 outlines three metrics that will help you evaluate the effectiveness of your learning solutions and prove the impact of training on both learners and the business.
Get the Infographic
 
[E-Book] How Virtual Reality Can Become a Reality for Your Organization
Advances in virtual reality (VR) technology and hardware have made VR a more accessible, affordable and effective option for training programs. Still, some organizations might be held back by a lack of information regarding the tech and anticipated hurdles that come with it. Our new e-book provides data-backed insights on VR’s relevance to L&D, common VR challenges organizations face and tips for overcoming these obstacles. 
Download a preview
 now to learn more.
Download a Preview
 
The 7 Competencies You Need as a Training Manager
Training Industry Courses has identified 
seven competencies
 critical to success, with the most important being the ability to strategically align training to business goals. Our catalog of courses is designed to provide development across all seven competencies, and our research shows that mastery of the competencies is associated with salaries up to $20,000 higher for training professionals. Access 
this guide
 to discover how you can develop the seven competencies you need as a training manager
Access the Guide
 
Leader Talk: Managing Learning Technologies in the Age of AI
Learning leaders are increasingly expected to double as technology experts as learning technologies continue to emerge and evolve at a rapid pace. When you factor in the additional element of AI within these tools, it can be very difficult to know what’s the best fit for your training needs. Join us for this complimentary 
Leader Talk
 
this
 
Thursday, Aug. 10
 to get tips from industry experts on how to leverage and manage AI tools to support your L&D efforts.
Reserve Your Spot

body:
Business News This Week
View this email in your browser
August 5, 2023
Industry News from 
Training Industry
Sign up to receive this newsletter each week
 
We are thrilled to bring you the latest news in the learning and development (L&D) space. Let's take a look at some of the notable collaborations, launches and acquisitions that are shaping the industry and empowering learners worldwide.
Here at Training Industry, we're excited to announce our Top 20 List of learning services providers. This list recognizes the organizations that have excelled in providing top-notch learning solutions, setting a benchmark for excellence in the training landscape.
Elsewhere in the L&D world, Udemy introduced a game-changing badging offering and integrated skills framework. With the new offering, Udemy aims to future-proof workforces and empower individuals to stay ahead in the ever-evolving digital era.
CompTIA unveiled the Xpert Series product family roadmap, with a focus on empowering professionals with relevant expertise and certifications. And Cheetah Learning introduced an innovative virtual leadership certification course to equip leaders with the skills and insights to excel in leading remote teams.
Looking for more insights? Follow us throughout the year for relevant news and announcements.
Jessi Schue
Market Research Analyst
Announcing the 2023 Training Industry Top Training Companies Lists: Learning Services
RALEIGH, N.C. — August 3, 2023
Training Industry today announced its selections for the 2023 Top Training Companies™ Lists for the Learning Services sector of the corporate learning and development (L&D) market. Training Industry, the leading research and information resource for corporate learning leaders, prepares the Training Industry Top 20 report on critical sectors of the corporate training marketplace to better inform professionals about the best and most innovative providers of training services and technologies.

SAN FRANCISCO — Aug. 1, 2023 
Udemy (Nasdaq: UDMY), a company dedicated to improving lives through learning, today proudly announced availability of its new Badging offering. The capabilities were introduced as part of an Integrated Skills Framework methodology designed to help organizations make sense of the complex skills landscape so that they can future-proof their workforce and keep pace with innovation.

subject: What's New at Zoom | July 2023 Recap
body:
Dear Jacob, 
Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better, we are constantly evolving to improve your experience. To help keep you up to date, we have summarized some key new things you should know below. 
Download
 the latest version of the Zoom desktop client to access all these features and more. 
For more resources to help you stay up to date, check out: 
Preview notes
 – A list of upcoming features. This page is only available to Zoom account owners and admins; you must sign in to view them.
Release notes
 – A complete list of past releases across the Zoom platform. 
If you have questions about the features and announcements outlined below, please reply directly to this email.
*Note: Some products and features may not be available to all customers. 
Zoom Learning Center Updates 
Discover updated Zoom Rooms courses - 
The Zoom Learning Center team recently updated the 
Zoom Rooms catalog
 to include information on all the latest and greatest features and enhancements. Refresh your memory on Zoom Rooms features, or learn something new like how you can reserve a Zoom Room with Workspace Reservation! 
Zoom Community  
The 
Customer Success Forum
 on the Zoom Community is now live!
 Launched in 2021, the 
Zoom Community
 is a hub for users to find answers, seek support, and receive guidance from fellow Zoom users and Zoom product experts. In the new Customer Success Forum, users will find a collaborative place to share success stories, learn about upcoming events, and exchange helpful ways to use Zoom features, all in one centralized, easily accessible location. Join the forum and learn more today!
Key Highlights from Zoom’s July Releases  
Zoom Web
 Updates 
Set default Team Chat channels for users
 -
 Account owners and admins can set up to 5 default Team Chat channels, to which all new and existing users will automatically be added. The chosen channels must be public channels and users can choose to leave these default channels. 
Zoom Phone
 Updates 
Advanced encryption for voicemails -
 Once advanced encryption for Zoom Phone voicemail is enabled, voicemail messages are received and recorded by Zoom servers which encrypt them with keys only known to their intended recipients’ devices. If admins enable the Escrow feature within advanced encryption for voicemails, admins will now be able to access these keys and users voicemails. Shared Line Appearance, Shared Line Group, Call Queue, or Auto Receptionist voicemail are not supported. Additionally, functionalities like email to voicemail, transcriptions, and the ability to check voicemails through dialing or the web are disabled when this feature is enabled. To utilize this feature, users must have a Power Pack license. Only admins with appropriate permissions can manage these voicemails.
Zoom Events
 Updates 
Attendee Companion app for Zoom - 
Attendees can join hybrid events using the companion app. This app allows them to attend an event in person or virtually without leaving Zoom Events. They can find, bookmark, and attend sessions in hybrid events. Attendees can navigate the physical space using maps and digital guides and switch between in-person and virtual webinar/meeting streams. During hybrid events, attendees can connect with in-person and virtual attendees. The companion app is available for iOS and Android devices. This feature may not be immediately available, as it is dependent on a backend server update. 
Security questions authentication for registration
 -
 Hosts can enable security questions for registrants when creating an event. Security questions apply to all registrants regardless of how they join (i.e., sign in to Zoom/IDP or fast join). The host can choose questions from a list of security questions (a template of 10 questions) and can customize up to 3 security questions. The questions will appear on the registration page as a mandatory item. Registrants must pick at least one question from the list and answer it to complete registration. The answer to each question will be associated with unique users, and the answer will be stored safely on the Zoom Events platform. After authentication at joining, registrants must answer the question they chose at registration. Only the registrant has the answer to the security question. If the registrant loses the answer, they will also lose access to the assigned ticket and cannot join the event. Registrants can contact the host for help and can register another ticket from the event detail page.
Zoom IQ for Sales
 Updates 
Email compose with Zoom IQ for Sales
 -
 Account owners and admins can enable or disable users' option to use Zoom IQ to create follow-up emails directly from the Zoom IQ for Sales Deals page. This setting is available at the account level and is disabled by default. This feature is currently not available for users with External IQ Admin and Zoom IQ Collaborator roles. 
Zoom Contact Center
 Updates 
Support for regions -
 Account owners and admins can create regions to organize users based on their location and apply voice routing settings specific to each location. This feature must be enabled by Zoom. 
Auto answer with queue default greeting - 
Account owners and admins can improve the call handling efficiency by implementing the auto answer feature for voice engagements. With auto answer, agents can automatically connect with callers, reducing the number of clicks required and providing a standardized caller experience. It also eliminates the need for agents to repeat the same greeting on every engagement, ensuring consistent greetings. 
Video channel for integrations -
 The Zendesk and Salesforce integrations for Zoom Contact Center support the video channel. As a result, agents can receive incoming video engagements, make outbound video calls, upgrade a voice call to video call, and chat with the consumer using in-video chat during the video engagement within the integration. During an incoming/outbound video engagement, the agent can see the customer screen pop within the CRM based on the 'email address' match. Configuration settings have been updated with video channel settings for Screen pop and search settings.  
Workspace Reservation
 Updates 
Workspaces admin management of reservations - 
Admins can add, change, or delete reservations at the building level. They can also override users' reservations in the building. Admins can book a workspace for a user (without needing to set up delegation), change a current workspace reservation of a user, and delete a user's current reservation. The user will receive a  notification if a change was made to the reservation by an admin. 
Configure a permanent desk -
 Account owners and admins can assign a user a permanent desk. Permanent desks are not reservable and will always display the assigned user at that desk. This feature displays users, who come into the office every day, and their permanent desks on the floor map. 
Business Announcements 
Zoom Software Lifecycle Policy -
 We plan to enforce the fourth round of our Software Lifecycle Policy on August 5, 2023, for all products and services, starting with the minimum versions referenced in the table found 
here
. Users running an end-of-life version after August 5 will not be able to join meetings via the Zoom Client and will be prompted to update or join from the Web browser. As always, we highly recommend you regularly download and update to the latest version of Zoom software by checking for updates within the Zoom desktop client or by navigating to 
zoom.us/download
 to take advantage of all our latest security and functionality features. Note: The end-of-life enforcement for Zoom Room Controllers on Windows UWP has been extended to August 5, 2023.  
End of Life for JSON Web Token (JWT) App Type in Zoom Marketplace -
 As a reminder, Zoom disabled the ability to create new JWT apps on June 1, 2023. Developers have until September 1, 2023 to migrate their JWT-based solutions to the new Server-to-Server OAuth or OAuth app types. For more information, please see the 
JWT migration guide
 and 
JWT deprecation FAQ
. 
Happy Zooming,
Zoom Success Advisor
Click 
here
 to unsubscribe from this list or manage your preferences 
here
.

subject: Here's the 🗝️ to Content Marketing
body:
Content marketing has been the central pillar of marketing for years, but it no longer works the way most understand it.
 
 
Hi Jacob!
 
I talk with a lot of marketers. What do the smartest marketers understand that the rest don't? They understand that content marketing as we’ve known it no longer works.
 
Content marketing has been the central pillar of marketing online for the last 10+ years. Write a blog post, optimize it for search, promote it everywhere, and watch the platforms send you traffic.
 
That recipe no longer works, and it hasn’t for some time. Organic traffic is down, ad costs are up, email is failing.  And yet so many marketers keep going back to this playbook like it’s 2010.
 
The reason content marketing as we’ve known it no longer works has to do with the platforms — I’m talking about Google, Facebook, Linkedin, Twitter, Reddit, TikTok, etc.
 
Beginning some years back, the platforms shifted from driving traffic to our websites (or being benign about it) to actively focusing on keeping it for themselves, on their platforms. 
 
This is the natural cycle of all platforms: Early in life they start out open and flexible (benign), but as they gain size and maturity, they start building walls to protect and sustain their value.
 
So what do the smartest marketers know? And how have they adjusted?
 
Firstly, they know that the platforms aren’t fully walled off; they’ve just restricted the exits more than they have in the past.
 
The platforms don’t like users leaving, plain and simple. They want us to stay on their platform and they’ll do everything in their power to make that happen.
 
So if you can’t get the platforms to drive you traffic, how do you get the attention of the people you want to be talking with?
 
Through engagement and distribution. This is the new paradigm.  
 
ENGAGEMENT: POSTING CONTENT THAT LIVES ON THE PLATFORM
 
Forget about blog posts on your site (they’re still relevant, but in a different way). The key to driving engagement is posting content that people want to consume ON the platforms.
 
I’ve heard this referred to as zero-click marketing, which I like; however, I don’t think it’s a term many are familiar with yet. But it gets the concept across.
 
What content can be consumed on a platform? A video, an image/collection of photos, a written post, a survey, an audiogram, etc.
 
Not only is on-platform content easier for a person to consume (you don’t need to leave Linkedin to read this post), but the platform also prioritizes these types of posts.
 
Said differently, content that keeps users on a platform gets exposed to more members of that platform than content that would send those people away from the platform.
 
That’s literally how platform algorithms are designed: reward stuff that keeps people on the platform, and discount stuff that leads people away.  
 
Which brings us to the second component of this new paradigm: how to reach the maximum number of people on these platforms, which is all about distribution.
 
DISTRIBUTION: ACHIEVING MAX EXPOSURE OF YOUR CONTENT
 
Assuming you post content that meets the above criteria (something that can be consumed on a platform), how do you get it exposed to the MOST people?
 
In my experience, distribution is something that marketers aren’t very good at. They focus a great deal on the content and on production, but distribution gets short shrift.
 
That’s a giant mistake.
 
Distribution is how you derive value from the content you create, and, in this new paradigm you need new ways to reach people because the platforms aren’t going to send them your way.
 
Yes, you could publish this content to your brand page, but no one is going to see it unless you pay to promote it. 
 
You could run some ads to promote your posts, but again, we’re back to spending money, and ads are fundamentally unsustainable, especially in B2B.
 
The KEY to distribution is getting people to share it to their networks, and the people you have ready access to are your employees: your CEO, the interns, and everyone in between.
 
You already understand why the type of content is important: It’s got to be something that 1) the platform prioritizes and 2) that users want to engage with. Check.
 
Well, WHO posts the content also matters. The #1 thing platforms want are users and the #1 type of user a network wants is a user who contributes CONTENT to their platform.  
 
These content-contributing users are the users who keep all of the other users coming back and they’re SUPER rare — there’s only one for every 100 average users.  
 
Case in point: You wouldn’t be here if I and X number of other people didn’t post to this platform! I’m not saying this is the world's best post. It’s not, but you get the point.
 
Employees are users in the eyes of a platform, which means the content they post — assuming it meets the above criteria — will be distributed to the broadest possible audience.
 
And, of course, the more of your people you get to distribute your content, the greater the number of people it will be exposed to. But marketing has always been a numbers game.
 
So yes, content marketing as we’ve known it is dead, but the simpler reality is that the rules have just changed.
 
But when the rules change, when people are caught off guard, when they don’t even see the ground shifting underneath them, THAT’S when the opportunity is the greatest.  
 
And this is what the smartest marketers know: They’re sourcing content to drive engagement and leveraging their people to distribute it.
 
Thanks for reading, and I hope you have a wonderful weekend!
 
Best,
 
Cameron Brain 
CEO & Co-Founder
EveryoneSocial
 
P.S. - Feel free to connect with me on 
LinkedIn
 or 
Twitter
!
Make sure to follow us on social media!
 
 
 
 
EveryoneSocial, 215 W Sego Lily Dr., #708100, Sandy, Utah 84070, United States

subject: Our 2023 summer reading guide is here
body:
Picks from leaders around the world ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
Books for summer reading
In the news
•
Take it easy.
 Although humans often dream of a life of leisure, it’s been the norm to work 40 hours a week since the 1990s. With the acceleration of AI, people increasingly speculate about whether machines will totally replace human labor—but could society actually handle that? Present-day workers seem uncomfortable with relaxing, using leisure time to pursue goals. That hasn’t always been the case. In 17th-century England, knitters routinely skipped work to go to “the alehouse or nine-pins,” a Royal Society fellow complained. Perhaps a more leisurely life of rest is needed. [
FT
]
•
Low levels of reading.
 Nearly a third of American students spend very little or no time reading for pleasure, and the average 13-year-old’s reading scores have fallen to their lowest level in about two decades, according to a recent National Assessment of Educational Progress report. Experts point to technology and social media as among the largest factors that may be contributing to a lack of reading. The average age that a child gets their first mobile phone is now 11, a 2022 Stanford Medicine study revealed. That’s an age where reading is normally encouraged. [
The Hill
]
Perhaps as a sign of much-needed respite, the most popular genre this year was fiction and poetry.
On McKinsey.com
•
What to read.
 Our world is both concerning—with executives navigating geopolitical tensions, economic setbacks, and other challenges—and exciting, with the advent of generative AI, which promises to shift the way we work. Our annual summer reading list reflects today’s evolving times, with selections by leaders from around the world, including picks from McKinsey global managing partner 
Bob Sternfels
, chief marketing officer 
Tracy Francis
, managing partner of global client capabilities 
Homayoun Hatami
, and senior partner 
Rodney Zemmel
. We also provide 11 additional curated reading lists
.
•
Something for everyone.
 Out of more than 70 selections, the top two books CEOs, founders, and editors recommended for 
McKinsey’s 2023 summer reading guide
 were 
The Age of AI: And Our Human Future
—by Daniel Huttenlocher, Henry A. Kissinger, and Eric Schmidt—and 
Trust
 by Hernan Diaz. These are from our innovation and fiction and poetry genres, respectively. In addition to these genres, with this year’s list, you’ll find books across genres such as workplace culture, history, personal development, biography and memoir, and more
.
Enjoy our annual book list
— Edited by Vanessa Burke, editor, Atlanta
Was this forwarded to you? 
Sign up here
.
Or 
send us feedback
—we’d love to hear from you.
Follow our thinking

privacy policy

Hello! While some view summer as a time to slow down, we're moving at Kumospeed. We pride ourselves on having the most technical team when it comes to digital workplace software — that means we build quickly — and we're just getting started.

subject: As heat and humidity increase, could India get too hot to work?
body:
The cost of lost labor hours ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
Searing heat in India
In the news
•
A deadly threat.
 Rising temperatures significantly threaten the physical and economic health of women and girls around the world. As a result of extreme heat, by 2050, more than 200,000 women in India, Nigeria, and the United States could die each year, new research by the Atlantic Council finds. Excessive heat restricts women’s working hours, resulting in a loss of income. The poorest women—such as West Bengal bricklayers who work outdoors and perform arduous physical labor—are often the most affected. [
Atlantic Council
]
•
Lacking air-conditioning.
 As record-high temperatures are being recorded across the globe, women are disproportionately exposed to health and financial risks. Extreme heat in India, Nigeria, and the United States limits women’s capacity for paid labor, amounting to $120 billion in lost productivity each year. Women who perform domestic chores, including collecting water for cleaning and cooking, are especially vulnerable to scorching temperatures. Just 9% of women’s working hours in India occur in air-conditioned workplaces. [
Scientific American
]
We estimate that 160 million to 200 million people could be living in urban areas in India with a nonzero annual probability of experiencing a lethal heatwave as soon as 2030.
On McKinsey.com
•
Climate risk challenges.
 As India faces a rapidly changing physical environment, extreme heat and humidity could put millions of lives and billions of dollars at risk. In fact, India could become one of the world’s first places to experience heat waves that exceed what a healthy human resting in the shade could survive, McKinsey Global Institute director 
Jonathan Woetzel
 and coauthors explain. Rising heat and humidity levels will also affect labor productivity and economic growth in an economy that relies substantially on outdoor work
.
•
What extreme heat costs.
 Chronic exposure to extreme heat rapidly decreases people’s ability to perform outdoor work. In India, the number of daylight hours during which outdoor work is unsafe will increase approximately 15% by 2030, compared with today’s levels, McKinsey analysis reveals. Lost labor hours due to increasing heat and humidity levels could put roughly 2.5 to 4.5% of GDP at risk by 2030, equivalent to roughly $150 billion to $250 billion. See what it would take 
for India to address the risk of lethal heat waves
.
Understand climate risk in India
— Edited by Belinda Yu, editor, Atlanta

.
Or 
send us feedback
—we’d love to hear from you.

subject: 🎙️ Decoded: New Podcast Release
body:
Join us in unpacking the phrase "I don't see color" with Paul Ladipo from Critical Conversations Consulting, LLC.
 
New Episode Release
Recording & Transcript
 
"I don't see color."
“I don’t see color” is sometimes viewed as a non-discriminatory, “politically correct” approach to interactions with people of color. But in reality, there’s a difference between understanding a person’s inherent value and being mindful of the challenges and perspectives each unique identity brings to the conversation.
 
To help us unpack this phrase, Host Larry Baker (he/him) is joined by Paul Ladipo (he/him), who will use their own lived experiences to explain how the phrase actually perpetuates racism through willful ignorance.
Featuring:
 
Paul Ladipo
Founder and Owner
Critical Conversations Consulting, LLC
LinkedIn
 | 
Website

subject: Introducing Personalized Tickets 🎟️
body:
Treat your audience to a best-in-class ticketing experience through customizable receipts and personalized delivery.
 
 
Create beautifully branded tickets and attach them to your confirmation emails
 
Treat your audience to a best-in-class ticketing experience through customizable receipts and personalized delivery. 
Book a Demo
 
As event planners, we know that the event registration, ticketing and check-in process can have a profound effect on attendee satisfaction, often before the event even starts. We make it our goal to perfect the process, but how can we leverage the right tools to optimize our flow?
 
At BigMarker, we're thrilled to announce Personalized Tickets, a fresh take on ticketing that delivers fully customizable tickets and receipts via email. Now, attendees receive tickets straight to their device, so they can enter your next in-person festival, concert, or B2C event with a simple QR code scan.
 
Design your tickets to align with your branding and meet your check-in needs, including
 key details like ticket tier, purchaser name, date & location, and unique QR code. 
 
Treat your audience to a best-in-class ticketing experience through customizable receipts and personalized delivery with Personalized Tickets.
With Personalized Tickets, you can: 
Automate the process of generating and sending tickets to audiences of any size
Provide a quick, seamless check-in experience for attendee with a simple QR code scan
Design your B2C event’s tickets with complete branding control
 
Ready to learn more? 
Simply click the button below for more information, or click the button above to schedule a demo.
Learn More
 
BigMarker, 223 W Erie Street, 4th Floor, Chicago, IL 60654, USA

subject: Psychological safety promotes better decisions and performance. How can leaders create it?
body:
Skills to build psychological safety ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
Playing it (psychologically) safe
In the news
•
Too much of a good thing.
 The Great Resignation of the pandemic years—government data shows roughly 98 million people left their jobs in 2021 and 2022—shone a light on toxic work cultures. But an insincere brand of niceness doesn’t actually fix toxicity, which is generally defined as environments that are not inclusive. According to psychology professor and author Tessa West, too much niceness doesn’t equate to empathy and can prevent managers from giving the critical feedback that helps people grow. [
Fortune
]
•
Under pressure.
 One organization estimates that anxiety and depression cost 12 billion working days, to the tune of $1 trillion in lost productivity across the globe each year. Organizations have committed everything from apps, free therapy, and assistance hotlines to help employees, but many workers are still stressed by their jobs. If the problem exists at an organization-wide level, then training programs will do little to help, one CEO says. Even if these initiatives survive postpandemic, they might not be accompanied by strategies to address unmanageable workloads, which may increase as persistent labor issues reduce staff. [
FT
]
According to one McKinsey survey, an overwhelming 89% of employee respondents said they believe that psychological safety in the workplace is essential.
On McKinsey.com
•
The power of psychological safety.
 Social scientists consider psychological safety—feeling free to openly disagree and bring up concerns without fear of retaliation—a basic need that’s vital to personal well-being. Research reveals that psychological safety at work strongly predicts team performance, productivity, and quality—and is even connected with better overall health. Open lines of feedback and communication can cultivate more creativity and inclusivity. According to a survey led by McKinsey senior partner 
Aaron De Smet
 and colleagues, leaders can promote this environment by engaging in supportive, collaborative behaviors such as open-dialogue skills.
•
Developing inclusive leaders.
 Creating psychological safety in the workplace requires an investment in developing empathetic and compassionate leaders. Organizations can formalize a commitment to psychological safety by reducing the stigma around mental health, offering leadership training that goes beyond a one-off presentation, and incorporating skill development into leaders’ daily work. Explore three leadership styles that best foster 
psychological safety at work
.
Create a safe space at work
— Edited by Gwyn Herbein, editor, Atlanta

subject: Casey Likes on Playing Marty McFly in Back to the Future on Broadway
body:
+ 5 Questions with Alex Moffat of The Cottage; Shucked's Alex Newell Performs on The View
View Online
 
 
 
 
Casey Likes on Playing Marty McFly in 
Back to the Future
 on Broadway
 
 
 
Likes was a 17-year-old high school junior from Chandler, Arizona when his performance of “Santa Fe” from 
Newsies
 at the Jimmy Awards wowed casting directors in the audience so much as to land him an audition for William Miller in 
Almost Famous
 – and subsequently book the role. 
The 21-year-old is now headlining his second Broadway musical in a year as Marty McFly in 
Back to the Future
, a part made famous by Michael J. Fox in the 1985 film. We spoke with him about his journey to Broadway and the challenges that come with playing such an iconic role.
 
Read More
 
 
 
 
5 Questions with Alex Moffat of 
The Cottage
 
The 
SNL
 alum talked with us about why he became an actor, the inspiring cast he's surrounded by, and his favorite NYC spot.

subject: [BOOK LAUNCH] Hinge’s new book The Visible Expert Revolution is here!
body:
Reach an audience far wider than you ever imagined.
 
NEW BOOK
How do ordinary experts become their industry’s top thought leaders? Our new book 
The Visible Expert Revolution
 explains exactly how it’s done. Featuring the stories and advice of Visible Experts from a wide range of professional services, the book is a comprehensive yet accessible guide any expert can use to raise their profile and achieve extraordinary success.
And starting today, it’s 
available on Amazon
!
 
In this book, based on more than a decade of research into hundreds of individual experts, you’ll learn why the almighty referral is in decline, how today’s buyers of services are hungry for authoritative information, and how you can position yourself as a buyer’s top—and sometimes only—choice. At the same time, you will reach an audience far wider than you ever imagined. 
The Visible Expert Revolution
 is your handbook to raise your profile, sharpen your expertise and command fees more than ten times higher than average. 
 
 
 
Table of Contents:
Introduction
Chapter 1: Why Become a Visible Expert? 
Chapter 2: Claim Your Niche. Develop Your Perspective. 
Chapter 3: Research Your Audience 
Chapter 4: Develop Your Visibility Plan
Chapter 5: Build Your Visibility Toolkit 
Chapter 6: Implement Your Plan 
Chapter 7: Sharpen Your Expertise 
  
What Readers Are Saying

The Visible Expert Revolution
 shows you how to turn your expertise into a rewarding and impactful career."

 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
Hey there,
You know how I’ve often talked about the benefits of setting up an online store?
Well, I've put together a 
guide on how to do just that
 in WordPress.
And guess what? It's 
way easier
 than you might think!
In this guide, I've covered three different methods depending on your business goals:
The Simple Shop
: Perfect if you only have a few products or services to sell. It's straightforward, easy to manage, and a great way to dip your toes in.
The Digital Downloads Store
: If you've got digital products like eBooks, music, or software, this one's for you. I show you how to handle downloads, making it super easy for customers to get what they purchase.
The Hybrid Store
: This one's a bit more comprehensive. It's perfect for selling a mix of physical and digital goods. It might sound daunting, but trust me, with the guide, you'll have it up and running in no time.
I've tried to make the guide as easy as possible, with clear instructions and plenty of screenshots. It's like having a friend walk you through the process (which, in a way, is exactly what's happening).
If you've ever thought about setting up your own online store, now's the perfect time to give it a go. And remember, I'm here if you have any questions or need a bit of help along the way.

. Can't wait to hear what you think!

subject: Understanding the economic potential of generative AI
body:
Four areas could benefit the most ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
﻿TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
The rise of generative AI
In the news
•
Custom credit cards.
 Although generative-AI tools have clearly captured the world's attention, finance leaders have been using computers to automate banking for decades, starting with ATMs in the 1970s. Still, generative AI represents a breakthrough in the development of artificial intelligence. Generative AI’s ability to use training data to create new content could give financial institutions the capacity to personalize products for every consumer. Banks might, for example, offer credit cards with financial perks that factor in how frequently someone orders takeout or travels for work. [
Fortune
]
•
The AI-enabled accountant.
 Companies’ finance and accounting departments are filled with routine activities. Now, CFOs are exploring the potential of generative AI to automate tasks even as organizations are trimming costs and dealing with a shortage of accountants. By producing lengthy reports and presentations, generative AI could remove much of the typical work for auditors and accountants. That might allow finance professionals to play a greater role in decision making, which in turn may spark more interest in these careers. [
WSJ
]
About 75% of the value that generative-AI use cases could deliver falls across customer operations, marketing and sales, software engineering, and R&D.
On McKinsey.com
•
Productivity boost.
 As companies rush to adapt and implement generative AI, understanding its potential to deliver value to the economy and society will help shape critical decisions about the technology. Generative AI’s impact on productivity could add trillions of dollars in value to the global economy. Our latest research estimates that generative AI may add the equivalent of $2.6 trillion to $4.4 trillion annually across 63 use cases, McKinsey senior partner 
Lareina Yee
 and coauthors explain.
•
Transforming knowledge work. 
Generative AI is likely to have the biggest effect on knowledge work, particularly activities involving decision making and collaboration. The capacity to automate activities that require applying expertise has increased to 58.5% in 2023, from 24.5% in 2017, while the ability to automate managing and developing talent jumped to 49.0% in 2023, from 15.5% in 2017, McKinsey estimates show. 
Consider how leaders may use generative AI to potentially create value
, streamline processes, and augment employee performance.
﻿See what generative AI could do
— Edited by Belinda Yu, editor, Atlanta

On July 26, 1990, the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) was signed into law, prohibiting discrimination against people with disabilities, and the first ever disability pride parade was held in Boston to celebrate. July 26 is now commemorated as #DisabilityIndependenceDay, and the month of July is recognized as #DisabilityPrideMonth. While disability rights have come a long way, there’s still progress to be made in achieving truly equitable systems. According to a 2022 report from the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics: ➡️ Across all age groups, people with disabilities are much less likely to be employed than people without disabilities. ➡️ The unemployment rate for people with disabilities is about twice as high as the rate for people without disabilities. ➡️ 30% of workers with disabilities are employed part-time as opposed to 16% of nondisabled workers, often because their hours were reduced or they couldn’t find an accessible full-time job. During July and throughout the year, we stand with the disabled community as we seek to foster equity in the communities where people live and at the organizations where they work. Only when all cultures are included can we ensure equitable outcomes and optimized performance in the workplace. #DEI #DiversityAndInclusion #Culture

subject: How do great CEOs successfully transition out of the role?
body:
Four tips for a better handoff ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
Stepping down smoothly as a CEO
In the news
•
Record turnover.
 It’s been a rough year for US businesses, with leaders contending with elevated inflation, the threat of recession, skills shortages, and disruptive technologies such as AI. In May 2023, monthly CEO turnover in the US reached an all-time high, with 224 chief executives departing their jobs, an executive outplacement company has found. That’s a 52% increase from April 2023 and the biggest number of CEOs leaving in one month since 2002, when the company started collecting these data. [
Fortune
]
•
Leadership legitimacy.
 The role of CEO carries great authority. Yet newly appointed executives who rely solely on authority to lead can only partly inspire. Displaying competence is a deeper way to influence, but workers’ support may rise or fall depending on a leader’s performance. New CEOs who gain legitimacy, however, earn the perceived right to lead in the best and worst of times. By acting with integrity, particularly when that comes at a cost—for instance, recalling a dangerous item immediately—leaders earn the trust of employees. [
HBR
]
A new CEO’s early dismissal is 2.4 times more likely when the outgoing CEO remains the board chair.
On McKinsey.com
•
﻿What bad transitions cost.
 When you’re a celebrated CEO, it’s hard to imagine being unprepared at the end of your career, McKinsey senior partner 
Carolyn Dewar
 and coauthors share. But as the transition to a new CEO gets closer, the reality that you’ve never done this before can feel daunting. Unlike Olympic athletes who practice over and over, you’ll only have one very public shot at it, and under emotional strain. Poorly managed C-suite transitions wipe out close to $1 trillion in market value every year in S&P 1500 companies
.
•
Better CEO handoffs.
 In a successful relay, the person receiving the baton starts running well before the baton reaches them. The best chief executives work with their directors on succession planning throughout their tenure. For instance, former Intuit CEO Brad Smith spoke to his board every quarter to update them on his succession plan. This helped to ensure there were no surprises when the time came to transition to a new CEO, Smith explains. See four best practices that will benefit any 
CEO contemplating a transition
.
Hear from leading CEOs
— Edited by Belinda Yu, editor, Atlanta
Was this forwarded to you? 
Sign up here
.
Or 
send us feedback
—we’d love to hear from you.
Follow our thinking
 
This email contains information about McKinsey's research, insights, services, or events. By opening our emails or clicking on links, you agree to our use of cookies and web tracking technology. For more information on how we use and protect your information, please review our 
privacy policy
.

body:

THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
Employees continue to prioritize growth in their career journeys so, naturally, they want to work for organizations that invest in their growth and development. This is why learning and development (L&D) is essential to organizational success!
To support you in this essential role, we’re 
featuring articles
 that offer insights into how L&D can have the biggest impact on the business, how to measure that impact and how to convey that impact to stakeholders.
We also have some great opportunities for you to come together with other learning leaders and learn from some of the best in the industry at our fall virtual 
Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)
 and our upcoming Leader Talk about making the most of artificial intelligence (AI) in your learning tech stack.
We hope these resources will help make it easier for you to confidently establish yourself as a trusted business partner. Please send any comments or suggestions to 
editor@trainingindustry.com
.
Jenny Ayers
Associate Editor
Register Now: 2023 Fall Virtual TICE
Get ready to unlock the secrets to building a powerful learning strategy! You’re invited to the virtual 
Training Industry Conference and Expo (TICE)
 Sept. 27-28 where we are focusing on building your learning strategy. Join us online from anywhere in the world and connect with over 1000 of your L&D peers! This conference is specifically designed to equip you with the skills and knowledge needed to drive impact and maximize the return on investment (ROI) of your L&D initiatives.
Learn More
 
Leader Talk: Managing Learning Technologies in the Age of AI
Learning leaders are increasingly expected to double as technology experts as learning technologies continue to emerge and evolve at a rapid pace. When you factor in the additional element of AI within these tools, it can be very difficult to know what’s the best fit for your training needs. Join us for this complimentary 
Leader Talk
 on Aug. 10 to get tips from industry experts on how to leverage and manage AI tools to support your L&D efforts.
Reserve Your Spot
 
Training Needs Assessment, Simplified
Great training starts with a robust needs assessment that highlights skills gaps and identifies learning opportunities that can help fill them. However, creating a comprehensive needs assessment isn’t easy. That’s why we’ve created a free, step-by-step checklist to assist you alongside your needs assessment journey. Download the checklist today and learn more about how Training Industry’s

subject: Schoox Adds Coaching Capabilities, Blanchard Partners With OpenSesame and Other L&D News ...
body:
Business News This Week
View this email in your browser
July 29, 2023
Industry News from 
Training Industry
Sign up to receive this newsletter each week
 
 
Schoox Adds Coaching to its All-in-One Learning Management and Talent Development Platform
AUSTIN — July 26, 2023
Learning management and talent development software provider Schoox today announced the addition of Coaching to its all-in-one learning platform. Incorporating coaching into the learning experience helps learners stay on track and guides them toward success in their roles.
Read More
 
Blanchard® Partners With OpenSesame
SAN DIEGO — July 26, 2023
Blanchard®, a global pioneer in leadership development, consulting, and coaching for more than 40 years, announced a partnership with OpenSesame, a leading SaaS global eLearning innovator, to include hundreds of Blanchard’s digital assets, videos, and microlearning on OpenSesame’s expansive and comprehensive catalog of eLearning courses.
Read More
​​​​​​
​​​
CONTENT DEVELOPMENT
Instructure and Khan Academy Announce Partnership to Enhance Teaching and Learning With Khanmigo, the AI Tool for Education 
SALT LAKE CITY — July 27, 2023
  
Today, Instructure and Khan Academy announced a partnership that brings together Instructure’s market-leading learning management system, Canvas, the anchor of the Instructure Learning Platform, and Khan Academy’s AI-powered student tutor and teaching assistant, Khanmigo.
Read More →
LEARNING TECHNOLOGIES
Unlock AI-Powered Upskilling and Motivate Employee Development With Bridge 
RALEIGH, N.C. — July 27, 2023
  
L&D technology platform Bridge has expanded its suite of learning and development tools to include an upskilling platform, Skills Plus.
Read More →
ONBOARDING
SmartRecruiters Unveils Q2 Product Release, Bolstering CRM and Onboarding Capabilities 
SAN FRANCISCO — July 27, 2023
  
SmartRecruiters, an All-in-One Hiring Platform, announced new capabilities in its Q2 Release aimed at bolstering CRM and Onboarding capabilities, while also expanding the depth of workflow customization and integration capabilities.
Read More →
STRATEGY, ALIGNMENT AND PLANNING
ADP Reports Fourth Quarter and Fiscal 2023 Results 
ROSELAND, N.J. — July 26, 2023
  
ADP (Nasdaq: ADP), a leading global technology company providing human capital management (HCM) solutions, today announced its fourth quarter and fiscal 2023 financial results along with its fiscal 2024 outlook through an earnings release available on the company’s website at investors.adp.com/events-and-presentations.
Read More →
SALES
RAIN Group Launches a Sales Management Online Training Course for Sales Managers 
BOSTON — July 23, 2023
  
RAIN Group, a global sales training company delivering results through in-person and virtual sales training, coaching, and reinforcement, announced today the launch of RAIN Sales Management, a new self-paced online sales training course.
Read More →
MEASUREMENT AND ANALYTICS
iMocha Launches AI-Powered Skills Intelligence Cloud to Enable Enterprises to Transition to Skills-First Talent Management 
ASHBURN, Va. & PUNE, India — July 26, 2023
  
iMocha, a leading SkillsTech platform today launched its Skills Intelligence Cloud, an AI-powered platform to revolutionize enterprise hiring, talent management, internal mobility, and workforce planning processes.
Read More →

subject: Are you collaborating the right way?
body:
Apply research-based principles to unlock better collaboration. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
BOOKS
 
 
 
 
COLLECTIONS
 
 
 
 
TOOLS
 
 
 
 
CASE STUDIES
 
 
 
HBR STORE
 
 
 
 
 
Achieve more with smarter collaboration 
 
Today’s business problems are increasingly complex, and so are the solutions. With HBR’s 
Smarter Collaboration Diagnostic Toolkit
, you get an action plan to embed more effective collaboration within your organization and maximize success. 
 
 
 
 
 
LEARN HOW TO:
•
Collect diagnostic data via surveys, interviews, and focus groups
•
Analyze how well you’re currently collaborating
•
Communicate and disseminate your findings
•
Ready your team to become stronger collaborators
•
Embed smarter collaboration to boost innovation
•
And much more
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
 
 
 
 
THE EBOOK
Firms that collaborate effectively consistently generate higher revenues and profit. 
Smarter Collaboration
 lays out a pragmatic action plan with practical advice to help companies collaborate in a smarter way. 
 
 
5 MODULES
From conducting qualitative research to making transformative changes, these modules provide the essential guidance and tools needed to transform your organization. 
 
 
6 VIDEOS
Each short video provides further insight on how to diagnose collaboration across your organization. 
 
 
9 WORKSHEETS
As you roll out research findings, use these worksheets to empower your people to incorporate better collaboration into their day-to-day work. 
 
 
THE HANDBOOK
We’re with you every step of the way with a roadmap, advice, and tips to guide your transition to smarter collaboration.
 
 
 
 
 
LEARN MORE
