Hey Ashton,
 
I’ve officially finished all the suggested edits on the website and documented the response to all notes in the tracker. You can find this documented here:
 
 
There are a final touches still needed. As you know, my goal was to help us get through these before the end of the week… I’m sorry I ran out of time to be able to do more. Here’s the list of remaining website edits still needed (below).
 
Remaining website to-do’s:
 
Add a “Schedule a demo” (for eLearning/microLearning) and “Preview the training” (for facilitated training) button on the read more pop outs on the Training and Learning page (sorry AV… I can’t seem to be able to figure this out!!)
Go through photos and add alt text
Go through pages and optimize for SEO 
Swap out headshot pictures as needed on the careers page (need Keri images)
Go through all past events and add the recording links
Figure out how to change the “See detail” buttons to “See details” on the events page
At some point when budget allows… send final copy off to translation to be translated (Alisa has said this will probably be a “nice to have” for a while)
 
Thanks again for all the work you put into this website! Let me know if you have any questions!
 
Jake

body:
Hey RP,

Remaining website to-do’s:

I figured I should loop you in so you’re aware that while the website is live, there’s still some backend polishing happening.
 
Thanks,
 
Jake

subject: A CIO and CTO guide to generative AI
body:
Harness the power ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
Share this email
 
 
Share this email on 
LinkedIn
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Twitter
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Facebook
  
 
 
 
 
AN ARTICLE A DAY, PICKED BY OUR EDITORS
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
Generative AI has taken the world by storm
—and it is evolving quickly. CIOs and CTOs have a crucial role to play in ensuring their companies get value from this technology, which McKinsey research estimates could add the equivalent of $2.6 trillion to $4.4 trillion annually to the global economy. In a 
new article
, McKinsey’s 
Aamer Baig
, 
Sven Blumberg
, 
Alexander Sukharevsky
, and their coauthors lay out the nine actions technology leaders need to take to turn the promise of generative AI into sustainable value for their businesses. Check out how CIOs and CTOs can avoid the pitfalls and shape the business approach to generative AI by orchestrating technology and data capabilities, scaling solutions, and managing risk.
 
Technology’s generational moment with generative AI: A CIO and CTO guide
CIOs and CTOs can take nine actions to reimagine business and technology with generative AI.
Harness the power  
Quote of the day
“By leveraging technology, automation, and robotics, we can remove some of the manual aspects of work and focus on more value-added and employee-centric aspects of the supply chain.”﻿
—Chris Smith, president of McLane Grocery at McLane Company, on what will give his company a competitive advantage in a 
recent episode
 of 
McKinsey Talks Operations﻿
Chart of the day
 
See today’s chart  
ALSO NEW
Four essential questions for boards to ask about generative AI
Boards are responsible for how generative AI is used at the companies they oversee. Asking company leaders the right questions will help unlock the technology’s value while managing its risk.
Ask the right questions 
 
The rewired enterprise: How five companies built to outcompete
Lessons from five rewired enterprises highlight how to turn initial digital gains into enterprise-wide ones.
Build digital distance  
The future of European gas: How buyers’ needs will shape the market
The European energy crisis has disrupted the trajectory of gas demand. Now, there is an opportunity for suppliers to partner with buyers and offer evolving energy solutions.
Assess your strategy 
 
— Edited by Joyce Yoo
,
 editor, New York

 Reminder: Learning with LCW: Creating a culture of inclusion that fosters high performance starts in 1 day
 
Hi Rebecca Parrilla,
This is a reminder that your webinar will begin in 1 day: 
Learning with LCW: Creating a culture of inclusion that fosters high performance
Date & Time
Jul 12, 2023 01:00 PM Central Time (US and Canada)
Webinar ID
889 3077 3713
Description
In the last three years, organizations have taken unprecedented steps to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging in their organizations. Have their efforts been successful? Creating impact that is both measurable and sustainable is both the most vital and most difficult aspect of DEIB work as well as of culture work more broadly. 
This session explores LCW’s Sustainable Culture of Inclusion Model (SCI), LCW’s framework for understanding organizational maturity. LCW believes that the cultural diversity inherent in all organizations is an asset that can be leveraged to build high performance, and that sustainable cultures of inclusion are the foundation for this success. LCW deploys the SCI framework to diagnose organizational maturity along two axes: (y) the organizational culture and mindset, especially that of leadership and management, and (x) the systems which underlie the organization’s people strategy. Using a collaborative discovery and workshop approach, LCW can diagnose your organization’s level of sustainable inclusion and create a roadmap for advancement that also provides measurement milestones along the way.
In this session, presenters will share the theoretical frameworks used to develop the SCI Model, discuss the methodology for using the model to diagnose organizations’ current state, and provide two case studies that demonstrate how the model has been used with client organizations. These case studies will reveal some of the specific actions organizations took to optimize systems and develop proficient mindsets. Ultimately, the goal is to create a Sustainable Culture of Inclusion that produces both a positive working experience and equitable outcomes for employees.

subject: Sneak Preview: From Day One's 2024 Live & Virtual Schedule
body:
Corporate-values conference series and media outlet From Day One has set an ambitious schedule of events for 2024
 
 
FROM DAY ONE
Announces 2024 Slate of Corporate Values Conferences,
In Person and Virtual 
Top executives in HR, Benefits, Diversity, Corporate Culture, Employee Engagement, and Corporate Responsibility discuss employee engagement, belonging, 
inclusive benefits, hybrid work, well-being, and more
JULY 13, 2023
 –
 From Day One
, the conference series focused on innovative ways for companies to foster stronger relationships with workers and communities, is announcing its 2024 schedule of in-person and virtual events. 
The company will host more than 35 conferences, including single-day events in cities across the U.S. – the most From Day One has ever held in one year – and a full slate of half-day virtual events.
"We're feeling the aftershocks of the three great workplace upheavals of the decade so far: the pandemic, the racial-justice movement, and the Great Resignation," said Stephen Koepp, From Day One's chief content officer. "While the pandemic has passed, the return-to-office migration is a contentious journey. The hoped-for progress toward diversity, equity, and inclusion has prompted a backlash. And workers are mostly done quitting en masse, but their expectations about job satisfaction have only grown. On top of these issues, the arrival of generative AI is going to change virtually everyone's job. Company leaders will need to face fresh challenges, and From Day One's conferences in 2024 will be bringing them the latest ideas about these developing stories."
Whether in person or online, From Day One’s accredited events bring together top executives and decision makers in HR, benefits, diversity, corporate culture, employee engagement, and corporate responsibility to discuss timely themes like hybrid work, employee benefits, diversity and inclusion, social impact, and employee well-being. 
From Day One is recognized as the pre-eminent forum for corporate-values discussions. The company’s in-person events break the typical conference mold by presenting in inspiring spaces, including art museums, opera houses, and centers of community gathering. From Day One was among the first to convene executives to address subjects like balancing productivity with well-being, developing diversity in leadership, supporting working parents, hybrid work, and offering better career paths, and the firm expects further evolution in the ways businesses and society will interact next year.
Even as the company looks ahead to 2024, this year still has several From Day One conferences remaining in 2023. The company will travel to 
Boston
 on Sept. 12, 
Manhattan
 on Sept. 26, 
Philadelphia
 on Oct. 3, 
Denver
 on Oct. 18, 
Los Angeles
 on Nov. 2, and 
Miami
 on Nov. 14. From Day One also holds virtual events and webinars every week; find the schedule of upcoming events at
 fromdayone.co
.
The full slate of 2024 in-person and virtual dates is below. In-person dates are preliminary and subject to change. Speakers and participants will be announced in the months leading up to the events. All From Day One conferences are eligible for SHRM and HRCI credits.
 
 
FROM DAY ONE 2024 IN-PERSON CONFERENCE SCHEDULE
 
*ATLANTA, GA — January 24
*HOUSTON, TX — February 6
*SEATTLE, WA — February 20
*SILICON VALLEY, CA — February 27
SALT LAKE CITY, UT — March 12
*WASHINGTON, D.C. — March 26
BROOKLYN, NY — April 9
BOSTON, MA — April 18
CHICAGO, IL — April 21  
DALLAS, TX — May 7
*MINNEAPOLIS, MN — May 14
AUSTIN, TX — June 6
SAN FRANCISCO, CA — June 26
BOSTON, MA — September 12
NASHVILLE, TN — October 1
PHILADELPHIA, PA — October 8 
MANHATTAN, NY — October 22
DENVER, CO — October 29
LOS ANGELES, CA — November 12
MIAMI, FL — November 26
SAN FRANCISCO, CA — December 3
* indicates exact date is confirmed.
  
FROM DAY ONE 2024 VIRTUAL CONFERENCE SCHEDULE
Jan. 10, 2024
A Fresh Commitment to a Culture of Well-Being 
While many employers recognize the connection between well-being and productivity, creating a healthy balance in the real world of work can be challenging. What are the key choices and thoughtful compromises that must be made for workers to thrive as well as produce? How can managers be trained to make the well-being of their workers a top priority? How can companies get a better sense of which benefits and rewards are most effective–and encourage workers to take advantage of them?
Feb. 14, 2024
Getting to the Next Stage of Diversity and Belonging 
At a time of resistance and corporate austerity, DEI advocates will need to re-energize themselves and their organizations with new ideas, programs, and reasoning for the cause of diversity. What can DEI practitioners learn from companies with consistent success? How are companies changing their policies to respond to court rulings and lawsuits? What practices have brought the most progress in bringing diversity to leadership ranks?
March 6, 2024
Employee Engagement: Tapping the Secrets of Energizing Workers 
Companies want their employees to be enthused and involved, yet employers need to be thoughtful in fostering these qualities in authentic ways. What’s the latest thinking about how employers can understand the motivations of their workers–and how to respond? What are the best methods for recognizing achievement, both individually and among teams? What’s the connection between engagement and job satisfaction? In the hybrid work environment, what binds workers together and wards off anxiety and loneliness? 
April 3, 2024
Benefits that Fit Individual Needs Without Busting the Budget
Having made a commitment to recognize the unique needs of individuals, the secret is in the execution. What are the emerging benefits and rewards that workers are seeking, from fertility care to financial wellness? How can companies use technology to stay in close touch with what individuals are experiencing–and where they need help as a result? How can companies choose among myriad point solutions and innovative new platforms? What are the most cost-effective rewards in terms of investments and outcomes?
May 22, 2024
The Art and Science of Employee Retention, Coaching and Advancement
While the pace of job-hopping has eased, employers have a powerful motivation to retain skilled workers, both for financial and cultural reasons. How can employers use new tools, including AI, to gain insights about what’s inspiring their workers to stay committed–or walk out the door? Since attrition is often caused by poor relationships with managers, what are innovative ways for employers to train their workers to be better leaders at a time when workers have higher expectations for job satisfaction? How can technology help make coaching more effective?
June 12, 2024
Bringing Talent Acquisition into the Digital Age 
Despite layoffs making headlines now, all the demographic and digital trends point toward tough competition for workers in the future–maybe sooner than most expect. What are the new techniques and tools that talent-acquisition can use to envision the workforce their company will need in the future? What data and insights can HR and TA leaders provide to the company to be ahead of trends? How can companies do a better job of internal recruiting and promoting internal mobility? What are the best practices for hiring based on skills and potential, rather than credentials?
July 10, 2024
Learning and Development: How New Tools Are Changing Upskilling and Career Mobility 
As employers put more emphasis on skills as the currency for worker development, they’re seeking new ways to measure them, fill in gaps, and predict the skills needed in the future. How can these new tools, including AI, create better matches between employees and projects? How can employers gain insights from the data they gather? Why do real-world simulations help measure certain skills better than traditional assessments? 
July 17, 2024
Innovative Benefits That Support Healthy Families and Caregivers
As the pandemic’s caregiving crisis showed, employers found significant gaps in their support for the parents and other caregivers in their workforces. The resulting scramble to help has produced a wealth of new HR policies, benefit offerings, and management practices. Where is the greatest demand for support, as well as the most innovative new methods? What have been the most cost-effective ways to help caregivers of all kinds, including parents as well as “sandwich generation” workers caring for elderly and disabled relatives? 
Aug. 7, 2024
Employee Engagement: Using Technology to Gain Insight Into Work Needs and Ambitions 
Traditional methods like town-hall meetings and surveys can be effective, but data and well-drawn insights can give top leaders a heads up about evolving patterns and trends in their workforces. How can AI and other technology be deployed in a way that brings new insights yet still respects privacy and the individual human factors at play? What approaches will bring employers new empathy for worker needs, ambitions, and well-being? 
Aug. 28, 2024
Pursuing Higher Productivity With Human Factors in Mind
In a competitive and uncertain climate, most companies need to do more with less. Yet if workers are their greatest asset, employers need to make sure the push for greater output is sustainable. What is the latest thinking about how to measure productivity, the means for stimulating it, and ensuring that workers have the energy to meet their goals–as well as thrive over the long run?
 
Sept. 18, 2024
Building a Corporate Culture That Workers Can Understand, Influence and Embrace 
 
Company culture is amorphous yet vital–the shared beliefs, values, traditions and behaviors that drive the actions of individuals and the organization as a whole. Who should be the architects of a company’s culture and how should it be designed and constructed? How should the culture be communicated, broadly and in everyday actions? How should a company start out on a project to evolve its culture in a credible way?  
Oct. 16, 2024
Modernizing Your Workplace for a More Flexible, Inclusive Era
The arrival of hybrid work sent virtually every employer back to the drawing board about what the workplace should look like, including floor plans, digital platforms, meetings, and even office furniture. After more than three years of experimenting, what have innovative companies discovered about what works–and what doesn’t? How have they improved workplace environments to be healthier, as well as more productive? How have these changes affected the goals of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging?
Nov. 20, 2024
Finding and Deploying HR Tech That Will Empower Workers 
 
The blossoming of innovation in HR technology has given employers untold new abilities to organize, inspire, develop, reward, and care for their workers. Yet this revolution presents new challenges for companies in choosing and supervising these tech tools. How should these tech platforms be evaluated? Which departments of the company should take responsibility–and how can organizations coordinate these moves? How can companies make sure they’re empowering their workers rather than overloading them with adaptation and distraction?
Dec. 11, 2024
Pioneering Approaches to Digital Transformation and the Future of Work
The emergence of generative AI in 2023 marked the arrival of a transforming technology that will change human roles, add and subtract jobs, and create astounding new capabilities. How can companies manage the transition, both from the short-term competitive pressures to  long-term corporate survival? How can AI be used to unleash creativity? Where are the areas for abuse, intentional or otherwise? How will digital transformation affect fields from talent acquisition to learning and development? 
 
ABOUT FROM DAY ONE
From Day One is a conference series and media outlet focused on innovative ways for companies to foster stronger relationships with their employees, customers, and communities. At a time when society holds businesses to a rising level of accountability, From Day One explores how companies can build well-grounded values into their business—diversity, responsibility, transparency—and stick with them in an economy driven by disruption.
What’s unique about From Day One is its cross-disciplinary approach, bringing together executives from the fields of corporate social responsibility, human resources, marketing, and communications. Its events facilitate people-focused conversations that promote real, actionable ideas for and from executives, civic-leaders, authors, and journalists across the country. Businesses have increasingly seen the wisdom of putting people first. From Day One’s mission is to help companies find the best ways to deliver on that promise, from day one.

subject: [Important Notice]: Upcoming MySQL Version Upgrade
body:
We are reaching out today to inform you that your current version of MySQL (MySQL 5.7) is reaching its end-of-life status and will be removed from our platform in October 2023.
 WordPress relies on the widely-used MySQL database to store and manage your website's data. Being on the most current version of MySQL ensures that your site is optimized for the future and protected against a greater number of threats. 
What does this mean for you?
 
It means that by the end of 
October 2023
, all WP Engine-hosted sites will be scheduled for an upgrade (that we will complete on your behalf) to MySQL 8.0 to ensure continued updates and security patches. 
To minimize possible disruptions to your sites at the time of your upgrade, we recommend that you assess your readiness and plan for this necessary upgrade of your site to MySQL 8.0. More information on how you can prepare can be found here: 
Resources for MySQL 8 Compatibility
We will contact you again in early August with the plan and timing to ensure this industry wide upgrade goes as smoothly as possible for you. 
As always, our team of WordPress experts are available 24/7 to assist with any questions you may have. If you reach out to support, 
please use the reference code: mysql8.
 
Need help? 
Contact our 
Support Team 
. 
© WP Engine | 504 Lavaca St. Suite 1000 | Austin, TX 78701 
Not the right contact for this account? Please forward on to the appropriate person, and be sure to update your account's users in 
User Portal 
.

subject: RE: Strategy and 2024 budget opportunities
body:
Thank you for this! Adding Ashton and Jake for visibility around your blog post idea.
 
What a great opportunity for us to share with other clients. Dan and I had a call yesterday with CapGemini looking for us to support their analytics department (70% male and from India, especially in the middle manager role) in rolling out training on Unconscious Bias. I am pleased to see our key differentiator on being culture first and global paying dividends.
 
 
 
Alisa Kolodizner
Co-CEO and Managing Partner, 
LCW

From:
 Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, July 13, 2023 8:55 AM
To:
 Tamara Thorpe <t.thorpe@lcwmail.com>; Andrea Wicks Bowles <a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com>; Training <training@lcwmail.com>; Consultants <consultants@lcwmail.com>; Kelly Salek <k.salek@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Strategy and 2024 budget opportunities
 
With regards to the affirmative action issue…thank you for highlighting it, I know that Camille and Lukeisha (my two top clients) will be asking me soon about our position and for talking points.
 
It is my view that – in terms of products and services -- our culture-first approach is the way forward, and the way 
through
 these changes in our country’s legal landscape. I think we need to work on a podcast, blog article, or social media post (or something!) that we can use to state our position, which is something like “no matter what the government says about affirmative action (or “wokeness,” for that matter) we are here to help you create a sustainable culture of inclusion in this culturally diverse world, because we know that it’s the way to achieve your goals as an organization.”
 
Happy to take the lead on that if folks think it will be useful. 
 
From:
 Tamara Thorpe <
t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, July 12, 2023 7:05 PM
To:
 Andrea Wicks Bowles <
a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com
>; Training <
training@lcwmail.com
>; Consultants <
consultants@lcwmail.com
>; Kelly Salek <
k.salek@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>; Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Strategy and 2024 budget opportunities
 
Hello Andrea,
 
PING: In addition to Navigating Global Cultures and Culture & Identity, we have a “Working with India” that is relatively up to date.
 
Aflac: In addition to our MUB series, there is Managing Bias for Managers & Leaders which I think speaks directly to the expressed need.
 
TT
 
From:
 Andrea Wicks Bowles <
a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, July 12, 2023 4:02 PM
To:
 Training <
training@lcwmail.com
>; Consultants <
consultants@lcwmail.com
>; Kelly Salek <
k.salek@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>; Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Strategy and 2024 budget opportunities
 
Hi Everyone,
For some of my clients, it is beginning to be the time of year to consider 2024.  I am looking for help responding to the following areas of interest.  What do/can we offer, how might I respond.  And finally, who could help me with the approach to create a journey…
 
PING
:  “
I've been asked to explore availability of any 
training, resources or other tools for US based leaders who manage employees in other countries (primarily India).
 We have an office in India that is growing and will continue to do so.
 
I checked your website and it looks like these are offerings which I assume helps address this concern.  Cultural literacy
Cultural immersion series (facilitated)
Navigating global cultures (facilitated)
Culture and Identity (e-learning)
Are there any other resources (or tools) that are available from a best practice perspective?”
 
Aflac
:  
Due to the recent attention on Affirmative Action, etc., I am keeping an eye out for any developments. Would like to double down on training efforts for our HR teams.  Do you have any specific training offering for hiring practices/diverse hiring etc?  Would love to see what you offer.  We have around 100 people in HR.
 
Collective help is really needed.  I am thinking that with our India trainers, we might have more flexibility proposing more of our standard catalogue, because I assume it will be shared in a culturally competent way.  Is that a true statement.
 
And for the issues of Affirmative Action issue influencing Aflac (and other companies)  what would we propose for enhancing the learning.  Does anyone have ideas about the opportunity for out trainings in the face of these issues??
 
Wished I had sent this before our Monday meeting.  I need to get back to clients next week.  Please send your ideas or let me know if you are interested in a discussion.
 
Thank you all.
 
Cheers~
 
Andrea Wicks Bowles
(She/Her/Hers)
Senior COnsultant
LCW

subject: Please join the 2024 High Growth Study
body:
Learn how much firms spend on marketing and much more.
 
2024 HIGH GROWTH STUDY
Get a FREE advance copy of the report on your industry (a $799 value)! 
Hi Jacob,
We would like to invite you to join the most comprehensive study of professional services marketing. For the ninth consecutive year, the Hinge Research Institute is conducting the High Growth Study, the largest research study of its kind. 
Whether your firm is a below-average performer or a fast-growing trailblazer, we need your help. 
Click here to take the survey.
We want to help professionals like you understand how firms approach marketing today—and how some professional services firms are able to grow faster, generate more leads, and reap higher profits than their average peers. 
This year’s study will also include several special topic areas, including adoption of ChatGPT, recruiting and retention strategies, approaches to strengthening company culture, and more! 
When you complete the study, you’ll receive these exciting benefits:
Get early access to the study's executive summary
Receive an exclusive code to download your full industry report for free (retails for $799)*
*As soon as it is ready in early 2024
What You'll Learn
We conduct this study each year to help firms in your industry recognize and adapt to a fast-changing marketplace. Here are just a few of the topics we cover:
Buyers’ top business challenges
How much firms spend on marketing
Which marketing techniques high-growth firms in your industry favor
How average- and high-growth firms invest in digital marketing
Practical takeaways you can use to help your firm grow faster and be more profitable 
 
All responses are strictly confidential and will only be reported in aggregate. No responses will be attributed to you or your firm.
Please join us and be part of this important project!
To get started, click 
here
.
Thank you,
Lee Frederiksen, Ph.D.

subject: Let's overcome workplace dissatisfaction together
body:
LAST CALL! Join today's webinar with Blueboard and ThinkHuman on how to drive bottom-line impact by investing in employee fulfillment. 
 
Last call!
Join us today
 at 10 AM PST / 1 PM EST for a 45 minute virtual session on actionable insights from this star-studded line up of people leaders:
Shireen El-Maissi 
- Director of People & Talent at Blueboard
Dr. Cornell Verdeja-Woodson
 - Director of Diversity, Equity & Belonging at Zillow Group

Hakemia Jamison Jackson

We're walking through how to take a human-centric approach to current HR challenges by providing:

⚡ Insights on how to achieve more with less, developing an agile and resilient team.

subject: When it comes to marketing, it pays to think like an investor
body:
How marketing can drive growth ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
﻿Marketing makeover
In the news﻿
•
The new CMO playbook.
 Three-quarters of chief marketing officers (CMOs) feel like they’re being asked to do more with less, according to a recent Gartner survey of more than 400 marketing leaders. While talent and digital media costs are increasing, marketing budgets are decreasing amid ongoing economic uncertainty. In this new era of scarcity, marketing leaders should revamp their goals to match the long-term objectives of their organization and get buy-in from all stakeholders. [
HBR
]
•
Needing a human touch.
 Nearly one-quarter of the $88 billion per year that US brands spend on digital ad placements is wasted, according to a new report from the Association of National Advertisers. Optimizing for the lowest cost per click can lead to ads appearing on low-quality, made-for-advertising websites that don’t see much human traffic. Instead, the report urges marketers to prioritize higher-quality media buys and to monitor which domains display ads during a campaign. [
WSJ﻿
]
﻿Nearly three dozen CMOs told us that, on average, their company boards demanded an 8% reduction in marketing expenditures over the previous 12 months.
On McKinsey.com
•
Think before you cut.
 Rather than bluntly slashing marketing budgets, taking a strategic approach to marketing spend could deliver both cost savings and growth, even when times are tough. McKinsey senior partner 
Kelsey Robinson
 and colleagues recommend that CMOs eliminate wasteful spending and redirect funds to areas that will deliver more long-term ROI. Thinking like an investor could potentially save companies 10 to 20% on inefficient marketing efforts and boost growth by 5 to 10%.﻿
•
What’s in your tech stack?
 Many organizations aren’t making full use of the automated creative or analytics solutions they’ve already invested in. CMOs should develop a thorough understanding of their current marketing tech tools and remove internal barriers that prevent implementation and continued usage. Read the full article 
for more ways to recalibrate your marketing strategy
 and create value in times of uncertainty
.
﻿Let marketing drive greater value
— Edited by Joy Merten, editor, Chicago
Was this forwarded to you? 
Sign up here
.
Or 
send us feedback
—we’d love to hear from you.
Follow our thinking
 
This email contains information about McKinsey's research, insights, services, or events. By opening our emails or clicking on links, you agree to our use of cookies and web tracking technology. For more information on how we use and protect your information, please review our 
privacy policy
.

subject: 5 minute ask - NPS Contacts
body:
Hey Ashton – can you please send this out to the consultants, Kelly, and Maya (all account owners)? We will talk through this tomorrow but I thought it would be better to be sent by you!
 
----
 
Hi all,
 
I hope you’re doing well! It’s once again time to send out our NPS survey and I need your help confirming contact information for your clients. Last quarter we only asked for confirmation on new accounts, but with the recent changes we thought it would be best tot reconfirm this information with you before sending. 
 
Please take 5 minutes to review your tab in 
 
this spreadsheet
 by the end of day Monday, July 17.
 
 
All contacts in this sheet have been gathered from Compass – 
please review your tab, add/remove contacts from each client listed so the list includes those that are relevant to last quarter’s SOW’s, and change the box at the top of the tab to green when your review is complete.
 
Thank you in advance for your help! 
 
Best,
 
Ashton

From:
 Jacob Pieczynski <
no-reply@zoom.us
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, July 11, 2023 2:13 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Reminder: Learning with LCW: Creating a culture of inclusion that fosters high performance starts in 1 day
 
Hi Rebecca Parrilla,
This is a reminder that your webinar will begin in 1 day: 
Learning with LCW: Creating a culture of inclusion that fosters high performance
Date & Time
Jul 12, 2023 01:00 PM Central Time (US and Canada)
Webinar ID
889 3077 3713
Description
In the last three years, organizations have taken unprecedented steps to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging in their organizations. Have their efforts been successful? Creating impact that is both measurable and sustainable is both the most vital and most difficult aspect of DEIB work as well as of culture work more broadly. 
This session explores LCW’s Sustainable Culture of Inclusion Model (SCI), LCW’s framework for understanding organizational maturity. LCW believes that the cultural diversity inherent in all organizations is an asset that can be leveraged to build high performance, and that sustainable cultures of inclusion are the foundation for this success. LCW deploys the SCI framework to diagnose organizational maturity along two axes: (y) the organizational culture and mindset, especially that of leadership and management, and (x) the systems which underlie the organization’s people strategy. Using a collaborative discovery and workshop approach, LCW can diagnose your organization’s level of sustainable inclusion and create a roadmap for advancement that also provides measurement milestones along the way.
In this session, presenters will share the theoretical frameworks used to develop the SCI Model, discuss the methodology for using the model to diagnose organizations’ current state, and provide two case studies that demonstrate how the model has been used with client organizations. These case studies will reveal some of the specific actions organizations took to optimize systems and develop proficient mindsets. Ultimately, the goal is to create a Sustainable Culture of Inclusion that produces both a positive working experience and equitable outcomes for employees.

subject: Retail reset: A new playbook for retail leaders
body:
Get ahead on priorities ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
Share this email
 
 
Share this email on 
LinkedIn
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Twitter
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Facebook
  
 
 
 
 
AN ARTICLE A DAY, PICKED BY OUR EDITORS
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
The retail industry has experienced as much disruption
 in the past five years as it has in the previous 25. The demands and behaviors of consumers, suppliers, employees, and investors have rapidly evolved—and this calls for a radical rethinking of long-held beliefs and practices, or a retail reset, say McKinsey’s Steven Begley, 
Becca Coggins
, 
Dymfke Kuijpers
, and 
Franck Laizet
 and their coauthors. In a 
new article
 from 
McKinsey Quarterly
, they discuss the forces shaking up the industry and suggest the focus areas that should be at the top of the retail C-suite agenda, including owning the consumer relationship, setting a vision for a retail ecosystem, and more. See what’s needed to reinvent retail.
 
Retail reset: A new playbook for retail leaders
In light of unprecedented industry disruption, a retailer’s actions today could determine whether it spends the next 20 years as a leader or a laggard. Here are four must-dos for retail executives.
Get ahead on priorities  
Quote of the day
“It’s tempting to chase shiny objects, but that can end up distracting from the critical issues in the core.”
—Kristin Wolf, senior vice president of enterprise strategy and transformation for Ulta Beauty, on striking the right balance between different types of growth in “
Meeting beauty consumers where they are—and where they’re going
”
Chart of the day
 
See today’s chart  
ALSO NEW
Ready for prime time? The state of live commerce
The innovative social-commerce format continues to grow, but its potential could be unlocked by tailored approaches responding to differences in consumer characteristics and needs.
Tune in 
 
How top performers outpace peers in sales productivity
The macroeconomic environment is putting sales budgets and bottom lines under pressure. “Doing more with less” isn’t just a mantra, it’s a decree.
Outpace your peers  
Making sense of generational stereotypes at work
Boomers to the left of you; Gen Z to the right. Are we really so bafflingly different?
People are people 
 
— Edited by Joyce Yoo
,
 editor, New York
Follow our thinking
 
Share these insights
Did you enjoy this newsletter?
 
Forward it to colleagues and friends
 so they can subscribe too. Was this issue forwarded to you? Sign up for it and sample our 40+ other free email subscriptions 
here
.

subject: 🎙️ Decoded: New Podcast Release
body:
Join us in unpacking the phrase "But you don't look autistic" with Becca Lory Hector from Truly Inclusive Leadership.
 
New Episode Release
Recording & Transcript
 
"But you don't look autistic."
The phrase “but you don’t look autistic” presupposes autism as an “other,” ostracizing autistic people from the conversation and discounting the community’s diverse lived experiences. So how do we respond to anti-autistic microaggressions, and what can we do to foster a sense of belonging through inclusive language?
 
To help us unpack this loaded question, 
Brave Conversations with LCW
 Host Larry Baker (he/him) is joined by Lead Consultant and Founder of Truly Inclusive Leadership Becca Lory Hector (she/her), who shares her lived experience as an openly Autistic Professional on a mission to close the disability gap in leadership.
Featuring:
 
 
Becca Lory Hector
Lead Consultant and Founder
Truly Inclusive Leadership

subject: Reminder: Learning with LCW: Creating a culture of inclusion that fosters high performance starts in 1 hour
body:
Hi Jacob Pieczynski,
This is a reminder that your webinar will begin in 1 hour: 
Learning with LCW
:
 Creating a culture of inclusion that fosters high performance
Date & Time
Jul 12, 2023 01:00 PM Central Time (US and Canada)
Webinar ID
889 3077 3713
Description
In the last three years, organizations have taken unprecedented steps to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging in their organizations. Have their efforts been successful? Creating impact that is both measurable and sustainable is both the most vital and most difficult aspect of DEIB work as well as of culture work more broadly. 
This session explores LCW’s Sustainable Culture of Inclusion Model (SCI), LCW’s framework for understanding organizational maturity. LCW believes that the cultural diversity inherent in all organizations is an asset that can be leveraged to build high performance, and that sustainable cultures of inclusion are the foundation for this success. LCW deploys the SCI framework to diagnose organizational maturity along two axes: (y) the organizational culture and mindset, especially that of leadership and management, and (x) the systems which underlie the organization’s people strategy. Using a collaborative discovery and workshop approach, LCW can diagnose your organization’s level of sustainable inclusion and create a roadmap for advancement that also provides measurement milestones along the way.
In this session, presenters will share the theoretical frameworks used to develop the SCI Model, discuss the methodology for using the model to diagnose organizations’ current state, and provide two case studies that demonstrate how the model has been used with client organizations. These case studies will reveal some of the specific actions organizations took to optimize systems and develop proficient mindsets. Ultimately, the goal is to create a Sustainable Culture of Inclusion that produces both a positive working experience and equitable outcomes for employees.

subject: Not sure about the advantages of online CBT? We've compiled the data here.
body:
CBT tools delivered online are as effective as face-to-face sessions.
Email not displaying correctly?
View it in your browser
.
Hi Jacob,
Studies have shown that cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) is a powerful solution to problems like anxiety and depression. This fact sheet explores the evidence of how online CBT tools are as effective as face-to-face sessions.  
For “silent sufferers” who don’t want to seek in-person therapy, digital CBT can effectively improve mental health care. 
  
Get the Fact Sheet

subject: [Webinar] Strategies for Maximizing Lead Generation in Your Webinars and Events
body:
You're invited! Register today for this info-packed webinar happening Thursday, July 27th at 1 PM EST.
 
 
 
Strategies for Maximizing Lead Generation in Your Webinars and Events
 
When executed effectively, webinars can be the most powerful lead generation tool in the marketer's toolkit.
 
However, most marketers today are working in overdrive to cut through the "noise" online to get their content in front of the right audiences and drive engagement. 
So how can we push the envelope to surpass our growth goals?
 
Join us for a 
l
ive webinar
 on 
Thursday, July 27 at 1 PM EST
,
 w
here we'll 
explore explore the ways to optimize your strategy to stretch your lead generation efforts and maximize your return. 
Specifically, we'll discuss:
Tips for creating a high-converting webinar landing page
Ways to effectively incentivize your audience to register for and attend your webinars
Partnership opportunities to tap into new audiences
Register Now
 
BigMarker, 223 W Erie Street, 4th Floor, Chicago, IL 60654, USA 
Unsubscribe
 
Manage preferences

subject: Middle managers are vital to organizational health and performance. How can you best support them?
body:
Why strong management pays off—literally  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
Managers in the middle
In the news
•
Coaching with tech.
 Employees—especially those who began their roles in a remote environment—crave coaching from managers, but a recent survey found that an increase in supervisory and training responsibilities makes leaders 520% likelier to burn out. Tech tools can help ease the burden of delivering personalized feedback. For example, one sales company uses AI to analyze live conversations between agents and potential customers. The digital platform provides real-time coaching while new sales reps make their pitches, so that managers don’t have to spend hours listening in on calls. [
HBR
]
•
A dearth of diversity.
 Many corporate DEI pledges that came out of the racial unrest of 2020 have not translated into meaningful gains for women and people of color, a 2023 study finds. An analysis of roughly 800 US public firms by researchers from Columbia Business School and the London Business School found that women comprise 39% of the workforce of those companies, whereas minorities constitute 36%. Among middle managers, only 6% are Hispanic and 4% are Black. Organizations become more racially homogenous at higher levels, the research also found. [
Fortune
]
Organizations with top-quartile managers realize from three to 21 times greater TSR over five years compared with those whose managers are in the other three quartiles.
On McKinsey.com
•
The power of the middle.
 Organizations with top-performing managers yield stronger shareholder returns than those that don’t, research by McKinsey partner 
Emily Field
 and colleagues reveals. But far from being the relationship builders they want to be, middle managers spend much of their time bogged down with administrative tasks. Only 20% of those surveyed strongly agree that their organizations help them to become better people managers, even though strong managers can reduce attrition, support talent acquisition, and bolster employee well-being and psychological safety
.
•
Charting a (middle) course to success.
 Successful middle managers aren’t just nice to have; they are key contributors to both organizational health and financial performance. As such, organizations have an immense opportunity to invest in these vital roles. Leaders can, for instance, reset manager roles to remove unnecessary bureaucracy, investing in technologies to help automate tasks and reduce meetings so that managers can focus their energies on developing others. Consider five actions leaders can take to 
help their middle managers (and organizations) succeed
.
Strengthen middle management
— Edited by Gwyn Herbein, editor, Atlanta

.
Or 
send us feedback
—we’d love to hear from you.

Four essential questions for boards to ask about generative AI
body:
Ask the right questions ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

AN ARTICLE A DAY, PICKED BY OUR EDITORS
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
With generative AI developing at lightning speed,
 company executives and employees are anxiously exploring its possibilities, values, and risks. But what role should a company’s 
board of directors
 play to get ready for what lies ahead? After all, the board is ultimately responsible for how generative AI is used in the companies they oversee—so they should be prepared to help their CEOs understand how it can create value while managing risks. In order to do this, asking the right questions is critical, say McKinsey’s 
Frithjof Lund
, 
Dana Maor
, Nina Spielmann, and 
Alexander Sukharevsky
. Check out this 
new article
 which outlines four questions boards should ask management, plus one question they should ask themselves. Give it a read and get ready for the future.
 
Four essential questions for boards to ask about generative AI
Boards are responsible for how generative AI is used at the companies they oversee. Asking company leaders the right questions will help unlock the technology’s value while managing its risk.
Ask the right questions  
Quote of the day

”

See today’s chart  
ALSO NEW
Tackling healthcare’s biggest burdens with generative AI
Disparate sources of unstructured data, which abound in healthcare, are now assets to power generative AI. Here’s how private payers and healthcare systems can use the technology to deliver care.
Understand the potential 
 
Unleashing developer productivity with generative AI
A McKinsey study shows that software developers can complete coding tasks up to twice as fast with generative AI. Four actions can maximize productivity and minimize risks.
Take 4 actions

Embrace the future

Email
 
How did you hear about us?:
Other
 
Services of Interest:
Translation & Localization Services
 
Would you like to receive emails from us about news, updates, and events?:
No
 
Message:
I am writing to express my interest in collaborating with you as a freelance translator. With my extensive experience of 15 years and passion for languages, I am confident that I can provide high-quality translation services to support your business needs. 
Here's why I believe I would be a valuable asset to your company: 
Experience: I have been working as a translator for 15 years, during which I have gained expertise in translating from English/French into Arabic and vice versa. I have successfully completed numerous projects for clients in various industries, including software, general, telecommunication, health care, marketing, legal, automotives, technical, real estate, manuals and medical general. 
Specialization: I specialize in technical translations, legal documents, marketing materials, computers and systems. This specialization allows me to deliver accurate and culturally appropriate translations that resonate with your target audience. 
Language Proficiency: I am a native speaker of Arabic and have an exceptional command of English and French. This ensures that I can capture the idioms, and cultural references in the translated text, resulting in a natural flowing translation. 
Quality Assurance: I understand the importance of delivering translations of the highest quality. To ensure accuracy and consistency, I utilize various tools and resources, including translation memory software, glossaries, X-Bench tool and style guides. Moreover, I am committed to proofreading my work meticulously to ensure error-free translations. 
Professionalism and Reliability: I understand that timely delivery is crucial for your projects, so I am dedicated to meeting your expectations in terms of both quality and turnaround time. 
I would be delighted to discuss how my skills and experience align with your specific translation needs. Please, find attached my most updated resume. I am also ready to do a test translation to showcase my abilities if you deem it necessary. 
Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to contribute to your team and help you achieve your translation goals. Should you require any further information, please do not hesitate to contact me. 
Best regards, 
Ahmed Saad Farahat 
Ahmed[at]middleeast-localizers.com

https://www.middleeast-localizers.com/

Trevor
 (StreamYard) 
Jul 11, 2023, 12:52 PM PDT 
Hi there,
 
Thanks so much for your feedback! I am so sorry you have to cancel due to cost! I do have a couple of options for you that may help 
 
I would be happy to extend our Partner discount to you if that will help you continue streaming...  it is $40 off either Annual Plan (so $200 USD for the Basic Annual Plan or $428 USD for the Professional Annual Plan). Let me know if you would like me to apply that discount to your account 
 
If you are not wanting to upgrade to the annual plan then I should let you know we were offering a new Plan a while ago called the 
Essentials Plan
. It has all the features of the Basic but you do have to keep our branding in the upper right. It is a small "StreamYard" print right next to your logo. That plan was being offered at $10 USD a month or $96 USD for the year. Let me know if that is something you are interested in and I may be able to make an exception and extend that offer for you.
 
Be sure and let me know if you have any other questions!
 
Cheers,
Trevor

subject: Reminder: Learning with LCW: Creating a culture of inclusion that fosters high performance starts in 1 day
body:
Hi Jacob Pieczynski,
This is a reminder that your webinar will begin in 1 day: 
Learning with LCW
:
 Creating a culture of inclusion that fosters high performance
Date & Time
Jul 12, 2023 01:00 PM Central Time (US and Canada)
Webinar ID
889 3077 3713
Description
In the last three years, organizations have taken unprecedented steps to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging in their organizations. Have their efforts been successful? Creating impact that is both measurable and sustainable is both the most vital and most difficult aspect of DEIB work as well as of culture work more broadly. 
This session explores LCW’s Sustainable Culture of Inclusion Model (SCI), LCW’s framework for understanding organizational maturity. LCW believes that the cultural diversity inherent in all organizations is an asset that can be leveraged to build high performance, and that sustainable cultures of inclusion are the foundation for this success. LCW deploys the SCI framework to diagnose organizational maturity along two axes: (y) the organizational culture and mindset, especially that of leadership and management, and (x) the systems which underlie the organization’s people strategy. Using a collaborative discovery and workshop approach, LCW can diagnose your organization’s level of sustainable inclusion and create a roadmap for advancement that also provides measurement milestones along the way.
In this session, presenters will share the theoretical frameworks used to develop the SCI Model, discuss the methodology for using the model to diagnose organizations’ current state, and provide two case studies that demonstrate how the model has been used with client organizations. These case studies will reveal some of the specific actions organizations took to optimize systems and develop proficient mindsets. Ultimately, the goal is to create a Sustainable Culture of Inclusion that produces both a positive working experience and equitable outcomes for employees.

subject: Maximize Your PR Potential: Unlock the Benefits of PR Newswire's Support Team
body:
Experience Excellence with PR Newswire: Elevate Your Press Releases 
View as a webpage
 
Elevate Your Press Releases with Expert Support from PR Newswire
GET STARTED
 
Hi 
Jacob
,
Customer support and excellence are synonymous with PR Newswire, and the reason why we have a 
99.8% accuracy rate
. Our Customer Content Services (CCS) team offers various levels of support to ensure your press release has the best chance of success. 
Initial Reviews
Rest easy knowing that every press release uploaded to PRN's Online Member Center receives meticulous human attention. We ensure accuracy, perform thorough proofreading for formatting, grammar, and punctuation, and provide optional consultations on SEO and content best practices. 
Individual Press Release Reviews
To receive additional guidance, simply sign up and request an individual press release review through your assigned account manager. Once you submit a draft of your press release before distribution, our dedicated team will provide thorough reviews and consultations. We offer a quick turnaround time of 72 hours. Our focus is on implementing SEO best practices, enhancing headlines and incorporating multimedia elements to maximize the reach and impact of your press release. 
Content Workshops
Our company-level workshops are designed to provide comprehensive insights into various subjects, such as enhancing impact and discoverability, staying updated on industry-specific distribution trends, navigating IR (Investor Relations) and ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) best practices and much more. To request a full content workshop, simply reach out to your account manager after signing up. 
Ready to take your press releases to new heights? Contact us now to speak with an expert and get started! 
GET STARTED

300 S Riverside Plaza Chicago, IL 60606, USA

subject: ✉️ Last Chance to Register! Creating a Culture of Inclusion
body:
Reserve your seat for our July Learning with LCW webinar: Creating a Culture of Inclusion that Fosters High Performance.
 
Last chance to register! 
Learning with LCW Webinar
Reserve Your Seat
 
Wednesday, July 12 | 1pm CT
 
In the last three years, organizations have taken unprecedented steps to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging in their organizations. Have their efforts been successful? Creating impact that is both measurable and sustainable is both the most vital and most difficult aspect of DEIB work as well as of culture work more broadly.
 
LCW’s Sustainable Culture of Inclusion (SCI) Model serves as a framework for understanding organizational maturity. LCW believes that the cultural diversity inherent in all organizations is an asset that can be leveraged to build high performance, and that sustainable cultures of inclusion are the foundation for this success. Ultimately, the goal is to create a Sustainable Culture of Inclusion that produces both a positive working experience and equitable outcomes for employees.
In this session, we will:
Share the genesis & structure of the SCI Model
Discuss how we use the SCI model to diagnose organizations’ current state
Provide two case studies that demonstrate the model’s impact 
Facilitated by:
 
 
Sarah Nodarse
Principal Consultant, LCW
 
 
Vince Bongiovanni
Associate Consultant, LCW
 
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2023 LCW, All rights reserved.
LCW, 4753 N Broadway, Floor 2, Chicago, Illinois 60640, USA

subject: Re: Website FYI - Elementor Pro authentication
body:
Hi Jake!
Thanks for the note, and glad those videos have been helpful. I'll touch base with Clint and circle back with you on the first two questions.
For Elementor, yep, go ahead and click on that button to connect & activate, and then it will likely prompt you to log into your Elementor account. I have in our notes that you (or your team) had purchased an Elementor Pro license, and the login uses the 
marketing@lcwmail.com
 email address. Do you have the password for that, or access to reset it? If not, I do have a password saved that I can share with you, not sure if it's out of date or not.
More real soon!
Best,
Scott
On Tue, Jul 11, 2023 at 11:12 AM Jake Pieczynski <
j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hi Scott and Maura,
 
Thanks very much for sending all these guides – please tell Clint we appreciate the detailed walk through videos! We wanted to make sure to get through all of them before responding to you. Thanks for putting these all together!
 
After getting through the videos we have two remaining questions:
 
How does the events section and plug-in work? We stayed away from this section so far because we’re not exactly sure what to touch, how to make an event go live, or what to do after the event’s over so the recording is available after they put in their info
How does the resources section of the website work? How do we designate a post for this section vs the blog and how can we edit/control the pop up info wall that comes up for access?
 
Could you please help us understand these two sections?
 
As for the Elementor subscription, I’m not sure we have an existing Elementor Pro subscription. My Dashboard has a slightly different message when I log in (I’ll put a screenshot below).
 
 
Do you recommend we click the connect and activate and then create an Elementor Pro account? Is there anything we should look out for when we do that?
 
Thank you again for sending all the great info and thanks for helping clarify these final points!
 
Best,
 
Jake
 
Jacob Pieczynski
(He/Him)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW

Subject:
 Website FYI - Elementor Pro authentication
 
Jake and Ashton,
 
Hello! Clint asked Maura and me to pass along one other note to you, that he forgot to mention when he put together the user guide.
Your site is built using a page builder within WordPress called Elementor Pro. When Clint tried to get your license installed on the site, he got blocked by two-factor authentication trying to log into your Elementor account. 
It looks like we need your help getting this set up under your account. Fortunately, it's super easy to do.
In WordPress, you'll just need to click the blue button at the top of the dashboard, and it will prompt you to sign into your Elementor account and connect it (screenshot below). 
 
It should be really simple -- mind letting us know that this worked okay for you?
 
My best,
Scott
 
 
-- 
Scott Daigger, 
MBA, PSM, NPDP
Founder, Owner
Buddy Web Design & Development
scott@buddywdd.com

subject: FW: [Upcoming Webinar]: The Gartner CMO Spend and Strategy Survey 2023
body:
Join me tomorrow to benchmark your marketing budget 
This message contains graphics. If you do not see the graphics, 
click here to view.
 
Hi Jacob, 
With budget growth stalling post COVID-19, CMOs continue to feel the pinch. Moreover, inflationary pressures are greatly impacting marketing's plans and priorities.
In our upcoming session tomorrow, I’ll reveal the latest insights from the annual Gartner CMO Spend and Strategy Survey and explore how CMOs are readjusting their commitments to marketing’s channels, resources and programs.
You can register 
using this link
 to join live or watch the replay afterward. 
I hope you’re able to join us,
Ewan McIntyre,
Distinguished VP Analyst
From:
 Gartner for Marketers <
Gartner.marketers@gartner.com
> 
Sent:
Tuesday, June 20, 2023 11:01 AM 
To:
 Jacob Pieczynski 
Subject:
 [Upcoming Webinar]: The Gartner CMO Spend and Strategy Survey 2023 
 
Register Now 
to learn the state of marketing budget and strategy in 2023 
Refocus Your Marketing Priorities Amidst Continuous Disruption
As we navigate a third straight year of budget constraints across North America and Western and Northern Europe, chief marketing officers are refocusing their efforts to gain the greatest benefits for their organizations.
Join leading Gartner expert Ewan McIntyre on July 12th
 as he reveals the findings from the annual Gartner CMO Spend and Strategy Survey and shares the strategy and budgeting priorities of CMOs in 2023 and beyond.
Discussion Topics: 
Get insights from the latest Gartner CMO Spend and Strategy Survey
Assess where marketing budgets are in 2023 
Analyze data on CMOs’ strategic priorities in the era of continuous disruption

subject: THIS WEEK: Your roadmap to boosting engagement
body:
Join a July 13th webinar with Blueboard and ThinkHuman on how to drive bottom-line impact by investing in employee fulfillment. 
 
 
Feeling the squeeze of higher expectations and lower resources? You're not alone. The solution? Taking a human-centric approach in how we empower our teams.
 
On July 13th, 2023, join this star-studded line up of people leaders:
Shireen El-Maissi 
- Director of People & Talent at Blueboard
Dr. Cornell Verdeja-Woodson
 - Director of Diversity, Equity & Belonging at Zillow Group
Aja M. Smith
 - Executive Leadership Coach & Community Catalyst at ThinkHuman
Hakemia Jamison Jackson
 - CEO | Global Executive Coach at Divinely Powered
They'll walk you through how to take a human-centric approach to current HR challenges by providing:
 
⚡ Innovative strategies to sculpt a workplace culture that boosts productivity and morale.
⚡ Tactical insights on how to achieve more with less, developing an agile and resilient team.
⚡ The secret to securing stakeholder buy-in, ensuring your strategies take root and flourish.
 
Don't miss this opportunity to build out a roadmap to boost engagement, performance, and overall wellbeing in your organization.
 
Busy at the time? Sign up, and we'll send a video recording for you to watch at your leisure. Bonus: Earn 1 PDC for SHRM/HRCI!
July 13, 2023
10:00 AM PT
Register Here

subject: Have you given any thought to the African economy? Here’s why you should.
body:
Opportunities for growth in Africa ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
Africa’s economic prospects
•
People power.
 The success of the future global economy hinges on one continent: Africa. In Asia, Europe, North America, and elsewhere, fertility has been shrinking for decades. Populations are also aging quickly, outpacing the number of young workers. Not so in Africa, which will account for 420 million of the 428 million prime-age workers that are expected to join the world economy by 2040. Young Africans may provide the lift in productivity needed to counter a slowing global economy. Increasingly, the rest of the world depends on it. [
Foreign Affairs
]
•
Growing and resilient. 
Despite shocks such as the COVID-19 pandemic, surging food prices, and higher borrowing costs, many African economies remain resilient. According to an index of the 100 businesses in the continent that are growing the fastest, companies in a wide range of sectors, including in commodities, fintech, healthcare, and renewable energy, expanded their businesses at a time of global lockdowns. Entrepreneurship is also alive and well. In 2021, tech start-ups garnered $5.2 billion, triple the amount they raised in 2020. [
FT
]
In Africa today, at least 345 companies have annual revenues of $1 billion or more.
•
Still growing. 
As home to the world’s youngest and fastest-growing population, Africa presents many opportunities for strong, inclusive growth. This may enable Africa to improve its productivity and reverse the economic deceleration it faced from 2010 to 2019, according to McKinsey senior partner 
Acha Leke
 and colleagues. Today, 60% of Africa’s population lives in poverty, yet half of its people live in countries that have thrived on the continent, and new McKinsey research finds that Africa is still growing and developing
.
•
Shift to services. 
The African economy has shifted profoundly over the past 20 years, as people left work in the fields to take jobs in trade and other services in cities. Employment in services increased from 30% to 39% over that period, although half the workforce remained in agriculture. The services sector makes up a large part of the continent’s economic output, contributing 56% in 2019. 
See more ways that the African economy is changing
, and what role large private-sector firms can play in rekindling economic progress there
.
Accelerate growth in Africa
—Edited by Belinda Yu, editor, Atlanta

—we’d love to hear from you.

subject: In the face of volatility, finance leaders adapt: Results from McKinsey's latest CFO pulse survey
body:
Adjust priorities ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

AN ARTICLE A DAY, PICKED BY OUR EDITORS
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
In today’s challenging economic climate,
 what’s on the minds of CFOs? Despite concerns over inflation and economic volatility, financial leaders continue to have an optimistic outlook on industry growth and investment. And while they expect volatility to persist over the next year, CFOs are taking proactive steps in the face of economic headwinds and enterprise risk, according to results from McKinsey’s 
latest CFO pulse survey
 led by 
Ankur Agrawal
, Christian Grube, and Jorge Herranz Bayo. Check it out to see how leaders are adapting to the current environment and understand the priorities that lie ahead.
 
In the face of volatility, CFOs—and their organizations—adapt
Our newest survey of CFOs finds that despite their growing concern over volatility and inflation, finance leaders plan to keep their organizations moving forward.
Adjust priorities
Quote of the day
“At some level, people are people. They want to have meaningful work. They want to have real connections with their coworkers and their managers; they want what they’re doing to have broader purpose; they want to be fairly compensated.”
—McKinsey partner 
Bryan Hancock
 on generational preferences at work in a 
recent episode
 of the 
McKinsey Talks Talent
 podcast
Chart of the day
 
See today's chart
ALSO NEW
The net-zero materials transition: Implications for global supply chains
To provide critical materials for the energy transition, the metals and minerals industries must adapt their global supply chains.
Dig deeper 
 
Meeting beauty consumers where they are—and where they’re going
Ulta Beauty’s Kristin Wolf details strategies for growth across a 600-brand portfolio.
Take a portfolio approach  
Transforming public sector hiring with data-enabled talent ‘win rooms’
These talent hubs can expedite and streamline government hiring processes—and they can also close critical labor gaps.
Build your capacity 
 
— Edited by Joyce Yoo
,
 editor, New York

subject: Website FYI - Elementor Pro authentication
body:
Jake and Ashton,
Hello! Clint asked Maura and me to pass along one other note to you, that he forgot to mention when he put together the user guide.
Your site is built using a page builder within WordPress called Elementor Pro. When Clint tried to get your license installed on the site, he got blocked by two-factor authentication trying to log into your Elementor account. 
It looks like we need your help getting this set up under your account. Fortunately, it's super easy to do.
In WordPress, you'll just need to click the blue button at the top of the dashboard, and it will prompt you to sign into your Elementor account and connect it (screenshot below). 
It should be really simple -- mind letting us know that this worked okay for you?
My best,
Scott
-- 
Scott Daigger,
 
MBA, PSM, NPDP
Founder, Owner
Buddy Web Design & Development
scott@buddywdd.com
616-202-2273

From:
 Ashton Vicente <a.vicente@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, July 5, 2023 12:00 PM
To:
 Office <office@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Action Required: LCW’s New Branding Has Launched!
Importance:
 High
 
Hi team,
 
This week marks an exciting new beginning for LCW – our new LCW branding has officially launched! If you visit our social media accounts or website, you’ll notice that these channels now feature our new look, embodying our renewed energy and commitment towards continuing this work for the next 20 years.
 
To help you navigate these changes, I’ve attached two documents that you should please prioritize reviewing as soon as possible:
 
Brand Launch Timeline Instructions
There are several changes you need to make to your own computer to ensure that you’re adopting our new visual identity.
This document includes instructions on how to make 4 required updates and three optional updates to your personal device and social channels.
We will make time to cover these changes in our upcoming All Staff meeting, but you can begin updating your device on your own (send questions to Ashton or Jake).
Please complete the 4 required updates outlined in this document by Friday, July 14
th
.
 
Brand Talking Points
This document includes valuable information on how to talk about this change with your clients and ensures we all are talking about this new brand identity in the same way.
You’ll also find information on the website and what this means for clients within this document.
No action is needed beyond your independent review of this document.
 
Additionally, the consulting team will receive information this week on how to work with the design team in prioritizing training materials for redesign (additional time will be allotted to discuss this process at our upcoming staff meeting). This process will continue through the remainder of the year with the goal that our entire library be converted to the new brand identity by 2024.
 
Thank you for your help in implementing this change – I hope you’re as excited as we are on Team MarComm!
 
Best,
Ashton

We’re thrilled to start off #DisabilityPrideMonth with a special episode of our Decoded podcast featuring self-identified Autistic Professional Becca Lory Hector, whose mission is to close the disability gap in leadership. ⏯️ Recording & Transcript: https://hubs.li/Q01WLmK40 In this episode, Becca and Host Larry Baker unpack the coded phrase “But you don’t look autistic.” How do we respond to anti-autistic microaggressions, and what can we do to foster a sense of belonging through inclusive language? In our latest podcast episode, Maya Hu-Chan shared a story about how microaggressions eventually made her change her own name. “Microaggressions,” she explained, “are subtle put-downs or insults, whether intentional or unintentional, that are regularly experienced by marginalized groups”—such as not learning how to pronounce someone’s name. Asking how to pronounce someone’s name and practicing with them is an inclusive behavior that communicates genuine care and respect. “I can't tell you how much that I appreciate that,” she said. ⏯️ Check out the full podcast and transcript on our website: https://hubs.li/Q01Wh_4p0 #DEI #Podcast #Culture #AANHPI

subject: Rapid organizational change means CEOs need to step up with a strategic response
body:
Handle upheaval with four superpowers ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
Hit the ground running
In the news
•
Return-to-work roulette.
 Postpandemic, the debate on returning to the office rages on, with offices at only 50% of prepandemic occupancy rates. Some companies are relying on carrots (for example, offering to make a $10 donation to an employee’s preferred charity for each day that person works from the office) or sticks (making performance reviews contingent on attendance) to lure people back to their desks. They’re also touting the benefits of impromptu meetings and in-person conversations. Other companies are making decisions about remote versus in-person work based on specific role functions. [
NYT
]
•
Mind the skills gap. 
A rapidly evolving job market means that the global skills gap is growing. By 2027, the world’s labor markets will add roughly 70 million new jobs, but 83 million may be cut, according to the World Economic Forum. Its 2023 
Future of Jobs
 report lists the top ten in-demand skills, a mix of “soft skills,” such as curiosity and lifelong learning, and “hard skills,” such as tech literacy. By recognizing the importance of a tech-literate workforce, employers could start reconsidering degree requirements and creating more flexible job paths. [
Fortune
]
A relentless focus on talent is the only way to bridge a huge capability chasm, since only 5% of our survey respondents say their organizations have the capabilities they need.
On McKinsey.com
•
A need for speed.
 Organizational changes are afoot, touching everything from companies’ working models (in person versus remote) to productivity (balancing the power of generative AI with its inherent risks). Research by McKinsey senior partner 
Dana Maor
 and colleagues reveals that organizational structures often prevent leaders from responding to these shifts. By increasing speed—removing hierarchy to empower employee-led decision making—companies can be better prepared for the ongoing rapid pace of change. Forming smaller, cross-functional teams is one way to move at pace
.
•
Leadership redefined. 
Change without strong leadership can be disorienting for employees. Having the right talent in the right place and creating a culture of learning and flexibility can help companies succeed even during uncertain times. A top-down approach to understanding what people care about, from coaching opportunities to recognition for a job well done, means making leadership authentic and personal. Read our article to see four “superpowers” that can 
help CEOs appropriately respond to organizational changes
.
Focus on four areas
— Edited by Gwyn Herbein, editor, Atlanta
Was this forwarded to you? 
Sign up here
.
Or 
send us feedback
—we’d love to hear from you.
Follow our thinking
 
This email contains information about McKinsey's research, insights, services, or events. By opening our emails or clicking on links, you agree to our use of cookies and web tracking technology. For more information on how we use and protect your information, please review our 
privacy policy
.
You received this email because you subscribed to the On Point newsletter.

 | 
Unsubscribe
