subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 July 9, 2023
body:
New infographic, internal consulting workshop and more. 
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
Whether they realize it or not, training managers embody a crucial element of organizational leadership, with their efforts directly contributing to employees’ ability to keep up with social and technological change.
To equip you with the tools you need to support learners through the increasing pace of change, 
Training Industry Magazine’s Summer issue
 features articles on how you can give better feedback, help to close the digital skills gap and foster a performance-first mindset. We’re also excited to highlight our 
State of the Industry report
 on the leadership training market, an 
infographic
 on improving the employee experience and more.
As always, we love hearing from you; reach out to 
editor@trainingindustry.com
 with any article ideas, questions or suggestions. Have a great week!
Mike Allen, CPTM
Editor
[Infographic] 3 Ways Training Can Improve the Employee Experience
Study after study indicates employees who don’t have opportunities to learn and grow in their organization are more likely to be disengaged and disconnected. Our 
latest infographic
 offers three ways to enhance the employee experience through training. Download now to learn how training can boost engagement and retention by offering opportunities for growth, collaboration and connection.
Get the Infographic
 
Beyond Implementation: Internal Consulting Workshop
The most effective training professionals are not only skilled at training design and delivery, but also act as strong internal consultants who partner with business stakeholders to build and implement solutions that drive business results. Attend the next 
internal consulting master class
 on July 28 to learn more about the consulting process and the basics of contracting, as well as strategies for gaining executive buy-in.
Learn More
 
[State of the Industry Report] The Leadership Training Market
Organizations continue to see the value in internal mobility for retaining top talent and, as a result, the leadership training market remains a fast-growing sector. Our 
annual report
 uses data and market insights to cover changes in leadership development over time, the size of the current market, universal and emerging topics, and trends based on our Top 20 Leadership Training Companies List. These insights will help you better understand the leadership training market and the evolution into virtual leadership development.
Get the Report
 
Training Industry Magazine’s Summer Issue
The Summer 2023 issue of Training Industry Magazine is out now! It's up to L&D to prepare organizations for the increasing pace of change; but first, we need to align our goals and how to measure them. 
This edition
 includes articles on developing a performance-first mindset, giving better feedback, bridging the digital skills gap, designing employee competency rubrics and more. Check it out now!
Read Now
 
PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT 
The Future of L&D Is Bright: A “Bright Idea” From TICE 2023
The 2023 Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE) proved that the future of learning and development is bright: Here's why.
Read Now →
STRATEGY, ALIGNMENT AND PLANNING 
Winning the Outcomes Race Through Impact and ROI
Learn how to define success, differentiate between impact and ROI and foster collaboration for meaningful evaluation.
Read Now →
STRATEGY, ALIGNMENT AND PLANNING 
A 3-Stage Strategy to Maximize L&D’s Impact

subject: Make tough decisions with confidence.
body:
Get HBR’s Both/And Thinking Toolkit. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
BOOKS
 
 
 
 
COLLECTIONS
 
 
 
 
TOOLS
 
 
 
 
CASE STUDIES
 
 
 
HBR STORE
 
 
 
 
 
Transform challenges into opportunities 
 
Do you and your team need to make more creative, flexible and impactful decisions? Move from an "either/or" mindset to a “both/and” approach. 
 
 
 
 
 
LEARN TO:
•
Effectively tackle strategic challenges and competing demands
•
Uncover less obvious and better solutions
•
Better cope with stressful decisions and conflicting priorities
•
Avoid the same issues resurfacing again and again
•
Apply these approaches to strategy, leadership and even personal dilemmas
•
And much more
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
 
 
 
 
THE EBOOK
Our brains love to make "either/or" choices, which are limiting and can even be detrimental. In this book grounded in 20+ years of research, you’ll discover how to transform tensions into opportunities for innovation and personal growth. 
 
 
TRAINING IN A BOX
Get all you need to effectively train your team: 
•
2 training sessions ready to present
•
Detailed lesson plans for each session
•
6 original toolkit videos by the book’s authors
•
Assessments, tools, articles, case studies and more
 
 
 
BONUS CONTENT
•
5 additional article reprints
•
5 videos with supplemental information
•
3 in-depth podcasts for further exploration
 
 
 
 
 
LEARN MORE

subject: Simplilearn Collaborates With Google Cloud, Mind Tools Partners With Guider and Other L&D News ...
body:
Business News This Week
View this email in your browser
July 8, 2023
Industry News from 
Training Industry
Sign up to receive this newsletter each week
 
We are thrilled to bring you the latest news and advancements in the learning and development (L&D) space. Let's take a look at some of the notable collaborations, launches and acquisitions that are shaping the industry and empowering learners worldwide
Simplilearn has joined forces with Google Cloud to enhance learners' digital skills. This collaboration aims to equip professionals with the knowledge and expertise needed to navigate the rapidly evolving digital landscape. Mind Tools has partnered with Guider Mentoring Software to assist individuals in fostering stronger workplace connections.
Addressing the critical need for digital skills, Lumify Group has introduced Lumify Learn, a training provider committed to bridging the digital skills gap. Through innovative learning solutions, Lumify Learn aims to empower individuals and organizations to thrive in the digital age. Skillnote, a cutting-edge measurement and analytics platform, has been included in SAP's Industry Cloud Portfolio, making it easily accessible to a broader audience.
Looking for more insights? Follow us throughout the year for relevant news and announcements. 
Jessi Schue
Market Research Analyst
 
Simplilearn Collaborates With Google Cloud to Upskill Learners With Digital Skills
SAN FRANCISCO — July 6, 2023
Simplilearn, a global digital skills training provider, has teamed up with Google Cloud Learning to be able to reach over 5 million learners on the Simplilearn platform with the latest digital skills. This collaboration is designed to provide a high-quality upskilling experience to the learners with measurable outcomes, leveraging the best-in-class Google Cloud labs and content offerings. Simplilearn will integrate the guided labs and content into its programs (DevOps Engineer and Cloud Architect) in order to strengthen its learning paths to bolster its learners’ digital upskilling experience.
Read More
 
Mind Tools Partners With Guider Mentoring Software to Help People Build Better Workplace Connections
EDINBURGH, Scotland — July 5, 2023
Mentors provide invaluable knowledge, experience and guidance, and significantly increase the likelihood of an employee’s success. Yet, according to Guider’s research, only 37% of professionals have a mentor.
Read More
COMPLIANCE
Lumify Group Launches new Training Provider Lumify Learn to Make a Positive Impact on Digital Skills Shortages 
SYDNEY, Australia — July 4, 2023
  
Lumify Group, the leading provider of Information, Communications and Technology (ICT) training in Australasia, has today announced the launch of Lumify Learn (RTO no. 45994).
Read More →
MEASUREMENT AND ANALYTICS
Skillnote now Available on SAP® Store as Part of SAP’s Industry Cloud Portfolio
TOKYO — July 5, 2023
  
Skillnote Corporation announced today that its Skillnote solution is now available on SAP® Store and is part of SAP’s industry cloud portfolio for the manufacturing industry.
Read More →
WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT
The AA Uses ARuVR® to Significantly Shorten Learning Time-To-Competence and Reduces the L&D Curriculum … Safely
LONDON — July 6, 2023
  
Founded in 1905, The AA is synonymous with roadside assistance and increasingly a range of aligned automotive services. 
Read More →
PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT
Safeguard Global Announces ChatSG, the First Generative AI for the Employer of Record Market 
AUSTIN, Texas — July 5, 2023
  
Safeguard Global, the leading provider of workforce enablement solutions, today announced the launch of ChatSG, the world’s first generative AI technology for the global HR market, which delivers rapid global workforce insights.
Read More →
LEADERSHIP
THRUUE Acquired by TiER1 Performance
COVINGTON, Ky. — June 28, 2023
  
TiER1 Performance recently acquired THRUUE, a Washington, D.C.-based culture, strategy, and leadership consulting firm serving commercial and not-for-profit clients.
Read More →

body:

CURATED PICKS FOR YOUR DOWNTIME, FROM OUR EDITORS

Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
The weekend is here
 and it’s time to catch up on the week’s big reads on meeting the needs of beauty consumers, lessons from five rewired enterprises, building strong warehousing operations, and more.
 
Ulta Beauty’s Kristin Wolf speaks with McKinsey partner Pamela Brown about growth, the importance of physical stores, transforming customer experiences with generative AI, and more.
Take a portfolio approach
 
From 
doing
 digital to 
being
 digital: McKinsey’s Santiago Comella-Dorda, Eric Lamarre, Noor Narula, Julie Goran, and Kent Gryskiewicz share how five companies completely rewired their business across the enterprise.
﻿Build digital distance
 
﻿McKinsey associate partner Alan Davie and two leaders in the logistics industry discuss the current labor landscape and how to build strong warehousing operations.
Tune in
 
Our weekly briefing note on sustainable and inclusive growth explores how data can help shipping get greener, how UK workplaces can make progress on equity for Black, Bangladeshi, and Pakistani women, and more.
Get updated
QUOTE OF THE DAY
“HR and technology leaders can work hand-in-hand to maintain an inventory of skills, knowledge, and attributes correlated with high performance in technology roles in their organizations. This will mean deconstructing actual business tasks and mapping them to the organization’s strategic priorities.”
—See how HR and technology leaders can work together to addresses the needs of tech talent in “
HR rewired: An end-to-end approach to attracting and retaining top tech talent
”

subject: Kiribati
body:
Kiribati (KEE – RUH – BAS)
 
Health effects from climate change: 
https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/kiribati-remote-island-nation-faces-triple-threat-health
 
Tion Uriam (National Coordinator for Hydrography)
https://www.hydro-international.com/content/article/navigating-climate-change-kiribati-s-efforts-to-address-sea-level-rise
 
Potential partnership/sponsor for the documentary?
https://www.hydro-international.com/
Reach out to these companies too?
https://www.hydro-international.com/companies
 
Seabed 2030: 
https://seabed2030.org/
 
WW2 Battle of Tarawa: 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Tarawa
 
Recently rejoined Pacific islands diplomatic grouping: 
https://www.rfa.org/english/news/pacific/kiribati-pif-01302023211518.html
“The island country controls a vast exclusive economic zone in the Pacific Ocean including a 408,250 square kilometer (approximately 157,600 square miles) marine reserve known as the Phoenix Islands Protected Area.”
 
Phoenix Island Protected Area: 
https://whc.unesco.org/en/list/1325/
 
How to visit: 
https://www.nationalgeographic.com/travel/world-heritage/article/phoenix-islands-1
“Phoenix Islands Protected Area has no tourism infrastructure and it is difficult to travel to this pristine locale. The only transport is by private boat or by plane into the (very limited) Kanton Island airstrip. Anyone hoping to visit should begin by 
contacting the proper authorities
.”
 
BU goes to the Phoenix Islands for research:
https://www.ocean-space.org/activities/ship-to-shore-discovering-deep-sea-corals-of-the-phoenix-islands-2
https://sites.bu.edu/rotjanlab/research/pipa/
https://www.bu.edu/articles/2019/phoenix-islands-fieldwork-vlog/
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25358303/
https://worldheritageoutlook.iucn.org/explore-sites/wdpaid/555512002
Leader for the Phoenix Islands Protected Area (PIPA) science program: 
https://schmidtocean.org/person/randi-rotjan-2/
 
Ideas:
What if this time we were a little more intentional… beforehand – we meet with the group months before and have at least 4-5 major shoots pre-planned?
We could map out a distribution plan that includes packaging the documentary for free school use and partner with CPS and other districts to give teachers access to a pre-made lesson plan, resources, conversation guides, and access to the film
We could set up a form and email US based non-profits that have a climate focus and offer the opportunity to sign up for free screenings in the Fall of 2024 – we could also ask for help locating grants and private funding that they know of to sponsor the project
 
Plot points:
Hydrography (potential help to fixing the issue)
Medical issues caused by climate change (human toll of the issue before physical land completely gone)
Phoenix Island Protected Area (biodiversity at risk)
 
 
Jacob Pieczynski
(He/Him)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW

From:
 Dr. Sheila Robinson <escher@diversitywoman.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, July 6, 2023 3:43 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Statement Regarding the Supreme Court Rulings
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Affirmative Action Statement
Last week the Supreme Court delivered rulings that struck down two pillars of democracy in America. The rulings, one that overturned affirmative action in higher education and another that invalidated a Colorado anti-discrimination law that protected the rights of LGBTQ individuals, while expected, were still shocking. They will set back the steady rise towards equality in our country over the last 60 years.
 
These rulings challenge the heart of Diversity Woman Media’s mission to advance women, in particular women of color, into leadership, and to promote 
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging 
in the business sector.
 
However, these hurdles, while daunting, will not stop us. We have faced many obstacles before, and we know how to stay true, stay strong, and persevere. Long before these rulings, organizations across the country, in every sector, were mobilizing for this day. Not only will Diversity Woman Media stand tall with our countless allies, we will stay steadfastly committed to our purpose, and not miss a step in building a stronger, more diverse and inclusive workforce in which women can thrive in.
 
I urge you to join Diversity Woman Media in this new fight. Together, we can leverage the innovative tools and approaches we have already developed and successfully implemented, to develop new strategies to continue our upward trajectory, and fulfill our quest to build a more diverse and inclusive America.
 
 
 
Copyright © 2023 Diversity Woman, All rights reserved.

subject: What's New at Zoom | June 2023 Recap
body:
Dear Jacob, 
Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better, we are constantly evolving to improve your experience. To help keep you up to date, we have summarized some key new things you should know below. 
Download
 the latest version of the Zoom desktop client to access all these features and more. 
For more resources to help you stay up to date, check out: 
Preview notes
 – A list of upcoming features. This page is only available to Zoom account owners and admins; you must sign in to view them.
Release notes
 – A complete list of past releases across the Zoom platform. 
If you have questions about the features and announcements outlined below, please email customer-success-advisor@zoom.us.
*Note: Some products and features may not be available to all customers. 
Zoom Learning Center Updates
Zoom Virtual Agent admin training is here
 -
 Zoom Virtual Agent is an intelligent conversational chatbot solution that uses the latest technology to understand and quickly resolve customer issues, and admins play a critical role in configuring these solutions for their organizations. Enroll in the Zoom Learning Center’s latest course, 
Welcome to Zoom Virtual Agent
, and learn everything you need to get started today!
Zoom Webinars user training gets a refresh
 - 
The Zoom Learning Center team recently updated the 
Zoom Webinars catalog
 to include information on all the latest and greatest features and enhancements. Start your learning journey today with confidence!
Key Highlights from Zoom’s June Releases 
Zoom Desktop Client
 Updates
Meeting/Webinar Features
Zoom IQ Meeting Summary -
 Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS -
 Hosts can initiate an AI-generated summarization of the current meeting. This summary is emailed and posted to Team Chat. The ability to receive the meeting summary can be restricted to the host alone, the host along with users on their same account, or extended to all attendees of the meeting, including invitees outside of their organization. All meeting participants will be notified that the summary is being generated, and the meeting host can stop the summary at any time, if necessary. This feature is available as a free trial for Zoom Pro, Zoom Business, Zoom One Business Plus, Zoom One Enterprise, Zoom One Enterprise Plus, and Enterprise Bundle accounts. 
Team Chat Features
Screen sharing in Team Chat -
 Windows, macOS - 
Users of Team Chat can instantly share their screen during a one-on-one chat. Similar to screen sharing options in meetings, Team Chat users have the flexibility to choose what they want to share and can even share multiple screens. This feature must be enabled by Zoom and will not be immediately available, as it is dependent on a backend server update currently scheduled for June 24, 2023.
Mail and Calendar features
Mobile mail support for Japanese, Spanish, French, and German -
 Android, iOS - 
Zoom Mail UI and settings have been localized into Japanese, Spanish, French, and German languages. Previously, only English was supported.
Zoom Web
 Updates
Team Chat message retention logic -
 
Cloud storage retention logic is changed to be more simplified and predictable for group chats and channels that include members from different groups or accounts with different cloud storage retention periods. All group chats and channels will follow the cloud storage retention period of the owner for that group chat or channel. 1:1 chats will continue to use the shortest retention period between the users. Additionally, the web settings for chat retention are renamed to better convey what they control.
Change to default for Immersive Scenes setting -
 
The Immersive Scenes setting will be enabled for all accounts. Please visit the 
release notes
 for detailed information on who is affected by this change.
Enterprise feature release controls - 
Admins on Enterprise accounts will be able to manage the release of certain new features or products into their environment. Account admins can select a timeline they are comfortable with for evaluating newly released features based on their needs for testing functionality, security, and compliance that are required by their organizational policy. Releases can be done manually or set to automatic release on a specific date. Admins can also track and review the timing of these changes through the Operation Logs report.
Chat Compose with Zoom IQ 
- 
Admins can allow their users to utilize Smart Compose in Team Chat to write their messages by leveraging context from your conversation. You’ll maintain the ability to change messages by adding tone, inputting prompts, or changing the length of the message to give you confidence in what you’re communicating. This setting is available at the Account level. 
Zoom Virtual Agent
 Updates
Zendesk chat integration
 -
 Zoom Virtual Agent offers support for Zendesk chat integration, allowing businesses to seamlessly connect their Zoom Virtual Agent bot with their Zendesk instance for a better customer support experience. With this integration, end-users can easily connect with agents via chat if needed, while still using the Zoom Virtual Agent bot for initial queries.
Intercom integration - 
Account owners and admins can integrate Zoom Virtual Agent with Intercom to enable the users to chat with a live Intercom agent within the same UI.
Gorgias support channel integration -
 
A new ticket creation integration channel has been added to Zoom Virtual Agent, allowing businesses to leverage the power of the Zoom Virtual Agent bot while providing end-users with the ability to create support tickets when needed. With this integration, the Zoom Virtual Agent bot can now render a ticket form, enabling users to submit their queries or issues directly as support tickets.
Zoom Phone
 Updates
SMS support for US/Canada Toll-free phone numbers - 
Account owners and admins can enable SMS functionality for their US/Canada Toll-free phone numbers. To activate this feature, they need to fill out a verification form and submit it to Zoom Support. The verification process typically takes up to four weeks. It is important to note that there is a charge per message when using SMS with Toll-free numbers.
Zoom Events
 Updates
Zoom Sessions licensing included in Zoom One Enterprise plan
 -
 
The Zoom Sessions 1000 license is included in the Zoom One Enterprise Plus plans. Adding Zoom Sessions to Zoom One Enterprise+ unlocks the premium webinar features on Zoom and gives the user additional access to Zoom Sessions on the Zoom Events platform.
Restrict hub visibility on the Zoom web portal
 - 
Account owners and admins can control the hub visibility options that are available to hub owners on Zoom Events. They can select if hubs will be public, internal, or hidden. This setting can be locked and is available on the Zoom web portal at the account or group level.
Workspace Reservation
 Updates
Workspace Reservation Beta licenses expiration
 -
 The Workspace Reservation Beta license is extended until July 28, 2023, until users renew their licenses. After the expiration date, users must purchase a Workspace Reservation license to continue managing and utilizing their workspaces.
Zoom Contact Center
 Updates
Consumer engagement surveys
 -
 Zoom is introducing surveys for the Zoom Contact Center voice channel. This feature enables account owners and admins to create voice surveys that support various questions, including multiple-choice and long description. Surveys can be linked to voice queues. Admins can also define role permissions to determine who can view survey results on the contact center analytics dashboard. From the consumer perspective, the feature introduces post-call surveys for voice interactions. After the agent hangs up or a specified duration has passed based on the queue settings, the consumer will hear the survey questions. Consumers can respond to single-choice questions using DTMF or speech, provide ratings using DTMF or speech, and provide long descriptions using speech. This feature must be enabled by Zoom.
Changes to phone numbers without SMS 10DLC campaigns
 -
 
For accounts with US/Canada virtual private numbers for SMS, account owners and admins must have an SMS 10DLC campaign assigned to the number for that number to be used as an entry point to a flow.
Business Announcements
Zoom Software Lifecycle Policy -
 
We plan to enforce the fourth round of our Software Lifecycle Policy on August 5, 2023, for all products and services, starting with the minimum versions referenced in the table found 
here
. Users running an end-of-life version after August 5 will not be able to join meetings via the Zoom Client and will be prompted to update or join from the Web browser. As always, we highly recommend you regularly download and update to the latest version of Zoom software by checking for updates within the Zoom desktop client or by navigating to 
zoom.us/download
 to take advantage of all our latest security and functionality features.
 Note:
 The end-of-life enforcement for Zoom Room Controllers on Windows UWP has been extended to August 5, 2023. 
Happy Zooming,
Zoom Success Advisor
Click 
here
 to unsubscribe from this list or manage your preferences 
here
.

subject: How Social Helped a Fortune 100 Co. Win BIG 🤑
body:
I'm excited to share the story of how a Fortune 100 company scaled its global social selling program. 
 
 
Hi Jacob!
 
I'm excited to share one of our latest EveryoneSocial customer case studies, which details how a Fortune 100 company scaled its global social selling program. Some highlights from just 12 months:
👉 5K salespeople activated
👉 5M reach
👉 80K shares
👉 9M impressions
👉 200K clicks
Click 
here
 to get the complete case study. (There's also a PDF version you can download, which is linked at the top of the page.)
Having supported clients and their social selling programs for the last 5+ years I believe we're making the transition from early adopter to early majority.
Most of the companies, such as the one featured in this case study, are early adopters. They're visionaries. They took a risk and it paid off BIG. 🤑 In doing so, they've also helped to show the path forward.
There's no question in my mind that sales leaders and reps will regard social as being on or above par with email, phone, and text.
Buyer demographics (younger), changes in the B2B marketing world (harder, more expensive), seller demographics (younger) point toward this.
Feel free to email  me directly if you'd like to chat about anything included in the case study or the other things we're doing here at EveryoneSocial to support social selling programs.
 
And have a wonderful weekend!
 
Best,
 
Cameron Brain 
CEO & Co-Founder
EveryoneSocial
 
P.S. - Feel free to connect with me on 
LinkedIn
 or 
Twitter
!
Make sure to follow us on social media!
 
 
 
 
EveryoneSocial, 215 W Sego Lily Dr., #708100, Sandy, Utah 84070, United States

subject: Maximize Efficiency: Smart Strategies for HR Leaders
body:
Driving employee engagement and getting executive buy-in is top of mind for HR pro's. That's why we put together webinars on both. RSVP Here
 
Hi Jacob,
 
We have some exciting webinars lined up this month at Blueboard and we’d be thrilled to have you join us. Take a look at the upcoming events and RSVP below:
How to Invest in Employee Fulfillment for Organizational Success
Date: 
July 13
 @ 10:00am PST / 1:00pm EST 
Who this webinar is for:
 Currently, both managers and employees are expected to accomplish more tasks with fewer resources. The pressure to improve performance from higher levels in the company is very high. This webinar will speak directly to HR leaders and offer strategies that will not only benefit your company's people but also make your tasks simpler. 
>>> 
Reserve your spot.
 
Workshop: How to recognize and reward your people with meaning.
Date: 
July 20
 @ 10:00am PST / 1:00pm EST 
Who this webinar is for:
 This webinar is for people leaders tasked with driving greater engagement and retention. Developed from a decade of research and best practices, this hands-on workshop will empower you to build a tailored, effective recognition program that will improve employee wellbeing, boost your bottom line, and cultivate a thriving work culture. Don’t miss out - spots are filling up fast!
>>> 
Reserve your spot.
 
If you can't join live, we encourage you to register and we will send you a video recording + recap following the webinar event.
 
See you online soon!
The Blueboard Team
 
About Blueboard
Blueboard offers the world's largest marketplace of experiential employee rewards. Trusted by top people-first companies like GoPro, Shake Shack, Teladoc Health, and more, Blueboard's easy-to-use platform and unique concierge service empower companies to reward employees with meaningful, memorable experiences—at scale—boosting engagement and performance across multi-generational, global workforces.
 
Blueboard, 9740 Scranton Rd. Suite 300, San Diego, CA 92121

Hi Maura and Scott,
 
Hope it’s been a great week! Maura, good luck and congrats on whatever opportunity is next – I’m sure you’ll be missed!
 
I’m just checking in on the instructions for the website – when do you think we can anticipate getting those?
 
We’ve been in the back end to create a blog post already to keep up with our social media calendar, but there are some things we don’t want to touch without the instructions (like the events section).
 
Thank you and have a good Friday!
 
Best,
 
Jake

I also wanted to let you both know that I will be transitioning out of my role here at LCW with my last day being July 14

As for those additional items - thanks for sharing! Post-launch QA is happening this week. We'll ask our QA tester to pay extra attention to mobile and we'll include these items in our list of fixes. Hi Scott,
 
Thanks for looking into that issue! I’ve let everyone know to hang tight as it’s being looked at. 
 
We set aside some time to look at the website today and it’s looking great! There wasn’t anything beyond what we’re going to do ourselves after getting access to the backend for the desktop version – thank you! We really like the ribbons in the scrolling box on Our Approach too!
 
Mobile is looking really solid as well! There were just a couple things that didn’t seem to be working on the mobile version that we wanted to call to your attention (below). The first two screenshots are elements we were considering hiding on the homepage anyway.
 
The case studies button doesn’t seem to hyperlink correctly on the homepage (iPhone 14 max, safari)
 
 
The teal square overlaps with text on the culture-first approach section of the homepage (iPhone 14 max, safari)
The buttons don’t align in the Our Process section of the homepage (iPhone 14 max, safari)
 
Thanks again for getting this launched successfully! We’ll check back in with you on Wednesday. Enjoy the holiday! 
 
Jake

Subject:
 Re: Website Redirect Down - RE: Website is live!
 
Hi Jake,
Good morning. Thanks for the update, and we're looking into this as well to see what options we have. It does appear to be a SSL / domain forwarding issue. Whereas when you type in 
http://www.languageandculture.com
, it forwards correctly, but if instead you use https:// it does not.
Coincidentally, I actually had another site that had a similar situation in the last week, but it was with GoDaddy as the domain registrar. When I tried to get that resolved, their tech team shared that the SSL isn't available with domain forwarding, and that's why this happens. They didn't have a fix for it. Maybe I'm just stubborn or naively optimistic, but I feel like there's got to be some workaround. 
This is on our list of things we're working on, we'll let you know as soon as we can, hoping for good news here.
Thanks,
Scott
 
On Mon, Jul 3, 2023 at 9:42 AM Jake Pieczynski <

> wrote:
Hi Scott,
 
Thanks for looking into that issue! I’ve let everyone know to hang tight as it’s being looked at. 
 
We set aside some time to look at the website today and it’s looking great! There wasn’t anything beyond what we’re going to do ourselves after getting access to the backend for the desktop version – thank you! We really like the ribbons in the scrolling box on Our Approach too!
 
Mobile is looking really solid as well! There were just a couple things that didn’t seem to be working on the mobile version that we wanted to call to your attention (below). The first two screenshots are elements we were considering hiding on the homepage anyway.
 
The case studies button doesn’t seem to hyperlink correctly on the homepage (iPhone 14 max, safari)
 
 
The teal square overlaps with text on the culture-first approach section of the homepage (iPhone 14 max, safari)
The buttons don’t align in the Our Process section of the homepage (iPhone 14 max, safari)
 
Thanks again for getting this launched successfully! We’ll check back in with you on Wednesday. Enjoy the holiday! 
 
Jake

> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 3, 2023 9:41 AM
To:
 Jake Pieczynski <
j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Maura Murphy-Barrosse <
maura@buddywdd.com
>; Ashton Vicente <
a.vicente@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Website Redirect Down - RE: Website is live!
 
Hi Jake,
Good morning. Thanks for the update, and we're looking into this as well to see what options we have. It does appear to be a SSL / domain forwarding issue. Whereas when you type in 
http://www.languageandculture.com
, it forwards correctly, but if instead you use https:// it does not.
Coincidentally, I actually had another site that had a similar situation in the last week, but it was with GoDaddy as the domain registrar. When I tried to get that resolved, their tech team shared that the SSL isn't available with domain forwarding, and that's why this happens. They didn't have a fix for it. Maybe I'm just stubborn or naively optimistic, but I feel like there's got to be some workaround. 
This is on our list of things we're working on, we'll let you know as soon as we can, hoping for good news here.
Thanks,
Scott

subject: RE: Upcoming Webinar Invite Template
body:
Hi all,
 
I hope you’ve enjoyed your weeks thus far! This is a friendly reminder that we need your help getting folks to next week’s SCI webinar event. We currently have 20 registrations for the event, but we’d love that number to be closer to 40-50 to fill the room for Sarah and Vince.
 
If you have not already done so, please make some time to invite your clients and prospects. This is a great on-ramp for talking about long-term vision and strategy!
 
Thank you and happy Friday!
 
Jake

subject: ⚕️U.S. Surgeon General's Report on Loneliness: Key Insights for HR
body:
Jacob, we read the 82-page report so you don't have to: Get the key takeaways and ways you can drive connection within your teams today.
  
 
 
 
📣 TOPIC OF THE MONTH:
How Companies Can Help Combat Loneliness + Isolation 
Loneliness is a silent crisis that affects individuals across society, with significant implications for overall well-being. In fact, the U.S. Surgeon General recently released 
an advisory about the “epidemic of loneliness and isolation”
, which lays out a framework for a “National Strategy to Advance Social Connection” – but 
the issue is truly a global one
. 
 
As an HR professional or people leader, what exactly should you and your organization be taking away from this comprehensive 82-page report? 
 
In 
our latest blog
, we distilled the top six recommendations so you can take action 
now 
– because this can't and shouldn't have to wait. 
READ ON ➜
 
 
 
 
Checklist: 3 Ways to Start Building Connection Today 👥
 
 
✅ Start Here: Connection Assessment
Pop quiz: 
How effectively is your organization fostering genuine connections throughout the entire employee lifecycle? Is there room for improvement? Take our 
short connection assessment
 to find out. 
FIND OUT ➜
 
 
 
 
 
✅ 
Dig Deeper: 3 Kinds of Connection That Cultivate Belonging
Get our 
science-based guide
 to help you facilitate communication and give your employees more control over their own journeys.
 
LET ME SEE ➜
 
 
 
 
 
✅ 
Level Up: 6K New Connections in 24 Hours
In this 
quick video
, you'll hear from Enboarder CEO Brent Pearson about how we built more than 6,000 connections in just 24 hours – and you'll get a sneak peek into how our new People Cards can help foster connection within your team.
WATCH IT ➜
 
 
 
Coming Soon! Events, Episodes, Extras...
Oh My!
 
WEBINAR
Human Connection and the New World of Work
JUL 13 @ 1 PM CDT
 
SAVE YOUR SEAT ➜
 
WEBINAR
Rethinking Human Connection for a Hybrid Work World
JUL 27 @ 1 PM CDT
 
SAVE YOUR SEAT ➜
Hungry for more? 
Access our best webinars 
on-demand, anytime!
 
 
in Dermalogica's positive engagement since starting with Enboarder.
LEARN HOW THEY DID IT ➜
 
 
👋 Let us help connect the dots!
Our team of people experts can help you create a game plan to tackle loneliness and start driving connection and belonging in your people programs today.
LET'S CHAT!
 
 
Feel like you're receiving a bit too many (or not enough) emails from us?
You can always

subject: The rise of social commerce—and other social media trends businesses should know
body:
How to get social media right ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
The social network effect
In the news
•
Tik, Tok, shop.
 After getting its start on Chinese social media, livestream shopping is growing in the US, with one research firm predicting that the country’s sales could reach $50 billion by the end of the year. To capture growing demand, several e-commerce and social media companies are developing platforms that enable live product demonstrations and real-time purchases. One influencer and live-shopping show host said that consumers will sometimes buy up to 3,000 products in a single show. [
CNBC
]
•
Influencing by another name? 
A new group of online trendsetters called “deinfluencers” are telling their followers what 
not
 to buy. Typically, they try to dissuade users from purchasing overpriced products and participating in what they perceive as wasteful trends. While deinfluencers can keep brands honest, they’re still part of the overall social media hype cycle—and might even be paid by rival brands, a social media analyst shares. [
CNN
]
Globally, the social-commerce market is expected to grow to more than $2 trillion by 2025.
On McKinsey.com
•
Waiting to hear back.
 McKinsey has identified social media’s four primary functions for businesses, including using social channels to respond to consumer requests. While companies face growing pressure to be present and responsive online, only about half are meeting expectations for response time on social media, per a recent study. Addressing online complaints quickly could increase shoppers’ positive feelings about a brand while delivering a great customer experience, McKinsey senior partner 
Renny Thomas
 and colleagues explain.
•
Bye-bye, brand loyalty. 
Three-quarters of customers changed the way they shopped, the products they bought, or tried a new store during the COVID-19 pandemic, senior partner 
Kelsey Robinson
 and coauthors find. In a time of decreasing consumer loyalty, companies that personalize their social media channels may improve performance. Tailoring messages to individuals can lower customer acquisition costs, increase revenue, and drive conversions, studies show. For more on social commerce, the latest social media strategies and trends, and key business risks, explore our 
McKinsey Explainer
 on social media
.
Get the download on social media
— Edited by Joy Merten, editor, Chicago

Sign up here
.
Or 
send us feedback
—we’d love to hear from you.

subject: What different generations really want from the workplace
body:
People are people ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
Share this email
 
 
Share this email on 
LinkedIn
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Twitter
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Facebook
  
 
 
 
 
AN ARTICLE A DAY, PICKED BY OUR EDITORS
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
Gen Z. Millennials. Gen X. Boomers.
 Do employees from these different demographic groups 
really
 want different things at work? McKinsey talent leaders 
Bryan Hancock
 and Bill Schaninger explore this question in a 
new episode
 of the 
McKinsey Talks Talent
 podcast. Drawing from recent McKinsey research on generational preferences, they talk about age-based stereotypes and myths that are present in the modern workplace and also suggest how managers can foster connections and meaning within and across multigenerational teams. Tune in to better understand the needs of employees of all ages.
 
Making sense of generational stereotypes at work
Boomers to the left of you; Gen Z to the right. Are we really so bafflingly different?
People are people  
Quote of the day
“It is love for the people we serve—this passion to create something extraordinary for them, that’s the priority. You are not a high-performing individual if you don’t have these traits in you.”
—
Mauro Porcini, chief design officer at PepsiCo, on high-performing teams in “
The Committed Innovator: The power of
 design
”
Chart of the day
 
See today’s chart
ALSO NEW
HR rewired: An end-to-end approach to attracting and retaining top tech talent
Technology companies are shedding the very talent that incumbent players need to meet their own digital objectives. Here’s what HR teams in traditional organizations can do to capitalize.
Adopt an end-to-end approach 
 
What’s on the menu? Revenue growth techniques for restaurants
By mastering revenue growth management—ensuring that pricing, promotions, and menu offerings are all working together—US restaurants can serve up profitable growth.
Start your journey  
Unleashing developer productivity with generative AI
A McKinsey study shows that software developers can complete coding tasks up to twice as fast with generative AI. Four actions can maximize productivity and minimize risks.
Take 4 actions 
 
— Edited by Joyce Yoo
,
 editor, New York

subject: Showcase Your Learning Strategy Solutions at Virtual TICE
body:
Help L&D decision-makers build a learning strategy this fall!
View this email  in your browser
September 2023 —– Online Everywhere —– 1000+ Learning Leaders.
At the 
virtual Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)
, we bring together learning leaders and experts from across the globe for meaningful collaboration and knowledge sharing. This year, our focus is on learning and development (L&D) strategy and equipping training professionals with the skills and confidence they need to align their programs to organizational goals.
Fall TICE provides sponsors the unique opportunity to get in front of L&D decision-makers as they are preparing their 2024 budgets. As a sponsor, you will interact with corporate training professionals who are actively exploring ideas and solutions to benefit their organization’s learning initiatives in 2024.
If you’d like to meet hundreds of learning leaders who are shaping their organization’s L&D plan, consider one of our limited sponsorship opportunities: 
Diamond
: a live 60-minute keynote session and a virtual booth.
Sapphire
: a live 30-minute featured session and a virtual booth.
Emerald
: a virtual booth for assets including videos, images, downloadable PDFs and a personal meeting room.
Learn about TICE sponsorships 
here
 
and feel free to

subject: Full Calendar - Upcoming Events
body:
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events, each accredited by SHRM and HRCI, unless otherwise noted.
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events
Our weekly 
webinars
 are each 60 minutes, complimentary to attend, and qualify for 1 credit from SHRM and HRCI.
Our monthly half-day 
virtual conferences 
include keynote, fireside chat, and panel discussions on our virtual main stage, as well as workshop sessions, chat, and one-on-one networking opportunities that facilitate interaction with our presenters and your fellow participants. They each qualify for 3 credits from SHRM and HRCI.
Our 
live events
 are coming to a city near you. Each one-day conference brings together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, talent acquisition, diversity, employee engagement, benefits, and CSR for an engaging, up-to-the-minute conversation about how employers can build stronger bonds of trust and connection with their workers and their communities. They each qualify for 4 credits from SHRM and HRCI. 
WEBINAR
 
July 11: Attract Loyal Hourly Workers by Diversifying Your Sourcing Strategy
Job boards are slowly becoming a thing of the past. Applicants use them to apply to multiple jobs at once—rather than to find the job they’re really excited about. To increase your chances of hiring hourly workers who are more likely to stick around, you need to implement a diverse, active sourcing strategy. Join industry expert Jackie Adams, to learn the top strategies businesses can employ to increase applicant quality and build a stronger hourly workforce. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
July 19: Innovation in Family Health: How Companies Can Take Personalized Approach 
Family health has taken on new dimensions over the past few years, as employers have recognized that in geographically distributed workplaces, employees face different circumstances when it comes to the availability and quality of fertility care, pediatric care, child care, education, and after-school programming. How can companies invested in family-friendly and caregiving benefits adapt to the variety of needs in their workforces? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
July 26: The New Keys to Employee Satisfaction, Recognition, and Retention
The right combination of total rewards, career advancement, and corporate purpose has been a moving target in recent years as workers reconsider their priorities. How can companies accentuate the benefits of sticking with  their organizations, emphasizing factors including personal growth, fulfillment, and benefits tailored to their individual needs? Which tools can accurately measure employee satisfaction, and how can managers augment their effect? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
August 3: 
How the Definition of Total Rewards Is Changing
The broadening scope of rewards is helping employers respond to more diverse needs, as well as giving employers the ability to focus on rewards that provide the biggest impact. What are the newest and most effective rewards, ranging from relocation programs and scholarships to management development and employee recognition? How can companies evaluate these diverse programs in a way that has emotional impact but represent efficient business practices? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
August 8: Filling the Gaps in Your Healthcare Benefits to Make Them More Inclusive
To provide personalized medical-benefit plans for an increasingly diverse workforce, employers need to find the shortcomings in their offerings and explore innovative ways to fix them. Workers today have higher expectations when it comes to employer support for family-building, wellness, and mental health. What kind of surveys and other tools can companies use to assess the needs of their workforce? In a marketplace with many point solutions, how can employers find the right mix for their workers? From the POV of the employees, what are the most inclusive ways to help them navigate the complex healthcare system? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
August 9: The Changing Profile of HR Leaders: How the Role Is Evolving and Growing
In just the past two years, HR has risen to the C-suite level in influence and responsibility. How should HR leaders respond in terms of preparing for changing roles, managing their new duties, and charting their own career paths? What can HR leaders do to leverage their new prominence to make change happen across the whole organization? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
August 17: When Belonging Is Broken: How an Intervention Can Strengthen Your Organization’s Culture
When a company has a healthy culture of belonging, it reaps many benefits: high performance, highly engaged employees, psychological safety, and the freedom to be authentic. But many organizations drift into the opposite condition. They suffer from ineffective practices for diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI). One of the symptoms is inadvertently excluding some in an attempt to include others. How can companies recognize when they need an intervention? What steps should they take to reverse the syndrome–and who should manage the process? What will it look like when they embed belonding at the team and organizational level? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
September 12: Boston, Massachusetts
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
September 19: Ageism in Industries
Ageism remains the open secret in the advertising, marketing and branding categories. Subtle discrimination is vaguely disguised in commercials and employer branding, especially in the beauty and tech industries. Often times the About Us and Meet our Team landing pages can tell you more about a brand than the nicely polished imagery. If you’re an organization that struggles to attract and retain experienced talent, join AARP Sr Advisor Heather Tinsley-Fix and New & Improved Principal Lisa Balser for a discussion on how ageism shows up in marketing and how employers can signal and implement a more inclusive culture. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
September 20: Building A Healthy Work Environment to Persevere Through Multiple Challenges
Organizations offering health care and wellness benefits maintain a stronger sense of employee loyalty. Yet health and well-being among employees goes beyond acute or specific physical or mental health needs. How can companies create a culture that emphasizes health through everyday experience? What are the hidden opportunities to nurture this kind of culture? Rather than relying only on standard  benefits to respond in times of unexpected distress, how can organizations address employee needs proactively? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
September 26: Manhattan, New York
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
September 27: Giving Workers Direction About Skills and Career Development
Many workers yearn to grow and advance in their careers, yet don’t have an understanding of how to develop their skills and experience  for a role with more responsibility. Learning and  development can help not only by showing the many possibilities, but also with vision to help employees find the learning and development path that will enable the most fulfilling growth according to their own interests. What can organizations do to deploy coaching in a way that helps not only with short-term goals but also the long arc of a worker’s career? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
October 3: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
October 10: Why Women’s Health Benefits are Essential to Retention, Affordability
Women’s health can be a high cost driver for employers. Additionally, offering solutions to improve and support needs specific to women can also be an important factor to retention. But, women’s health in general is not just one condition. Join us for this fireside chat where Ovia Health Chief Medical Officer, Dr. Leslie Saltzman, explains the different facets of women’s health (like menopause, fertility, maternity care management, etc.), what areas generate the most ROI and how employers can offer the deepest, and most all-encompassing benefits to support and delight their employees and medically supported dependents. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
October 11: How HR Technology Can Connect, Motivate, and Recognize the Hybrid Workforce
Most workers have strongly embraced hybrid and remote work arrangements, having settled into sustainable routines that allow them to be productive. But camaraderie and a sense of belonging have proven elusive without meaningful face-to-face contact and team-building opportunities. How can organizations create new structures for in-person gatherings that maintain the comfort of remote or hybrid work, as well as new digital approaches that create the ties that bind? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
October 18: Denver, Colorado
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
November 2: Los Angeles, California
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
November 8: Casting a Wider Net: Fresh, Productive Approaches to Diversity Recruiting
Many companies fall short of their diversity-hiring goals because they keep looking in the same places–and with the same techniques and expectations. What are the best ways for employers to break out of these patterns? How can they reconsider their job specifications to bring in more non-traditional candidates and prospects who could thrive with a modest amount of training and upskilling? What are the new and innovative ways to strengthen a diverse pipeline? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
November 9: Bridging the Distance: How Tech Can Boost Engagement and Recognition
The broadening scope of rewards is helping employers respond to more diverse needs, as well as giving employers the ability to focus on rewards that provide the biggest impact. What are the newest and most effective rewards, ranging from relocation programs and scholarships to management development and employee recognition? How can companies evaluate these diverse programs in a way that has emotional impact but represent efficient business practices? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
November 14: Miami, Florida
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
December 13: The Arc of Change for People and Culture in 2024
Recent history affirms that unpredictable events will buffet the workplace of 2024, yet the trajectory of trends in 2023 gives an indication of how organizations will need to be ready for changing expectations among workers and other stakeholders. What are the emerging patterns that leaders should watch in the realms of diversity and inclusion, talent acquisition, employee rewards, learning and development, social responsibility and sustainability? What new points of focus will arrive in the greater field of people and culture? 
Register now
.

subject: 🗓️ Your July event lineup is here!
body:
Career Growth, The Impact of AI on HR, In-Person Culture Clubs & more!
 
Your July event lineup is here! 
Register for our hyper-practical, live sessions for People Ops and HR folks!
 
👉*Psst! We're experimenting with a brand new platform to showcase all our amazing events, so brace yourself for a fresh look! If you come across any hiccups or have burning questions, shoot us an email at events@lifelabslearning. We're here to help!
 
We all know the problem: employees crave growth. Managers want their direct reports to grow. Companies are in urgent need of skilled, inspired employees. Yet somehow it's still difficult to catalyze the career growth everyone wants. In this mini-workshop by LifeLabs Learning, we'll share tools, frameworks, and experiments you can immediately use at your company to deepen your career growth culture and systems.
Register today!
 
 
Can't make the first session? No worries!
 
We've got you covered!
 Join us on 
July 25 
for this
 mini-workshop by LifeLabs Learning; we'll share tools, frameworks, and experiments you can immediately use at your company to deepen your career growth culture and systems.
Register today!
 
 
Hey there, Seattle! 🏙️Culture Club is returning! Get ready to join in on the fun and connect (
yes, in-person!
) with other awesome HR and People Ops leaders in the Seattle area. We'll share helpful tools, frameworks, and experiments that you can start using right away to enhance the growth culture and systems at your company. Don't miss out on this one-of-a-kind opportunity to network and learn!
Register today!
 
 
Calling all HR and People Ops professionals: how do you feel about Artificial Intelligence (AI) and what it means for the HR profession and employee experience? If these emojis capture your emotions 🤯😱🤓🤩, then we have an event for you! 
Join us on 
July 20th
 for a virtual discussion about emerging trends in AI and their implications for HR and People Ops leaders. 
This virtual panel is open to HR professionals, leaders, and enthusiasts from all industries. No prior knowledge of AI technologies is required!
Register today!
 
 
📣 Attention all People Ops/HR professionals in Los Angeles - Mark your calendar for July 20th, because 
Culture Club is coming back to LA! 
Join us at Culture Club, 
in person
, for an evening of skill-building, idea-sharing, and networking with other HR and People Ops professionals in the LA area. We'll share tools, frameworks, and experiments you can immediately use at your company to deepen your career growth culture and systems. 
Register today!
 
🤗Sharing is caring! Know a People Ops person who might want to join a session? 
Feel free to forward this invite.
 
Want to check out training options for your company?
Meet with a LifeLabs Learning Program Consultant 
via Zoom to get assistance on your approach to Learning & Development planning. 
Speak with a Consultant
 
30-minutes. Immediate benefits. Zero pressure.
 
 
 
LifeLabs Learning is the go-to leadership training company for managers, execs, and teams at innovative companies like Slack, Glossier, Lyft, Venmo, and BlackRock.
LifeLabs Learning locations: Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Los Angeles, New York City, San Francisco, Seattle, Global

Gina Pacheco

757-651-1634

Date:

Jake Pieczynski <j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
Follow up and feedback
Hi Jake,
How are you doing? It seems like it’s been a while since I’ve reached out to you.  We sure have been busy trying to run this business, grow it, and (of course) provide excellent client service.  That being said, how has your experience been working with us?  What would you say are our strengths and weaknesses. We are heading into our first full year as a S-corp, and heading into year two, I’d like to find ways to improve.  Your candid feedback will be greatly appreciated.
 
Thank you for your support!

subject: ✉️ You're Invited! Learning with LCW Webinar
body:
Reserve your seat for our July Learning with LCW webinar: Creating a Culture of Inclusion that Fosters High Performance.
 
Learning with LCW Webinar
Reserve Your Seat
 
In the last three years, organizations have taken unprecedented steps to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging in their organizations. Have their efforts been successful? Creating impact that is both measurable and sustainable is both the most vital and most difficult aspect of DEIB work as well as of culture work more broadly.
 
LCW’s Sustainable Culture of Inclusion (SCI) Model serves as a framework for understanding organizational maturity. LCW believes that the cultural diversity inherent in all organizations is an asset that can be leveraged to build high performance, and that sustainable cultures of inclusion are the foundation for this success. Ultimately, the goal is to create a Sustainable Culture of Inclusion that produces both a positive working experience and equitable outcomes for employees.
In this session, we will:
Share the genesis & structure of the SCI Model
Discuss how we use the SCI model to diagnose organizations’ current state
Provide two case studies that demonstrate the model’s impact 
Facilitated by:
 
 
Sarah Nodarse
Principal Consultant, LCW
 
 
Vince Bongiovanni
Associate Consultant, LCW
 
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2023 LCW, All rights reserved.
LCW, 4753 N Broadway, Floor 2, Chicago, Illinois 60640, USA

subject: Stay Ahead of the Curve: Essential Marketing Insights and Events from 1H 2023
body:
Discover trending marketing insights from the first half of 2023. 
This message contains graphics. If you do not see the graphics, 
click here to view.
 
 
 
 
3 Techniques to Prove Marketing Value 
In times of economic uncertainty, CMOs need a strategy to protect their budgets and, with it, their results. 
Download the research
 to discover three techniques to prove the value of marketing to critical stakeholders.
Download the Research
 
 
The State of Marketing Budget and Strategy in 2023 
As volatility becomes the new normal, CMOs must price disruption into their annual marketing budget. 
Use this guide
 to see how CMOs are allocating their budgets and benchmark your budget against peer priorities across channels and resources. 
Download the Guide
 
 
How Should CMOs Respond to ChatGPT Today? 
As marketers explore ChatGPT without restriction, CMOs must establish policy and controls. 
Explore the insights
 and get recommendations on what CMOs can do to combat challenges as ChatGPT’s usage is on the rise. 
Download the Insights
 
 
The Digital IQ Index Genius Brands 
Gartner uses its Digital IQ Index to measure a brand’s digital marketing performance across more than a thousand data points to quantify aptitude and maturity relative to industry peers. 
Explore this research
 to drive greater value with digital channels. 
Download the Research
 
Top Virtual Events 
• 
The Gartner CMO Spend and Strategy Survey 2023: Refocus Your Marketing Priorities
 
• 
Position Your Brand to Drive Business Outcomes
 
• 
Orchestrate High-value B2B Buyer Engagement Across Channels

subject: Communication Lessons from a Nobel Laureate
body:
We examined the remarkable career of Nobel Prize-winning journalist Maria Ressa and the invaluable lessons she imparts on the realms of public relations and marketing. 
View as a webpage
 
Communication Lessons from Nobel Laureate Maria Ressa
GET THE LESSONS
 
 
 
Hi 
Jacob
,
We live in an era where brands are held to the highest ethical standards by their stakeholders. Yet many brands struggle to communicate how they are living their purpose and values in a way that is perceived as authentic and sincere. That is what makes the career of Nobel Prize-winning journalist Maria Ressa so remarkable – and so inspiring. 
In the fourth article of our Masters of Communication series, we examine how Ressa has used her platform as a journalist and business leader to speak truth to power, build trust and combat disinformation.
READ IT NOW
 
As public relations and strategic communications professionals, it is crucial for us to stay ahead of the curve and continuously evolve our skill sets. Learning from exemplary individuals like Maria Ressa helps us broaden our perspectives, embrace innovation, and approach our work with renewed enthusiasm and purpose. 
Read the article to discover practical insights that can elevate your professional journey while inspiring your team to harness the power of communication to create a positive impact. 
Best,
Cision

300 S Riverside Plaza Chicago, IL 60601, USA

subject: Learn what the numbers really mean.
body:
If you’re not a “numbers person,” HBR’s Financial Intelligence Set is for you. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
BOOKS
COLLECTIONS
TOOLS
CASE STUDIES
HBR STORE
 
 
 
Conquer your fear of finance
 
 
HBR’s 
Financial Intelligence Set: What You Need to Know to Succeed
 will enable you to mine every bit of meaning from the financial reports that cross your desk, employ financial techniques that can multiply your effectiveness, and foresee business opportunities that remain invisible to others. If you’re not a “numbers person,” this collection is the way to learn what you’ve always needed to know.
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
In the collection:
 
 
HBR Guide to Finance Basics for Managers Ebook + Tools
 provides the fundamentals of financial literacy, offering tips on reading and deciphering financial statements, preparing a breakeven analysis, how to speak the language of ROI, and more.
 
 
 
 
 
Financial Intelligence: A Manager's Guide to Knowing What the Numbers Really Mean
 lays the foundation for a deep understanding of the financial side of business and arms managers with practical strategies for improving performance. 
 
 
 
 
 
How Finance Works
 uses entertaining case studies, interactive exercises, full-color visuals, and a conversational style to show how finance really works. 
 
 
 
 
 
HBR Tools: EBITDA
 (Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, Amortization) will help you master the key concepts of EBITDA, whether you’re a finance novice or just need a refresher. 
 
 
 
 
 
HBR Guide to Data Analytics for Managers Ebook + Tools
 will help managers tease insight from data to understand where it comes from, make sense of the numbers, and use those findings to inform decisions. 
 
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
Discover more tools
Master finance skills with more books, collections, and tools. Learn more today.
 
SHOP NOW
 
 
To redeem, simply enter 
HBRORGREG4
 in the Promotional Code field at checkout. Discount will be applied to your order subtotal of your first purchase only.

subject: Never too tired to make a sale, generative AI is reshaping marketing at lightning speed
body:
Six ‘no regrets’ AI strategies ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
Cyborg sales
In the news
•
Endless ad copy.
 Companies that need marketing and advertising services—and the marketing services that need companies to hire them—are embracing a new tool that may also pose new risks. It’s generative AI (gen AI), and it can pump out infinite lingo, jingles, and catch phrases at little cost. While marketers delight in tech that can cut the cost of an ad campaign by 90%, fears of intellectual-property disputes and digital-ad giants taking an even greater piece of the pie abound. Copywriters and graphic designers also have much to gain—and to lose—as AI creeps deeper into the industry. [
WSJ
]
•
Boss talk.
 A recent survey of 82 senior marketing executives revealed that they expect gen AI to help them cut costs by an average of 13%—and 19% of respondents think that reducing internal head counts will make up the bulk of those savings. More than 60% of respondents said they think AI will help create new kinds of content, while 78% said it will lead to greater efficiency. Nearly half of the respondents predict their teams will shrink due to AI, and nearly half predict that marketing budgets will gradually be reduced. [
WSJ
]
At successful companies, we’ve found there is a clearly defined AI vision and strategy and more than 20% of digital budgets are invested in AI-related technologies.
On McKinsey.com
•
Sales partner. 
A fifth of current sales-team functions could be automated, and organizations that invest in AI are seeing revenue grow by 3 to 15%, report McKinsey senior partner 
Steve Reis
 and fellow authors. Generative AI is particularly good at generating personalized content and communication, due to its ability to analyze customer characteristics, behavior, and preferences. While AI can speak directly to potential customers with personalized emails and chatbots, it can also function as an assistant to human salespeople, offering advice and reminders.
•
Steps to success. 
Companies can take six no-regrets steps to transform sales and marketing teams with AI. First, they can conduct an AI audit that evaluates how gen AI could fit in. Second, they can form a commercial gen-AI taskforce to explore opportunities. Next, by identifying low-risk use cases, they can begin testing; they can also start training the sales team in the basics to inspire further experimentation. Finally, companies can establish guidelines that protect sensitive customer data and establish a process for verifying output. Learn more about 
getting a gen-AI strategy under way in marketing and sales
.
Gain real intelligence
— Edited by Katy McLaughlin, senior editor, Southern California

subject: Career-changing insights from the experts in management thinking
body:
Wherever you are in your professional journey, HBR can help you level up your skills. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
Read online
 
Wherever you are in your leadership journey, HBR offers the research and insights you need to level up. Explore articles on these key topics and many more: 
 
Managing yourself
 – Leveling up your leadership skills starts with knowing how to manage yourself. 
 
Leadership and managing people
 – Get insights on all aspects of managing people and leading a team. 
 
Business communication
 – Learn how to better communicate in the business world. 
Don’t wait to level up your leadership skills! Subscribe today to get access to unlimited articles on these topics and many more. 
LEARN MORE
 
Engaging and nurturing employees
Employee retention rates are a huge factor in an organization’s success. With the rise of remote jobs, the trend of quiet quitting, and concerns about employee’s mental health, engaging and nurturing employees is even more critical.
Check out these timely articles for insights on how to engage and nurture a team.
5 Questions to Help Your Employees Find Their Inner Purpose
High-Performing Teams Don’t Leave Relationships to Chance
Stop Telling Women They Have Imposter Syndrome
Why Microsoft Measures Employee Thriving, Not Engagement
13 Signs That Someone is About to Quit, According to Research

subject: What Mexican consumers want: results from McKinsey’s latest consumer sentiment survey
body:
Dive into the data ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

AN ARTICLE A DAY, PICKED BY OUR EDITORS
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
What’s the latest on consumer sentiment and behavior in Mexico? 
According to a McKinsey survey of more than 1,000 Mexican consumers across income groups, they are feeling more optimistic about their finances and the country’s economy but are continuing to look for ways to spend less. To reduce spending, Mexican consumers are eating and cooking at home, and shopping online in search of cheaper products, particularly items such as cosmetics, consumer electronics, toys, and baby supplies. For more insights and highlights from the survey, check out this 
new article
 by McKinsey’s Fernando Hiraoka and Diego Martin Del Campo
.
 
Mexican consumers seek value and convenience—and find it online
Our latest consumer sentiment survey in Mexico reveals lasting pandemic effects on consumer behavior, including reduced spending and more online shopping.
Dive into the data
Quote of the day
“Shipping has to transform. It’s hard to find another industry that is as ripe for disruption as shipping and where technology can have such a large impact. It felt like a unique opportunity in history that I had to jump on.”
—Pelle Sommansson, the chief operating officer of ZeroNorth, on what inspired him to go into shipping in “
Logistics Disruptors: Data-driven insights for greener shipping
”
Chart of the day
 
See today’s chart
ALSO NEW
The Committed Innovator: The power of design
PepsiCo chief design officer Mauro Porcini describes how humanity and authenticity drive innovation, and the ‘unicorn’ superpowers vital to leading from the heart.
Love what you do 
 
﻿
Forward Thinking on bringing the joy to economics with Betsey Stevenson and Justin Wolfers
“Our economics, the economics I get to do, my colleagues at the university when I walk down the hallway, this is just the most exciting water-cooler conversation in the world.” Two University of Michigan professors talk about their highly relevant—joyous—take on economics.
Listen in 
﻿
The agricultural transition: Building a sustainable future
Sustainable farming is necessary for decarbonization. But to get the world to net zero, the agriculture sector must take action along the entire value chain.
Download the full report 
 
﻿
— Edited by Joyce Yoo
,
 editor, New York

subject: Preview -
body:
Learning with LCW Webinar
Reserve Your Seat
 
In the last three years, organizations have taken unprecedented steps to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging in their organizations. Have their efforts been successful? Creating impact that is both measurable and sustainable is both the most vital and most difficult aspect of DEIB work as well as of culture work more broadly.
 
LCW’s Sustainable Culture of Inclusion (SCI) Model serves as a framework for understanding organizational maturity. LCW believes that the cultural diversity inherent in all organizations is an asset that can be leveraged to build high performance, and that sustainable cultures of inclusion are the foundation for this success. Ultimately, the goal is to create a Sustainable Culture of Inclusion that produces both a positive working experience and equitable outcomes for employees.
In this session, we will:
Share the genesis & structure of the SCI Model
Discuss how we use the SCI model to diagnose organizations’ current state
Provide two case studies that demonstrate the model’s impact 
Facilitated by:
 
 
Sarah Nodarse
Principal Consultant, LCW
 
 
Vince Bongiovanni
Associate Consultant, LCW
