I apologize that I've been terrible at checking my emails as of late and that this escaped me. I'm guessing the chances to complete this have passed, but if you're still looking for feedback in any capacity or for specific pages that you're still unsure about, I'd be more than happy to help before the potential launch date. I did take some time previously to review the most recent draft.
 
Again, sorry I was unable to reach back out in a timely manner, but I will say I was impressed by their work and am excited for the launch.
Please let me know if there's any way I can help at this point.
 
James
 
On Fri, Jun 16, 2023 at 8:45 AM Jake Pieczynski <
j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hi James,
 
I’m reaching out to you about the new LCW website. We’re on track for a June 30 launch date and are looking for volunteers to review the final site’s copy before launch. 
 
If you were to be a website reviewer, you would:
Receive a one-hour calendar block within the next week to review the website on your own using staging site login information
Be asked to provide full website feedback, but be given 2-5 specific pages to focus on
Record your feedback in a tracker
Send your feedback back to Jake at the end of your one-hour review block
 
Please reply to this email by end of day if you’d be willing to provide your feedback and can commit to this timeline!
 
Thank you for your help!
 
Jake

Subject:
 Request for next week's consulting meeting - Rebrand SOP
 
Hi Dan, Sarah, and Tamara,
 
Happy Friday! I’m reaching out this morning to follow-up on the training materials rebranding SOP we took a look at together a few weeks back. Our website and social channels will officially switch over to our new brand on Monday and Alisa and Chuck will be reaching out to the team to announce this change and with some additional instructions on how to update personal devices/channels accordingly.
 
Can you please help get this rebrand SOP in front of the consulting team during next week’s weekly consulting meeting and help reenforce the importance of following this process? 
 
I’ve attached the SOP document to this message – there have been a couple minor changes, but the SOP for this process largely remains the same. Design is working on a set list of first priority items and as we sell new products they will need to be added to a tracker to be updated before delivery.
 
We will also be making time in the July All Staff meeting to talk about the individual computer updates requested and the rebranding SOP process, but we appreciate your help getting this in front of the consulting team before then so that’s not the first time they’re learning about it. Additionally, Dustin, Ashton, or I can certainly join any team meetings you think would be helpful – just let us know if this is something you’d like!
 
Thank you!
 
Ashton, Dustin, and Jake
 
Jacob Pieczynski

 Dustin Puehler <d.puehler@lcwmail.com>; Ashton Vicente <a.vicente@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Request for next week's consulting meeting - Rebrand SOP
 
Hi Dan, Sarah, and Tamara,
 
Happy Friday! I’m reaching out this morning to follow-up on the training materials rebranding SOP we took a look at together a few weeks back. Our website and social channels will officially switch over to our new brand on Monday and Alisa and Chuck will be reaching out to the team to announce this change and with some additional instructions on how to update personal devices/channels accordingly.
 
Can you please help get this rebrand SOP in front of the consulting team during next week’s weekly consulting meeting and help reenforce the importance of following this process? 
 
I’ve attached the SOP document to this message – there have been a couple minor changes, but the SOP for this process largely remains the same. Design is working on a set list of first priority items and as we sell new products they will need to be added to a tracker to be updated before delivery.
 
We will also be making time in the July All Staff meeting to talk about the individual computer updates requested and the rebranding SOP process, but we appreciate your help getting this in front of the consulting team before then so that’s not the first time they’re learning about it. Additionally, Dustin, Ashton, or I can certainly join any team meetings you think would be helpful – just let us know if this is something you’d like!
 
Thank you!
 
Ashton, Dustin, and Jake
 
Jacob Pieczynski
(He/Him)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW

subject: Automatic reply: All Staff Asks/Meeting time
body:
Hi Team!
 
I'll be OOO from Monday 6/26 to Friday 6/30. I'll be back online on Monday, 7/3.  
 
Thank you for your patience,

subject: All Staff Asks/Meeting time
body:
Briza! 
 
I hope you’re having a wonderful time away and don’t see this until Monday!
 
A couple quick things for your return:
 
Can we please add two things to the All Staff agenda for July 12?
Following up on personal computer/channel updates for the rebrand
                                                    
i.
     
I wrote an email for Alisa/Chuck to send on Monday that announces the brand launch and gives out instructions on updating computers, email signatures, social channels, etc.
                                                   
ii.
     
Folks will have these materials and can start updating on their own immediately next week
                                                  
iii.
     
This time would be to review any processes that are giving folks trouble/or demonstrate how to execute some of the more complicated processes live
                                                  
iv.
     
15 minutes?
Training material rebrand SOP 
                                                    
i.
     
Consultants will be presented with a CLT approved rebrand process that will have them coordinate with design to update needed materials with rebranded identity standards
                                                   
ii.
     
This time would be Dustin and I summarizing the process and taking questions that the team has
                                                  
iii.
     
10 minutes?
Alisa asked me to meet with you to talk about my transition – I’m honestly not really sure why but she made it seem like you were doing this with other folks too… I’ll schedule time and you’ll see that request come through, but please know I’m going to be very blunt with anyone that tries to say you can take over anything on our list and tell them that you are capable of doing it but it’s not your job/you can’t be expected to just pick up everything… so please don’t think I’m scheduling this time to tell you I’m recommending you take over our tasks 
 
Enjoy the rest of your time off!!
 
Jake
 
Jacob Pieczynski
(He/Him)

subject: Have you attended a concert lately? Arts institutions are navigating challenging times.
body:
How data and analytics could help ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
The art of data
In the news
•
Symphony seating.
 Many operas culminate in tragedy, but major US orchestras are ending the latest season on a high note after audience attendance plummeted earlier last fall. In September 2022, attendance fell to about 40% of concert hall capacity from roughly 70%—a “very visible, and very scary” change, one leader said. As the 2022–23 season has progressed, however, orchestras have reported rebounding attendance. Still, sales of subscriptions remain sluggish, and audiences are also buying tickets later than before. [
NYT
]
•
Jobs lost.
 The performing arts industry in one US state shed ten years’ worth of jobs during the COVID-19 pandemic, a recent study finds. A downturn in attendance, high inflation, and increasing rents contributed to a loss of roughly 59,000 positions from 2019 to 2021, bringing employment levels down to 2010 figures. Since the arts are so closely linked to other industries, such as restaurants and parking, the contraction could cut state and local tax revenues by $4.1 billion over the course of four years, the report noted. [
LA Times
]
The lack of high-quality, up-to-date, and standardized data sets limits the perspectives that art-institution leaders can have of their organizations’ performance.
On McKinsey.com
•
The arts under pressure.
 Before the COVID-19 pandemic, art institutions were already struggling due to increasing overheads, changing audience behaviors, and funding shifts. COVID-19-related disruptions have only compounded these trends. In the US, changing consumer behaviors decreased audience ticket demand by up to 25%. While technology can help arts institutions strengthen resilience, many may lack the capabilities, processes, and infrastructure to build data and analytics tools, McKinsey senior partner 
Ben Mathews
 and colleagues explain
.
•
Measuring value. 
Historically, art institutions have struggled to measure their value, which has limited their use of standardized performance metrics. As a result, art organizations often have an imprecise understanding of audiences, short-term views on revenue and growth, and planning methods linked to unreliable funding patterns. To help leaders increase their use of technology, McKinsey collaborated with seven leading US art institutions. Review a five-step framework 
leaders in the arts can use to build data and analytics capabilities
.
See a sample data dashboard
— Edited by Belinda Yu, editor, Atlanta
Was this forwarded to you? 
Sign up here
.
Or 
send us feedback
—we’d love to hear from you.
Follow our thinking
 
This email contains information about McKinsey's research, insights, services, or events. By opening our emails or clicking on links, you agree to our use of cookies and web tracking technology. For more information on how we use and protect your information, please review our 
privacy policy
.

subject: HR rewired: An end-to-end approach to attracting and retaining top tech talent
body:
Adopt an end-to-end approach ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
Share this email
 
 
Share this email on 
LinkedIn
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Twitter
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Facebook
  
 
 
 
 
AN ARTICLE A DAY, PICKED BY OUR EDITORS
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
It’s time for organizations to adopt
 a holistic approach to HR that addresses technology professionals’ needs at all stages of their talent journey—from attraction, to onboarding, to long-term professional development. Taking this end-to-end perspective can help HR and technology leaders build a resilient technology workforce and accelerate their companies’ digital transformations. Check out a 
new article
 by McKinsey’s 
Vincent Bérubé
, 
Dana Maor
, Maria Ocampo, and 
Alex Sukharevsky
 to see why rewiring traditional HR processes can help you find and keep the tech talent you need to compete.
 
HR rewired: An end-to-end approach to attracting and retaining top tech talent
Technology companies are shedding the very talent that incumbent players need to meet their own digital objectives. Here’s what HR teams in traditional organizations can do to capitalize.
Adopt an end-to-end approach
Quote of the day
“We don’t like to talk about the struggle, because it’s uncomfortable. But that’s where the work is getting done, and we really are moving forward. It may not feel that way, but you really are moving forward.”
—Joanne Lipman, former editor in chief of USA Today, on navigating change in the way that we live, work, and lead in a recent 
Author Talks
 interview
Chart of the day
 
See today’s chart
ALSO NEW
The CEO alpha: The advantages of exceptional leadership
When private equity portfolio company CEOs perform well, the companies they lead do too, creating a “CEO alpha.” This episode of 
Deal Volume
 discusses how to cultivate great leaders for greater gains.
Shape next-gen leaders 
 
Investing in middle managers pays off—literally
New research shows that having more top-performing middle managers leads to much better financial outcomes. Here are five actions that can set managers and their organizations up for success.
﻿5 actions 
The growth imperative: Perspectives from UK marketing leaders
Alumni of the Marketing Academy EMEA Fellowship Program share their experiences in overcoming near-term obstacles to growth.
Adopt a bold mindset 
 
— Edited by Joyce Yoo
,
 editor, New York
Follow our thinking
 
Share these insights

While we're implementing those final edits and preparing for launch, I wanted to get back to you about the text color adjustment...

Subject:
 LCW Website - Final Review & Sign-Off
 
Hello Jake & Ashton - 
 
The website is ready for your final technical review and sign-off!
 
https://lcw1.wpengine.com/
user name: demo
password: staging
 
Please add any feedback to 
this document
. We will review together on our call tomorrow, Tuesday 6/27, at 2pm CT. 
 
Before reviewing the site, please see the following notes (many are regarding recent feedback):
Downloadable resources - when a user goes to a resource, the popup will come up prompting them to put in their email. Once the user inputs their email, it unlocks the blog post. Hopefully this is an acceptable compromise.
Other Solutions Slider - Pictures were originally clickable as well, but it was flagged as an accessibility issue. All links need to have discernible text (even if the image has alt text. Sorry we know this is not ideal)
We have confirmed that Poppins is being used in all titles everywhere. Some of the smaller titles are in all Caps (like on staff blocks)
"The image that’s used in the browser tabs is elongated and looks off. Can we swap that out with a transparent background version of the ribbon that doesn’t stretch? We can provide new files as needed!"
 - It might not be best idea to make the ribbon transparent, because some people have dark mode on their browser and the ribbon will have a black background, but I changed this so it's more of a badge shape and it should look a lot better now
"Can you please change the scrolling boxes to match the color of the corresponding box in the SCI graphic"
 - We can't do the exact color. Those boxes need to have a certain level of contrast in order to pass accessibility standards. So we can't make them too light.
"When an event is past it seems to say “Expired!” – is there a work around for that/what’s the options post-event for these pages?"
 - So this is how the current events work as of right now: When an event is active, there will be a button that says "Reserve your seat" that links to a hubspot form. When the event is expired, an LCW staff member will need to go into the event and add the link to the recording. Once that is done, it will show a button to watch a recording (blocked by a popup to capture their email address). Here is a test example: 
https://lcw1.wpengine.com/events/brave-conversations-with-lcw-live-lets-talk-about-why-juneteenth-matters/
 If the recording link isn't added, then the event will just say "expired!" with no button.
On the contact page, after submitting contact form, the page redirects to the bottom of the screen instead of where the success message appears - This has something to do with Hubspot forms and we can't adjust it.
Translations - We believe what we agreed upon is that we were going to get the translation plugin installed and set up, and LCW will have to go in and work on manually translating every webpage. When you click the different translation options, it won't work until the pages are actually translated. So maybe we just turn this feature off for now?
Also, please confirm that the domain is switching to 
lcwinclusion.com
. Thanks!
 
Looking forward to meeting with you tomorrow. 
 
Best,
Maura
 
 
Maura Murphy-Barrosse
Project Manager
Buddy Web Design & Development
maura@buddywdd.com
323-868-6083

subject: Branding Launch Documents & Email Ask
body:
Hi Alisa and Chuck,
 
I’ve completed and tested the instructions and talking points we will need to disseminate to the team on Monday. Would one of you be willing to send out the attached documents and message on Monday at noon? Waiting until noon will give Ashton and I time to make sure the social channels and website have been updated.
 
Sending this from your email will help reenforce it’s importance! Please feel free to review and let me know any questions/notes.
 
Thank you!! 
 
Jake
 
-------------------
 
Send time: Monday, July 3 @12pm 
 
Subject: Action Required: LCW’s New Branding Has Launched!
 
Hi team,
 
Today marks an exciting new beginning for LCW – as of today our new LCW branding has officially launched! If you visit our social media accounts or website, you’ll notice that these channels now feature our new look, embodying our renewed energy and commitment towards continuing this work for the next 20 years.
 
To help you navigate these changes, we’re attaching two documents that we ask you prioritize reviewing as soon as possible:
 
Brand Launch Timeline Instructions
There are several changes we need you to make to your own computer to ensure that you’re adopting our new visual identity
This document includes instructions on how to make 4 required updates and three optional updates to your personal device and social channels
We will make time to cover these changes in our upcoming All Staff meeting, but you can begin updating your device on your own (send questions to Jake)
Please complete the 4 required updates outlined in this document by Friday, July 14
th
 
Brand Talking Points
This document includes valuable information on how to talk about this change with your clients and ensures we all are talking about this new brand identity in the same way
You’ll also find information on the website and what this means for clients within this document
No action is needed beyond your independent review of this document
 
Additionally, the consulting team will receive information this week on how to work with the design team in prioritizing training materials for redesign (additional time will be allotted to discuss this process at our upcoming staff meeting). This process will continue through the remainder of the year with the goal that our entire library be converted to the new brand identity by 2024.
 
Thank you for your help in implementing this change – we hope you’re as excited as we are!
 
Best,
 
Alisa & Chuck
 
Jacob Pieczynski
(He/Him)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW

subject: New this month on BigMarker: Personalized ticketing, blur camera background and more
body:
Read on to learn more about this month's featured product updates and check out the accompanying product update blog post.
 
 
This month, we added several new features to optimize webinar and event hosting functionality and maximize attendee engagement on BigMarker.
View All Updates
 
What's New from BigMarker...
📬 Generate personalized tickets for each registrant and attach them to confirmation emails 
 
Send out event tickets and receipts with ease using the new custom email attachment feature. Simply configure your custom, personalized attachments and include them in your scheduled confirmation emails. 
🎛️ Blur your camera background to obscure what's behind you from view
Along with setting a virtual background of your choice, you can now blur your background as well, keeping the focus on you during your webinar or event. 
🔔 Receive real-time email notifications when questions are submitted during live and evergreen webinars 
 
Set an admin’s email address to receive notifications when a question is submitted to a webinar. 
This feature is especially useful for Evergreen Webinars that are always open but don’t have an admin or a presenter in the room at all times.
📊 Onsite check-in dataflow update to automatically push data to CRM
When onsite attendees check-in for your hybrid or in-person event, this feature enhancement updates onsite check-in status automatically in your CRM of choice. 
⏱️ Introducing more flexibility in scheduling recurring webinars
Recurring live or automated webinars are a great way to automate the scheduling of your sessions. In this enhancement, you can now set multiple different cadences to offer the same session on multiple recurring time slots. 
View All Updates
 
 
Hosting a hybrid event? Virtual event series? Not sure? We're here to help.
Click below to book a 1:1 demo with an events expert.
Talk to a BigMarker Expert
 
BigMarker, 223 W Erie Street, 4th Floor, Chicago, IL 60654, USA

subject: Don’t miss your chance to see it first!
body:
View this email in your browser.
 
SUBSCRIBE NOW
 
Please welcome to the stage, LIVE and at the CIBC Theatre for the first time ever…BETTY BOOP! That sassy-sweet champion of empowerment, that spit-curled icon of joy, that songstress of strength comes alive in 
BOOP!
, the new Broadway-bound musical-comedy extravaganza.
Tony Award®–winning director/choreographer Jerry Mitchell (Kinky Boots, La Cage aux Folles, Hairspray) brings the Queen of the Animated Screen to the theater with celebrated multiple Grammy® Award-winning composer David Foster (“I Have Nothing,” “After the Love Is Gone,” “The Prayer”), Tony Award-nominated lyricist Susan Birkenhead (Working, Jelly’s Last Jam), and Tony Award-winning bookwriter Bob Martin (The Drowsy Chaperone, The Prom).
For almost a century, Betty Boop has won hearts and inspired fans around the world with her trademark looks, voice, and style. Now, in 
BOOP!
, Betty’s dream 
of an ordinary day off from the super-celebrity in her black-and-white world leads to an extraordinary adventure of color, music, and love in New York City—one 
that reminds her and the world, “You are capable of amazing things.” 
Boop-oop-a-doop!

subject: ICYMI: Annual TICE 2023 Recap
body:
Sign up to sponsor TICE 2024 now!
View this email  in your browser
We are wrapping up our annual 
Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)
, and this year, we had record-breaking numbers!
Conferences are a great avenue to expand and strengthen your network and engage with customers face-to-face in a high-energy environment. TICE brings together leaders in learning and development (L&D) to share insights, challenge industry standards and make lasting professional connections.
We are looking forward to hosting another TICE event later this year, online Sept. 27-28, where we will connect even more industry experts, learning leaders and training vendors as we discuss the topic of building a learning strategy. If you are interested in learning more about sponsorship opportunities, visit our 
sponsorship page
. 
  
Sponsor TICE
Want to know which sponsorship opportunities are right for you?

subject: Re: LCW Website - Final Review & Sign-Off
body:
Hi Jake - 
While we're implementing those final edits and preparing for launch, I wanted to get back to you about the text color adjustment...
Did we purposefully switch the website text back to blue from gray?
After changing the text to gray, we found that it wasn't passing color contrast accessibility tests. So we had to darken the grey color quickly a bit so it would pass tests. So yes this was intentional.
Hope that makes sense and is okay with you! 
Best,
Maura
Maura Murphy-Barrosse
Project Manager
Buddy Web Design & Development
maura@buddywdd.com
323-868-6083

Subject:
 LCW Website - Final Review & Sign-Off
 
Hello Jake & Ashton - 
 
The website is ready for your final technical review and sign-off!
 
https://lcw1.wpengine.com/
user name: demo
password: staging
 
Please add any feedback to 
this document
. We will review together on our call tomorrow, Tuesday 6/27, at 2pm CT. 
 
Before reviewing the site, please see the following notes (many are regarding recent feedback):
Downloadable resources - when a user goes to a resource, the popup will come up prompting them to put in their email. Once the user inputs their email, it unlocks the blog post. Hopefully this is an acceptable compromise.
Other Solutions Slider - Pictures were originally clickable as well, but it was flagged as an accessibility issue. All links need to have discernible text (even if the image has alt text. Sorry we know this is not ideal)
We have confirmed that Poppins is being used in all titles everywhere. Some of the smaller titles are in all Caps (like on staff blocks)
"The image that’s used in the browser tabs is elongated and looks off. Can we swap that out with a transparent background version of the ribbon that doesn’t stretch? We can provide new files as needed!"
 - It might not be best idea to make the ribbon transparent, because some people have dark mode on their browser and the ribbon will have a black background, but I changed this so it's more of a badge shape and it should look a lot better now
"Can you please change the scrolling boxes to match the color of the corresponding box in the SCI graphic"
 - We can't do the exact color. Those boxes need to have a certain level of contrast in order to pass accessibility standards. So we can't make them too light.
"When an event is past it seems to say “Expired!” – is there a work around for that/what’s the options post-event for these pages?"
 - So this is how the current events work as of right now: When an event is active, there will be a button that says "Reserve your seat" that links to a hubspot form. When the event is expired, an LCW staff member will need to go into the event and add the link to the recording. Once that is done, it will show a button to watch a recording (blocked by a popup to capture their email address). Here is a test example: 
https://lcw1.wpengine.com/events/brave-conversations-with-lcw-live-lets-talk-about-why-juneteenth-matters/
 If the recording link isn't added, then the event will just say "expired!" with no button.
On the contact page, after submitting contact form, the page redirects to the bottom of the screen instead of where the success message appears - This has something to do with Hubspot forms and we can't adjust it.
Translations - We believe what we agreed upon is that we were going to get the translation plugin installed and set up, and LCW will have to go in and work on manually translating every webpage. When you click the different translation options, it won't work until the pages are actually translated. So maybe we just turn this feature off for now?
Also, please confirm that the domain is switching to 
lcwinclusion.com
. Thanks!
 
Looking forward to meeting with you tomorrow. 
 
Best,
Maura
 
 
Maura Murphy-Barrosse
Project Manager
Buddy Web Design & Development
maura@buddywdd.com
323-868-6083

subject: 🎙️ Podcast Release: AANHPI Heritage Month
body:
Maya Hu-Chan joins the podcast to deconstruct myths and microaggressions faced by the AANHPI community.
 
New Episode Release
Recording & Transcript
 
AANHPI History and Allyship
Since 1992, May has been recognized as Asian American, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander (AANHPI) Heritage Month in the United States. So how can we honor the lived experiences of this diverse community and show up as authentic allies coming out of a pandemic that increased anti-Asian hate crimes and discrimination?
 
In this episode of 
Brave Conversations with LCW
, Host 
Larry Baker
 (he/him) is joined by internationally recognized keynote speaker, best-selling author, and master-certified executive coach 
Maya Hu-Chan
 (she/her). Together, they defined allyship through deconstructing myths and microaggressions faced by the AANHPI community, today and throughout history.
 
The episode was live streamed on Monday, May 22.
Featuring:
 
 
Maya Hu-Chan
Founder and President
Global Leadership Associates
Website
You are receiving this email because you opted in to receive podcast notifications directly to your inbox. We look forward to bringing you a maximum of two podcasts per month!
 
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2023 Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC, All rights reserved.
LCW, 4753 N Broadway, Floor 2, Chicago, Illinois 60640, USA

Jacob, it's time to schedule your check-in meeting.

subject: The prevention and cure for low morale
body:
Join a July 13th webinar with Blueboard and ThinkHuman on how to drive bottom-line impact by investing in employee fulfillment. Reserve your spot today. 
 
 
Feeling the squeeze of higher expectations and lower resources? You're not alone. The solution? Taking a human-centric approach in how we empower our teams.
 
On July 13th, 2023, ThinkHuman & Blueboard are teaming up to bring you a webinar on how to take a human-centric approach to current HR challenges by providing:
 
⚡ Innovative strategies to sculpt a workplace culture that boosts productivity and morale.
⚡ Tactical insights on how to achieve more with less, developing an agile and resilient team.
⚡ The secret to securing stakeholder buy-in, ensuring your strategies take root and flourish.
 
Don't miss this opportunity to build out a roadmap to boost engagement, performance, and overall wellbeing in your organization.

subject: [WEBINAR] Human Connection and the New World of Work
body:
Unlocking the Secrets of Thriving Organizations: Join Our Webinar on Human Connection on 13 July!
 
 
Hi Jacob,
 
We might be on the other side of the pandemic, but employees are still feeling isolated and often disengaged in the workplace. This crisis of connection is threatening our people’s sense of belonging, retention, engagement, and well-being. 
 
And yet, in the midst of a tight labor market and shift in employee demographics, better opportunities for connection are exactly what organizations need to thrive. But how can you facilitate these connections across the employee lifecycle? 
 
Join Brent Pearson, Founder and CEO at Enboarder as he shares the latest industry research including how organizations can help employees feel connected to their work and how that benefits the bottom line.
 
Date: 
July 13
Time: 
2
:00pm ET / 11:00am PT
SAVE YOUR SEAT
 
Hope to see you there!
Stacey @ Enboarder

body:
Get up to speed on the latest research and intel.  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
BOOKS
COLLECTIONS
TOOLS
CASE STUDIES
HBR STORE
 
 
 
Your AI roadmap for success
 
The Artificial Intelligence (AI) revolution is well underway. Leading economists and business experts predict that AI will completely transform how we live and work. How will AI impact your industry, company, and career? Get up to speed on the latest research and intel with HBR’s 
Artificial Intelligence Library: How to Remain Competitive in an AI World
. With these resources, you’ll explore how to: 
Lay the groundwork for transformation
Incorporate AI into your business strategy
Reimagine work processes
Manage people in this brave new world
Leverage AI to be a market leader
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
 
This specially priced 7-volume set includes:
 
 
Competing in the Age of AI: Strategy and Leadership When Algorithms and Networks Run the World
 
Packed with examples, many from the most powerful and innovative global AI-driven competitors and based on research in hundreds of firms across many sectors, this is your essential guide for rethinking how your firm competes and operates in the AI era.
 
 
 
 
 
Human + Machine: Reimagining Work in the Age of AI
 
In this much-needed management playbook, you’ll discover how to become an AI-fueled business so you can leap ahead on innovation and profitability.
 
 
 
 
 
Prediction Machines: The Simple Economics of Artificial Intelligence
 
Economists explain the profound impact of AI and how CEOs, managers, policy makers, investors and entrepreneurs can navigate the changes on the horizon.
 
 
 
 
 
HBR’s 10 Must Reads on AI, Analytics, and the New Machine Age
 
Contains the most important HBR articles to help you understand how these technologies work together, how to adopt them, and why your strategy can’t ignore them.
 
 
 
 
 
All-in On AI: How Smart Companies Win Big with Artificial Intelligence
 
Written by the author of 
Competing on Analytics
 and the head of Deloitte's US AI practice, 
All-In on AI
 will give you a rare inside look at what the leading adopters are doing, while providing you with the tools to put AI at the core of everything you do.
 
 
 
 
 
Power and Prediction: The Disruptive Economics of Artificial Intelligence
 
When prediction is taken to the max, industries transform, and with such transformation comes disruption. 
Power and Prediction
 explains what’s at the root of this and how we can make the coming AI disruption work for us, not against us.
 
 
 
 
 
Artificial Intelligence: Tools for Preparing Your Team for the Future
 
Includes a step-by-step training guide, comprehensive slide deck, case studies, and thought-provoking questions to help stimulate team thinking and kick off the discussions needed to move your company forward.
 
 
 
 
Whether you’re an entrepreneur, manager, or leader, learn what it takes to successfully compete in the AI world. This specially priced 7-item digital library is a must-have for managers who need to recognize the potential impact of AI, how it is driving future growth, and how they can compete.
 
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
Discover more collections
Chart your path to management success with HBR’s curated collections.
Get instant access today. 
 
SHOP NOW
 
 
To redeem, simply enter 
HBRORGREG4
 in the Promotional Code field at checkout. Discount will be applied to your order subtotal of your first purchase only. 
*Valid online or by phone (excludes HBR magazine subscriptions, shipping & handling, taxes, and customs fees). Cannot be combined with other offers or discounts, including bulk pricing. No adjustments to prior purchases. 
Purchasers are responsible for all shipping charges, duties, taxes, brokerage fees, and/or import fees imposed by the country of import.

subject: Businesses face tumultuous times. What do leaders see as the ten biggest organizational shifts?
body:
Four ways organizations can respond ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
 
 
TODAY’S NEWS. TOMORROW’S INSIGHTS.
A daily newsletter from McKinsey & Company
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
The changing organization
In the news
•
Wanted: creative thinkers.
 A recent survey of more than 800 companies in a variety of industries and regions reveals employers’ most sought-after skills. Executives predict that 44% of employees’ skill sets may require updating by 2027. The results, published in the World Economic Forum’s 
Future of Jobs
 report, show that while tech literacy ranks among the top ten in-demand skills, soft skills such as analytical and creative thinking, self-awareness, and agility rank even higher. This reflects the need for workers to adjust to profound changes in the workplace, the report noted. [
CNBC
]
•
Happy hybrid.
 Attrition rates go down by more than a third when companies use a hybrid work model, recent research has found. However, while hybrid appeals to many workers and can reduce operating expenses for organizations, it can also make networking more difficult, especially for younger workers. To improve remote workers’ access to coaching and learning, companies may need to tweak their onboarding and mentoring programs. For instance, offering online onboarding could allow new employees to meet key stakeholders and establish feedback channels early on. [
MIT Sloan
]
“Only about half the organizations that we talked about feel prepared for the coming years when it comes to organizational transformation.”﻿
On McKinsey.com
•
A new mindset.
 The geopolitical and economic disruptions of the past few years have drastically changed how businesses operate, innovate, and recruit talent. In an episode of 
The
 
McKinsey Podcast
, McKinsey senior partners 
Dana Maor
 and
 Patrick Simon
 surveyed more than 2,500 business leaders to learn what they see as the biggest organizational changes. McKinsey’s 
State of Organizations
 report reveals ten shifts affecting companies, with managing the hybrid workplace, increasing resilience, and building capabilities coming in top of mind for executives
.
•
Strengthening resilience. 
Our research has uncovered a wide range of organizations—from smaller companies with 200 employees to larger ones with 140,000 workers, in a variety of fields—that are succeeding, despite economic uncertainty. These organizations build resilience into their processes and structures by breaking down silos, communicating clear priorities to all parts of the organization, and providing upskilling opportunities for talent at all levels. 
Understand four ways that today’s organizations can respond
 to a constantly changing business environment.
Prepare for future shocks
— Edited by Gwyn Herbein, editor, Atlanta

subject: How investing in marketing can drive long-term growth
body:
Double down on growth ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
Share this email
 
 
Share this email on 
LinkedIn
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Twitter
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Facebook
  
 
 
 
 
AN ARTICLE A DAY, PICKED BY OUR EDITORS
 
Brought to you by 
Liz Hilton Segel
, chief client officer and managing partner, global industry practices, & 
Homayoun Hatami
, managing partner, global client capabilities
Cutting back on marketing budgets
 is an all-too-common practice during times of economic uncertainty. This is a shortsighted approach, say McKinsey’s 
Julien Boudet
, 
Marc Brodherson
, 
Kelsey Robinson
, and Eli Stein. In a new 
McKinsey Quarterly
 article
, they explain how marketing can be a key driver for long-term growth and why investing in marketing is more important than ever during turbulent times. Give it a read and understand the investor approach to marketing and what CMOs can do to unlock significant value for their companies.
 
Beyond belt-tightening: How marketing can drive resiliency during uncertain times
During tough times, marketing is often the first to be trimmed, but that’s a shortsighted approach. Instead, companies can invest in marketing as a key to long-term growth.
Double down on growth  
Quote of the day
“CEOs make substantial decisions around strategy, resource allocation, M&A, and hiring and firing top talent, so making those decisions in the best way possible will have an outsize impact on the performance of the company.”
—McKinsey senior partner 
Sacha Ghai
 on the concept of “CEO alpha” in “
The CEO alpha: The advantages of exceptional leadership
”
Chart of the day
 
See today’s chart  
ALSO NEW
The role of social media and tech in Gen Z’s mental health
A McKinsey Health Institute global survey reveals that Gen Zers experience worse mental health problems than other generations. Do social media and tech harm or help?
Support mental health
 
‘Before skill set comes mindset’: FairPrice CEO on breakthrough leadership
Vipul Chawla, group CEO of Singapore’s largest supermarket chain, discusses why—and how—he prioritizes culture, purpose, and people.
Set the course  
Unleashing developer productivity with generative AI
A McKinsey study shows that software developers can complete coding tasks up to twice as fast with generative AI. Four actions can maximize productivity and minimize risks.
﻿Unlock generative AI’s potential
 
— Edited by Joyce Yoo
,
 editor, New York

subject: RE: Please respond by EOD Friday if interested - LCW Website Review
body:
You are very welcome!
 
From:
 Jake Pieczynski <j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, June 28, 2023 9:05 AM
To:
 Tamara Thorpe <t.thorpe@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Please respond by EOD Friday if interested - LCW Website Review
 
Gotcha – thanks for explaining!
 
Jake Pieczynski
(he/him/his)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW

From:

>

 Wednesday, June 28, 2023 10:03 AM
To:
 Jake Pieczynski <
j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Please respond by EOD Friday if interested - LCW Website Review
 
Thanks Jake for reviewing and responding to my feedback, Much appreciated. When we meet we can talk about #2.  And on the podcast page, I only saw the most recent podcast and fill box and moved away from the page. There was nothing that led me to scroll down, which I just did now, but didn’t previously. I’d suggest adding something like, listen to more below or something like that here:
 
Tamara
 
From:
 Jake Pieczynski <
j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, June 28, 2023 8:53 AM
To:
 Tamara Thorpe <
t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Please respond by EOD Friday if interested - LCW Website Review
 
Hi Tamara,
 
Thanks for reviewing and for your notes! We’ll take a look at your notes and consider them as we make changes after the site goes live. Here are a few quick responses to your comments:
 
The four prominent boxes do not lead to a sales page; without these boxes leading me to an action I’m not sure I understand their function. And from the UX perspective they seem misleading. I want to click and there is no where to go from there. I think each should have a corresponding landing page or at least lead to a sales/landing page.
We asked the developer about adding CTA buttons for the pop-out boxes and we’ll add those after the launch. 
There is an especially critical for our eLearnings and Microlearnings which should have a more direct sales funnel with a request to-
 Book a Demo-to  make it easier for a customer to view and purchase the product without having to go through our Biz Dev process or work with a consultant. I think we stand to sell more if we make it easier.
I like the concept but don’t know what this looks like in practice. I’d need someone to create this process and tell me what tools we’re using to make it happen.
On the Let's Talk form- eLearning are not available in the drop down menu
Digital Learning Solutions is included in the Services of Interest section
Podcast page – only one podcast; how can folks access the others? Seems another missed opportunity to engage a customer
We have all our past podcasts on this page – can you explain what you mean by only one podcast?
Menu bar – why is careers (especially now) on the main menu- doesn’t make sense if we are being customer and sales focused
I think the situation has certainly changed since the site structure was created, but we should remain ready for growth and can leverage the page to collect contractor info if that’s the direction we change to. It’s also very late in the game to make a structural change to the website layout. 
Overall I think there could be more prominent Call to Action buttons – Book a Demo-Book a Call-Meet with a Consultant- etc
Yes we’ll add the buttons mentioned above to add some opportunities for acting on calls to action on the T&L page.
 
Thank you for your time and insights!
 
Jake
 
Jake Pieczynski
(he/him/his)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW 
 
   
www
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
 
From:
 Tamara Thorpe <
t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, June 23, 2023 4:49 PM
To:
 Jake Pieczynski <
j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Please respond by EOD Friday if interested - LCW Website Review
 
Hello Jake,
 
Thanks for the opportunity. I didn’t have time to review the site in its entirety; however, I did note, what I consider a huge missed opportunity on our Training and Learning page.
 
The four prominent boxes do not lead to a sales page; without these boxes leading me to an action I’m not sure I understand their function. And from the UX perspective they seem misleading. I want to click and there is no where to go from there. I think each should have a corresponding landing page or at least lead to a sales/landing page.
There is an especially critical for our eLearnings and Microlearnings which should have a more direct sales funnel with a request to-
 Book a Demo-to  make it easier for a customer to view and purchase the product without having to go through our Biz Dev process or work with a consultant. I think we stand to sell more if we make it easier.
On the Let's Talk form- eLearning are not available in the drop down menu
Podcast page – only one podcast; how can folks access the others? Seems another missed opportunity to engage a customer
Menu bar – why is careers (especially now) on the main menu- doesn’t make sense if we are being customer and sales focused
Overall I think there could be more prominent Call to Action buttons – Book a Demo-Book a Call-Meet with a Consultant- etc
 
Hope this helps.
 
Tamara
 
 
From:
 Jake Pieczynski <
j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, June 21, 2023 1:59 PM
To:
 Tamara Thorpe <
t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Please respond by EOD Friday if interested - LCW Website Review
 
Hey Tamara,
 
Sure thing! I’ll include the instructions we sent folks below. Today was the last day we had scheduled review time for people and they were asked to send any notes by end of day. We’ll be compiling all the feedback tomorrow and sending it to the web developer. If you’re not able to review by end of day, please still feel free to provide feedback – it just may not be able to be considered before the launch.
 
Thank you!
 
Jake
 
Instructions:
 
NOTE: THIS IS NOT A MEETING; IT IS A HOLD
 
Go to this link to reach the staging site: 
https://lcw1.wpengine.com/
Use [username: demo | password: staging] to enter the staging site
Use the top navigation bar to review the website looking for notes on copy, user experience, and aesthetics
Review the pages you've been asked to focus on especially close
Record any notes you have in the tracker (attached) - please use a separate row for each piece of feedback, even if it is on the same page as a previous note 
At the end of your review block, save your notes tracker and send it back to Jake
 
A few notes:
The contents of the blog, podcast, events, careers, and downloadable resources pages may still need to be properly formatted and some of the functionality is still being tested
The site has not been fully optimized for mobile yet - please use your desktop to review
We're going to read and consider every note submitted to us, but at the end of the day we may have to reconcile conflicting notes
 
Ashton and I will be compiling the notes from the many volunteers we received and will apply consolidated feedback all at once.
 
Thank you so much for your time! We're excited for you to see the site!
 
 
Jake Pieczynski
(he/him/his)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW

 RE: Please respond by EOD Friday if interested - LCW Website Review
 
Hello Jake,
 
Sorry for the delay. Let me know if you still need me. Happy to help.
 
Tamara
 
From:
 Jake Pieczynski <
j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, June 15, 2023 12:10 PM
To:
 Tamara Thorpe <
t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Please respond by EOD Friday if interested - LCW Website Review
Importance:
 High
 
Hi Tamara,
 
I’m reaching out to you about the new LCW website. We’re on track for a June 30 launch date and are looking for volunteers to review the final site’s copy before launch. 
 
If you were to be a website reviewer, you would:
Receive a one-hour calendar block within the next week to review the website on your own using staging site login information
Be asked to provide full website feedback, but be given 2-5 specific pages to focus on
Record your feedback in a tracker
Send your feedback back to Jake at the end of your one-hour review block
 
Please reply to this email by end of day tomorrow June 16
th
 if you’d be willing to provide your feedback and can commit to this timeline!
 
Thank you for your help!
 
Jake
 
Jake Pieczynski

Hi Rebecca,
 
Thanks very much for your time and feedback. I haven’t had the chance to go through your document in detail yet, but we will add all your feedback to the tracker and consider your notes as we make a round of changes next week after the site is launched (this Friday). We’ll be sure to reach out with any questions!
 
Thank you very much!
 
Jake

Hi Jake, 
I had time today to review the Learning Journeys and the Training & Learning sections, which were quite robust. I spent about 3 hours on this. 
 
There are several places where “intercultural” is spelled with a hyphen (“Inter-cultural”). Please remove this hyphen wherever in the website it appears. 
 
Attached is my feedback. Please reach out if anything is unclear.
RP
 
 
-
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Rebecca M. Parrilla (she/her)
Director of Content & Research, LCW
 
From:
 Jake Pieczynski <
j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, June 16, 2023 5:10 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Website Review Information
 
Hi Rebecca,
 
Thank you for volunteering to review the new LCW website before it officially launches! 
 
I've schedule a block on your calendar for you to review the website. During this time, please use the instructions below to complete the review.
 
Your pages to focus on (but please review/share feedback on any page): Learning Journeys, Training & Learning, Consulting, Leader Development
 
Instructions:
 
NOTE: THIS IS NOT A MEETING; IT IS A HOLD
 
Go to this link to reach the staging site: 
https://lcw1.wpengine.com/
Use [username: demo | password: staging] to enter the staging site
Use the top navigation bar to review the website looking for notes on copy, user experience, and aesthetics
Review the pages you've been asked to focus on especially close
Record any notes you have in the tracker (attached) - please use a separate row for each piece of feedback, even if it is on the same page as a previous note 
At the end of your review block, save your notes tracker and send it back to Jake
 
A few notes:
The contents of the blog, podcast, events, careers, and downloadable resources pages may still need to be properly formatted and some of the functionality is still being tested
The site has not been fully optimized for mobile yet - please use your desktop to review
We're going to read and consider every note submitted to us, but at the end of the day we may have to reconcile conflicting notes
 
Ashton and I will be compiling the notes from the many volunteers we received and will apply consolidated feedback all at once.
 
Thank you so much for your time! We're excited for you to see the site!
 
Jake
 
Jake Pieczynski
(he/him/his)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW
